* Alla medarbetare får tillgång till samtalsstöd kring hälsa, kris, sorg, stress men även ekonomi och juridik
* Kollektivavtal, personalrabatter och friskvårdsbidrag tar du med enkelhet del av genom vår förmånsportal Elajo4U
* Bred kunskap inom bolaget med fokus på teknikutveckling
* En gemenskap och ett starkt affärsmannaskap

### **Våra värderingar**


Vår värdegrund bygger på **Engagemang**, **Utveckling**, **Öppenhet** och **Förtroende**. Vi strävar efter jämställdhet och mångfald, där alla ges lika möjligheter och olikheter uppskattas och respekteras. Hos Elajo får du möjlighet att kombinera karriär med balans i livet.

### **Om Elajo**


Elajo är en av Sveriges ledande aktörer inom el, säkerhet, mekanik och energi. Med över 800 medarbetare och verksamhet på 39 orter erbjuder vi bred kompetens och utvecklingsmöjligheter. Med lång erfarenhet, bred kompetens och stark lokal närvaro inom vårt teknikområde el & energi levererar vi tjänster inom elinstallation, service och projektering.

### **Ansökan**


Vi tar gärna emot din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Intervjuer sker löpande. Sista ansökningsdag 2025-12-28.


För ytterligare information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta:

* Andreas Eriksson, Distriktschef, på telefonnummer: 0370-374153

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

*Inför denna rekrytering har Elajo tagit ställning till rekryteringskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanbeder oss därför vänligt men bestämt kontakt med mediesäljare, rekryteringsbolag och liknande.*

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**Senior Data Engineer**


Vill du vara med och bygga upp nästa generations dataplattform på ett av Sveriges största telekombolag? Hos Telenor får du chansen att arbeta med modern teknik, affärsnära data och ett team som brinner för att skapa värde genom analys. Vi söker nu en Senior Data Engineer som vill bidra till att förvandla data till verkligt affärsvärde och samhällsnytta.


Just nu genomgår vi en omfattande Analytics Transformation där vi satsar stort på att modernisera våra dataplattformar och arbetssätt. Som Senior Data Engineer får du vara med och driva och utveckla value use cases – i en miljö där teknik och affär går hand i hand.

**Det här kommer du att få göra**  

Som Senior Data Engineer blir du en del av ett erfaret team av kollegor inom Data Engineering. Tillsammans utgör ni en viktig del av Telenors bredare Data & Analytics-organisation, där du samarbetar tätt med Data Engineers, ML Engineers, BI Developers och MarTech Developers, allt för att skapa business value. Du kommer in i ett kompetent, stöttande team som gillar att dela med sig, där du får möjlighet att växa både tekniskt och personligt.


Hos oss arbetar du i projektform och driver egna initiativ i nära samarbete med kollegor och stakeholders inom både teknik och affär. Du har ett helhetsansvar för dina lösningar, från kravställning och utveckling i datalagret till att publicera value use cases i prod-miljö. Arbetet omfattar såväl nyutveckling som vidareutveckling och förvaltning, där du spelar en nyckelroll i att säkerställa att data är strukturerad, relevant och användbar för verksamheten.


Du kommer att arbeta i både vår nuvarande datamiljö i AWS och i den nya plattform vi bygger i Google Cloud (GCP), då vi befinner oss i en pågående molnmigrering.

**Är du den vi söker?**


Vi behöver dig som är på tårna! Du har en genuin vilja att lära och utvecklas så att vi kan möta kunders ständigt föränderliga behov – idag och imorgon.


Du gillar att ta ansvar, driva saker framåt och samarbeta med både tekniska och affärsnära personer. Du är trygg i din tekniska kompetens, men också nyfiken och vill lära nytt. Du är också självgående, samarbetsinriktad och har en lösningsorienterad inställning.

**För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har:**

* Högskoleutbildning inom systemvetenskap, datateknik eller liknande
* Minst 5+ års erfarenhet av Data Engineer i Data Lake-miljö
* Gedigna kunskaper i AWS, SQL, Python, Java, Spark, Airflow, ETL/ELT
* Kunskap om datamodellering och statistics
* God kommunikationsförmåga på både svenska och engelska

**Meriterande om du har:**

* Erfarenhet av Google Cloud Platform
* Erfarenhet av Qlik Cloud
* Bakgrund inom telekombranschen

**Vårt löfte till dig**  

  

Vi är bättre tillsammans. Hos oss möts du av en familjär och inkluderande kultur, en stark gemensam värdegrund och ett ledarskap som ger dig frihet och handlingskraft. Vi tror på att ge varandra förtroende och frihet att agera och fatta beslut, samtidigt som vi är där för varandra i med- och motgångar.
  

  

Vi stöttar relationer och samhällen. Telenor är ett samhällsbärande företag och här får ditt arbete ett större syfte. Vi skapar värde för miljoner människor varje dag och har ett kundnära förhållningssätt där mänskliga relationer står i centrum.


Vi ger plats för livet. Arbeta hemifrån två dagar i veckan om du vill, så länge dina arbetsuppgifter gör det möjligt. Resten av tiden skapar vi magi tillsammans på kontoret. Ledarskap baserat på tillit och flexibla arbetstider hjälper dig att balansera jobbet och livet. Vi finns där genom livets alla faser och erbjuder trygghetspaket i form av bl.a. kollektivavtal, tjänstepension, friskvårdsbidrag och möjlighet att skräddarsy försäkringslösningar som passar just dig, för ditt behov här och nu.

  

Vi bjuder in till en spännande karriärresa. Din utveckling står i centrum och hos oss är lärande en del av kulturen. Vi avsätter 40 timmar om året för att du ska kunna fördjupa dig, utforska nya områden och växa i din roll. Genom Telenor Academy och andra lärandeinitiativ får du verktygen och friheten att forma din egen karriär. När du vill vidare väntar möjligheter i hela Norden.


**Sök till oss idag**  

Vill du ta ditt nästa steg i karriären med oss? Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! Vi träffar kandidater löpande så hör av dig redan idag.
  

  

Om du har frågor och vill veta mer är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande ledare Marta Jagebro på marta.jagebro@telenor.se Sista ansökningsdag är den 10 december 2025. Vi kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökan via mejl.

 **Bra att känna till**  

Enligt Telenors policy genomförs bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidater i alla rekryteringar.

title: Software Architect/Lead Engineer
description:
If you want to shape the foundation of next-generation in-vehicle experiences – and see your architectural decisions come alive in real machines – this could be your next step. We’re looking for a Software Architect/Lead Engineer who thrives on bridging hardware and software, guiding technical direction, and enabling teams to build world-class infotainment and operator-interface solutions.

**About us**
------------


CPAC Systems develops advanced control systems for marine and industrial applications. Since 1999, we’ve been turning complex operations into intuitive experiences. With 250 employees, a portfolio of 50 patents and more than 500,000 delivered products per year, we drive innovation in everything from electrification to intelligent automation, always working at the intersection of safety, efficiency and user experience. As part of Volvo Group, our role is to lead advanced technology development and explore the next generation of smart control systems.

**Your role**
-------------


As a Software Architect/Lead Engineer, you will shape and develop the architecture of our Android-based infotainment and operator-interface platform. You’ll work at the intersection of hardware, the Linux kernel and Android/AOSP, ensuring that all layers integrate seamlessly into a stable, scalable and high-performing system.


In this role, you will support teams across hardware development, Android platform engineering, system engineering and validation. You will help them stay aligned, make informed technical decisions and integrate their work smoothly throughout the entire development process. A key responsibility will be to guide Android OS upgrade projects and ensure that our platform remains future-proof across different machine segments.


This is a hands-on architecture role where you will influence design choices, mentor teams and turn ideas into production-ready platforms used in marine and industrial applications.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Define and maintain the overall software architecture for an advanced Android-based infotainment/operator-interface ECU
* Ensure robust integration between hardware drivers, Linux kernel, Android/AOSP frameworks and application layers
* Support technical discussions across cross-functional teams and help drive informed decision-making
* Lead architectural reviews and secure compliance with relevant industry and automotive standards
* Collaborate with system engineers, hardware teams and customers to align architecture with requirements and project goals

Guide Android OS upgrade projects (e.g., Android 12* Android 14) with a focus on compatibility, scalability and long-term maintainability
* Promote knowledge sharing and mentor developers in architectural methods, design patterns and platform understanding

**Key qualifications**
----------------------

* Proven experience as a Software Architect or Lead Engineer in embedded or automotive-adjacent systems
* Deep understanding of Android/AOSP internals and Linux kernel architecture
* Strong knowledge of hardware interfaces and communication protocols common in construction, marine and commercial vehicle applications (GMSL, Ethernet, FPD-Link)
* Proficiency in Java, Kotlin and C/C++ (Python for tooling is a plus)
* Experience working with CI/CD pipelines and system-level integration
* Hands-on experience with Android OS upgrades, platform migrations or BSP work is highly desirable
* Excellent communication skills and ability to support cross-functional collaboration and technical leadership
* Fluent in English

**Who you are**
---------------


You see complex system architecture as a field full of possibilities, and you like being hands-on. You stay updated in your area and share your knowledge with others. You enjoy end-to-end responsibility, and you’re not afraid to challenge norms and find innovative solutions. With your understanding of both hardware and software and the interplay between them, you make things happen.

**How to apply**
----------------


Submit your application today and feel free to reach out to David Andersson at *david.andersson2@cpacsystems.se* if you have any questions.

title: Automotive Platform Software Engineer - Linux/Drivers/Android
description:
If you want to work close to the hardware and help build the technical foundation for next-generation infotainment systems, this could be your next step. We’re looking for a Platform Software Engineer who enjoys deep technical problem-solving, low-level programming and making hardware and software work seamlessly together inside complex ECUs.

**About us**
------------


CPAC Systems develops advanced control systems for marine and industrial applications. Since 1999, we’ve been turning complex operations into intuitive experiences. With 250 employees, a portfolio of 50 patents and more than 500,000 delivered products per year, we drive innovation in everything from electrification to intelligent automation, always working at the intersection of safety, efficiency and user experience. As part of Volvo Group, our role is to lead advanced technology development and explore the next generation of smart control systems.

**Your role**
-------------


As a Platform Software Engineer you will focus on hardware integration and foundational software development for our Android-based infotainment ECUs. You will work hands-on with kernel components, device drivers and hardware interfaces such as GMSL, Automotive Ethernet and FPD-Link, ensuring reliable, stable and high-performing systems.


In this role, you will collaborate closely with system architects to define the hardware–software interaction layer, participate in design and code reviews, and contribute to the long-term maintainability and quality of low-level components. You will also support Android OS upgrade projects by securing driver compatibility and hardware stability across versions.


This is a role for someone who enjoys solving complex technical challenges, digging into kernel internals and building the solid foundation that the entire system depends on.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Integrate and maintain automotive infotainment hardware such as GMSL, Automotive Ethernet and FPD-Link
* Develop and maintain Linux kernel components and device drivers
* Collaborate with system architects on hardware–software interface design
* Ensure maintainability, robustness and code quality for low-level components
* Participate in design and code reviews for hardware-related modules
* Maintain technical documentation for hardware and kernel layers
* Support Android OS upgrade projects and ensure driver stability and hardware compatibility

**Key qualifications**
----------------------

* Strong experience with automotive hardware solutions and communication protocols
* Solid experience in Linux kernel development and device driver programming
* Proficiency in C/C++ (Python for tooling is a bonus)
* Good understanding of embedded systems and ECU architecture
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken

**It’s a plus if you also bring**
---------------------------------

* Familiarity with Qualcomm CPUs
* Experience supporting Android platform upgrades or adapting hardware drivers for new Android versions

**Who you are**
---------------


You enjoy working close to the hardware and are driven by understanding systems at their deepest levels. Solving complex technical problems motivates you, and you like digging into kernel behavior, driver interactions and hardware interfaces to find the root cause. You stay up to date with new tools and technologies, and you readily share your insights with others. You take ownership of your work, care about code quality and stability, and are comfortable challenging assumptions to create smarter, more robust low-level solutions. With a strong understanding of both hardware and software, you help ensure that every layer works together as a reliable and well-engineered system.

**How to apply**
----------------


Submit your application today and feel free to reach out to David Andersson at *david.andersson2@cpacsystems.se* if you have any questions regarding the job.

title: Linux/Unix Engineer – för samhällskritisk kund
description:
*Vill du ta ditt konsultande till nästa nivå hos Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare? Vi vet vad du tänker. Du har hört det förut. Men tro oss, det har du inte. Vårt körsbär på konsulttårtan är något annat. Sök jobbet och smaka själv!*


Vi söker dig som vill arbeta med stabila och säkra Linux/Unix-miljöer hos en kund med samhällskritisk verksamhet. Rollen passar dig med några års erfarenhet som vill arbeta tekniknära med fokus på drift, script, felsökning och optimering av system med höga krav på tillgänglighet.

### **Om rollen**


Som Linux/Unix-specialist blir du del av ett team som ansvarar för drift och vidareutveckling av viktiga IT-plattformar. Du arbetar med konfiguration, underhåll och förbättring av system och tjänster, och bidrar till en robust miljö där trygghet, kvalitet och säkerhet står i centrum.

### **Arbetsuppgifter**

* Drift, administration och optimering av Linux- och Unix-baserade plattformar
* Installation, konfiguration och uppdatering av system och tjänster
* Skript och automationsarbete (Bash, Python eller liknande)
* Felsökning och incidenthantering i komplexa servermiljöer
* Logghantering, övervakning och grundläggande performance-analys
* Dokumentation och medverkan i förbättringsarbete
* Stöd till teamet i frågor kring drift, stabilitet och säkerhet

### **Krav**

* **3–7 års** erfarenhet av arbete med Linux och/eller Unix i produktion
* Erfarenhet av Bash och/eller Python för enklare script och automatisering
* God förståelse för operativsystem, nätverk och serverarkitektur
* Erfarenhet av drift, uppgraderingar och systemadministration
* Gärna universitets-/högskoleutbildning inom IT

 **Meriterande**

* Erfarenhet av Unix-varianter (t.ex. AIX, Solaris, BSD)

* Erfarenhet av containerteknik (Docker, Kubernetes på grundnivå)

* Monitoring/övervakningsverktyg (t.ex. Grafana, Prometheus, ELK)

* Erfarenhet av arbete i **samhällskritiska eller säkerhetsklassade miljöer**

 **Bara det bästa åt de bästa – vår personalfilosofi**


Castra är en konsultgrupp inom IT och Management. Eller ja, en elite squad kan man säga. Vi samlar de vassaste och mest erfarna konsulterna, helt enkelt för att det är hos oss de får ut max i både kapacitet och livskvalitet. Vi är verksamma inom Systemutveckling, IT-infrastruktur, IT-styrning & Ledarskap samt IT-säkerhet.


Vi är en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, på riktigt! Det låter lite skrytsamt, men det är faktiskt inte vi som sagt det. Castra har sedan 2017 blivit certifierad av **Great Place to Work** och har de senaste två åren blivit utnämnda till **Sveriges Bästa Arbetsplats** för stora bolag. Som grädde på moset är vi även ett Gasell- och Karriärföretag.


På Castra tror vi på frihet, utveckling och gemenskap. Du som konsult styr själv vilka uppdrag du tar, när du jobbar, om du vill levla upp någon kompetens och hur och mycket lön och semester du tar ut. Att du får bygga din egen logga är bara en bonus! Trodde du det var allt? Då trodde du fel. Stöd av bra chefer, aktiviteter, kompetent och snabbfotad säljstyrka, möjlighet till delägarskap, stora möjligheter att påverka bolagets framtid och härliga kollegor – listan på vad som gör Castra till en fantastisk arbetsplats kan göras lååång. Möjligheterna bra nära oändliga. Win för alla parter, säger vi.

*Castra har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro, Jönköping och Sundsvall.*


Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss på castra.se/konsulterbjudande/

**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?**


Sök direkt via länken eller hör av dig till Charlotta Ljung på Charlotta.Ljung@castra.se eller 0728716312

title: FI Solution Sales Director
description:
**Our Purpose**
*Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.*
**Title And Summary**
 FI Solution Sales Director
   

  

**Overview**
 Mastercard has a vision to build a leadership position as the only truly multi-rail payments technology company and Europe is at the forefront in defining and executing our multi-rail strategy. Commercial payments are a large opportunity for Mastercard in the Northern Europe.
   

  

 In this role you will have an opportunity to drive Commercial revenue for Mastercard across Europe.
   

  

 The role will be driving Large Market Commercial growth for Mastercard locally and across Europe. The focus will be on the development of business opportunities with large national, regional, and global companies and partnership with issuers’ Large Market Corporate sales teams.
   

  

 The job will require consultative leadership where the individual will establish close working relationships with stakeholders throughout Mastercard as well as partner organizations to drive incremental volume, leveraging our T&E and B2B products and platforms, while meeting strategic product and sales objectives.
   

  

 Key accountabilities of the role
   

  

* Technical Sales lead for CS in the Northern Europe division
* Working as a consultative B2B expert collaborating with the local account management and business development teams and the European Commercial product team, the successful candidate will:
* Closely consult with existing issuers and local market stakeholders to drive new scalable opportunity in commercial payments.
* Establish relationships with large corporations in market to develop sales pipeline and drive demand for Mastercard Commercial products.
* Support CS BD team, issuers and Mastercard Account Managers to manage and grow corporate sales pipeline for both T&E and B2B spend.
* Form and manage strong relationships with issuer sales teams focused on Large Market corporates to partner on driving their sales pipeline for B2B and T&E volume.
* Build in-depth corporate payments insight, including understanding of value-chain players, customer pain points and payment/data flows to identify and pursue opportunities to drive Mastercard’s relevance and presence.
* Partner with European Commercial product team to accelerate sale and adoption of Commercial products to corporations.
* Create market sales plan with clear objectives, strong customer engagement and KPIs.
* Be responsible for alignment of Commercial sales strategies and pipeline management across Europe and globally, coordinating with other regional and global Commercial salespeople.
* Enhance ongoing business development relationships with the industry and corporations by organizing and participating in forums, webinars and conferences in the T&E and B2B space.
* Set Commercial and B2B sales strategy through a segmented approach


 towards banks, corporates, and partners.
   

  

* This is a sole contributor role


**All About You**
* Excellent Commercial payments experience and knowledge with 10+ years’ experience in the industry is expected.
* Track record of being a trusted advisor with a proven consultative business development approach, especially to the banking sector and large corporates
* Deep understanding of B2B payment flows, business needs and the purchase to pay process in large organisations.
* Demonstrate multi years of success introducing selling existing and emerging B2B commercial


 payments solutions.
   

  

* In- depth experience creating, executing, and managing business development strategies involving B2B payments, P2P technologies and transaction flows considered by the office of the CFO
* Proven ability to build meaningful, trusting relationships with multinational customers & C Level executives.
* Strong collaborator - able to build trusted partnerships both internally and externally.
* Track record in consistently achieving business growth targets.
* Comfortable with roles that require discretion, integrity, and agility


**Experiences And Other Requirements**
* Excellent verbal and written communications skills to articulate solutions and value propositions to senior management level stakeholders and customers.
* Outstanding ability to work collaboratively and deliver results in a highly


 cross-functional environment.
   

  

* High self-motivation and ability to work autonomously; “can do” attitude;


 strong customer and results orientation.
   

  

* Fluency in English with other languages highly preferable
* Bachelor’s degree required; MBA or other post graduate degree desirable


**Corporate Security Responsibility**
 All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
   

  

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

title: Desktop Support Engineer
description:
Join our global team of over 1,000 engineer support heroes, and work with some of the world’s leading brands, from high-street giants to energy multinationals and financial institutions.
   

  

 Not only will you be working alongside a highly experienced and dedicated project team, but you will also have an opportunity to gain exposure to the latest hardware and tools, including our own bespoke engineer software.
   

  

 Your success is our success and that’s why we will support you in reaching your full potential through ongoing training and development. We take reward and recognition seriously, each quarter we recognise service excellence globally as part of our Engineer Hero Awards.
   

  

**The role:**
* Handle Incidents and Service Requests and near desk support;
* Provide services to End Users that include the following:
* End User Devices including workstations, desktop PCs, laptop/notebook PCs, tablet PCs,
* Collaboration and Communication services and devices including smart phones, desktop phones, mobility devices, streaming media systems (video conferencing) and other End User computing Hardware devices and associated system Software;
* Network-attached devices (e.g. printers, scanners, copiers, multi-functional devices (e.g. printer/scanner/fax);
* Locally-attached devices (e.g. personal printers, projectors);
* Daily health checks to End User Devices and Network attached devices as required
* Meeting room support as required.
* Provide effective Deskside Support Services in accordance with the appropriate Performance Standards;


**About you:**
* You will have a minimum 1-3 years’ experience in Windows Desktop support.


 Experience in:
   

  

* Windows 7-10, Microsoft Active Directory, utilization of GPOs, MS Office 365, PC hardware installation and troubleshooting, Enterprise anti-virus solutions, Helpdesk ticketing systems (e.g. ServiceNow).
* Mobile device management including IOS and Android devices, Enterprise encryption solutions, Windows PC/laptop management via Active Directory.
* Proven analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills.
* The ability to multi-task, effectively determine priorities and meet SLA’s.
* Excellent communication, rapport building and internal customer service skills.


 If you are interested in the opportunity to work onsite with one of A&O IT Group’s key clients, carrying out a wide range of IT related services, meeting a wide range of technical challenges and providing an excellent experience for our customers we would love to hear from you.
   

  

 A&O IT Group
   

  

 As a successful and growing global IT services provider, A&O IT Group deliver ‘fully managed’ IT solutions and cyber security services. Combining over 50 years expertise, and boasting an extensive global network, whilst remaining privately owned, A&O IT Group is a trusted IT services partner to clients globally.
   

  

*This role is subject to a post-offer Background Verification in accordance with the local country legislation.*
 Learn more about life at A&O IT Group and our opportunities on our website
 ***IT Engineer Careers***
 page.
   

  

**NO AGENCIES**
*We encourage diversity and seek to attract individuals with unique backgrounds and perspectives. It is important that we build a team with a diverse mix of people and skills, where everyone feels welcome and able to succeed. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability or gender identity.*

title: Junior Engineer - Build Real Systems, Learn Every Day
description:
*Are you ready to turn your computer science degree into real-world impact? We’re looking for a Junior Engineer to join Henriksson Storage, a fast-growing tech-driven company modernizing the self-storage industry across Europe. You’ll work directly with our Tech Lead to develop, deploy, and maintain systems that keep our storage sites connected and our customers happy.* 




  





*It’s a hands-on role - you’ll learn fast, get broad exposure, and see your work make a visible difference.* 




  





**What You’ll Do** 




  





*Site Tech & Operations* 



* Help set up and maintain connectivity, networks, and IP cameras at our storage sites.
* Support automation of on-site systems (access control, sensors, monitoring).
* Troubleshoot and improve performance across hardware and software layers.



  





*Software & Integration* 



* Write and maintain small tools and scripts in Python.
* Work with Linux and Docker environments for running and deploying systems.
* Assist in connecting our internal and external systems via APIs.



  





*Learning & Development* 



* You’ll learn a lot on the job - from networking and cloud tools to real-world automation.
* Work side-by-side with an experienced Tech Lead who’ll help you grow into a broader engineering role.
* Gain end-to-end insight into how tech and operations work together in a scaling business.



  





**What You Bring** 




  




* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or similar.
* **Core skills** 
 : Comfortable with 
 **Linux** 
  command line, proficient in 
 **Python** 
 programming
* Curiosity about systems, networks, and real-world tech operations.
* Hands-on mindset - you like building, testing, and improving things.
* Willingness to learn new technologies as you go - most things you’ll pick up here.



  





**Why Join Henriksson Storage** 




  





 Henriksson Storage is scaling fast, bringing smart, tech-enabled self-storage to cities across Europe.
 



 We combine modern hardware, automation, and software to make storage easier and more accessible.You’ll join early, learn directly from senior engineers and founders, and grow into a key technical contributor as we expand internationally.
 



  





**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
 



  





 Questions? Drop us a line at: careers@henriksson.com

title: Software Engineer Internship
description:
**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Job Type:** 
 Internship
   

  

**Duration of Internship:** 
 2 months (Paid Internship)
   

  

 We’re looking for a
 **Software Engineer Intern** 
 with a backend focus to join our team in Stockholm. In this role, you'll get hands-on experience working across the stack, primarily building solid backend services that power our products. You’ll collaborate closely with engineers, designers, and product teammates to help bring ideas to life and deliver real features.
   

  

 If you're someone who enjoys solving meaningful problems, writing clean code, and learning within a supportive team that values trust, ownership, and growth, this internship is for you.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Help turn business and product needs into clear development tasks
* Contribute to backend systems that are scalable, secure, and reliable
* Participate in agile ceremonies like stand-ups and retrospectives
* Write clean, maintainable, and testable code
* Help troubleshoot and optimise backend performance


**What We’re Looking For**
* Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Computer Science or a related field
* Some experience in backend or fullstack development (via coursework, projects, or internships)
* Programming experience (Python preferred)
* Knowledge of unit tests and testing frameworks
* Understanding of APIs (REST, GraphQL), databases (SQL/NoSQL), and basic system design
* Willingness to learn and take initiative
* Clear communicator and team player


**What’s Offered**
* Flexible working hours (10–16 hours per week)
* Hands-on experience in developing industrial-grade web applications
* Collaboration with a talented team of engineers and developers
* Opportunities to grow technical and professional skills in a supportive environment
* Possibility to transition into a full-time position


**About IPercept**
 IPercept is delivering solutions to transform machine efficiency through its predictive AI platform for maintenance and production teams. It has quickly grown to become a leading provider of operational efficiency and predictive maintenance solutions for metalworking machines and is trusted by some of the largest manufacturing companies across Europe. IPercept enables production and maintenance teams to make fact-based decisions that increase machine availability, productivity, and product quality. IPercept is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 We look forward to seeing your application!

title: Director of Cloud
description:
As the
 **Director of Cloud** 
 you will lead the strategic development, delivery, and expansion of the organisation’s digital architecture and engineering capabilities. You will oversee a team of specialists covering
 **software development, solution architecture, cloud, cybersecurity, and enterprise architecture** 
 , ensuring clients receive best-in-class technical advisory and hands-on engineering support.
 



  





 This is a senior leadership role with full responsibility for shaping the practice, driving growth, mentoring experts, and strengthening the organisation’s digital transformation portfolio.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities**




  





**Strategic & Practice Leadership** 



* Define and execute the strategy for the Digital Engineering & Architecture practice in Sweden.
* Lead and grow a multidisciplinary team of architects, engineers, and consultants.
* Develop service offerings within digital engineering, cloud transformation, secure architecture, integration, and platform modernisation.
* Act as a senior voice in shaping the company’s digital advisory agenda.



  





**Client Engagement & Delivery** 



* Serve as a trusted advisor to senior client stakeholders across financial services and complex regulated industries.
* Lead high-impact architecture, cloud, and engineering engagements—from discovery through delivery.
* Provide expert guidance on secure design, system integration, SOA, API strategies, platform modernisation, and enterprise architecture.
* Ensure high-quality, scalable, and secure solutions aligned with client needs.



  





**Commercial & Growth** 



* Support business development activities
* Experienced in building relationships at C-suite
* Identify market opportunities and build long-term client relationships.
* Contribute to thought leadership, go-to-market positioning, and capability development.



  





 Please reach out on ryan.daly@lafosse.com or apply directly

title: Product Engineer - Stockholm
description:
**Build something monumental for Healthcare!** 




 At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.
 



 We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!
 



**About The Role** 




 You love building products that truly delight at light speed. At your previous job you often felt impatient that your team’s next wave of improvements isn’t in your users' hands already. At Tandem you’ll be using that mindset to solve the problem that today clinicians are forced to work in systems that work against them rather than with them.
 



 As a Product Engineer at Tandem you’ll be shaping and building towards our product vision, working closely with designers, other engineers and our users. Owning and shipping features end to end, from understanding the user's pain-point through shipping it to clinicians all over Europe and polishing it to delight our users. You’re deeply technical, but ultimately, you’re motivated by crafting great products that solve real problems, and you’ll roll up your sleeves and get that done.
 



 What you will do:
 


* Own Product development end-to-end by defining product requirements, setting priorities, and translating ideas into technical specifications
* Partner directly with designers, users, and other engineers to shape and deliver impactful features.
* Design and implement scalable web applications using modern front-end and back-end technologies.
* Ensure applications provide an intuitive and seamless user experience, incorporating feedback from stakeholders and end-users.
* Maintain high standards of code quality through code reviews, testing, and documentation.
* Use the best modern tools to ship great features as fast as possible.



 What You Bring
 


* A strong product mindset with the ability to define, build, and ship impactful features end-to-end.
* Proven experience building and deploying production-grade Python systems.
* Strong programming skills in TypeScript and React.
* Experience with cloud infrastructure and a focus on scalability and reliability
* A passion for technical excellence and a drive to deliver impactful solutions.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.



 Bonus Points
 


* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Experience in the healthcare industry or with health-related applications
* Experience building Large Language Model (LLM) applications.
* Experience handling streaming audio and transcription.
* Experience with Kubernetes and Azure



 Location
 



 We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.
 



 How to Apply
 



 We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.
 



 Our interview process consists of 4 stages:
 


* Screening interview with Talent Acquisition
* Technical interviews with some of our Engineers
* Interview with our CTO & Co-Founder
* Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.



**Benefits** 



* Competitive salary & company stock options
* 25 days/year of paid vacation
* 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)
* Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)
* An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare
* Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.



*We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.* 




**Culture at Tandem** 




 At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.
 



 Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.
 



 Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.
 



 We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

title: Cyber Security Manager - Cybercrime
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a Cyber Security Manager, we are looking for a experienced manager and principal leader within Cybercrime and Online Fraud prevention that can drive our delivery and services portfolio.
   

  

 You will ensure that core capabilities are in place to manage Cybercrime, Online Fraud and Loss prevention. You will grow and mature the internal and external organisation, from individual team members to our managed services partners. You will drive risk management work related to the Cybercrime area, improve the security posture to meet current and emerging threats, and proactively work with compliance to policies and regulations.
   

  

*You will be responsible for:*
* Managing the day-to-day activities of the Cybercrime team and ensuring the teams are meeting operational and performance objectives.
* Team level budgeting, planning, roadmap.
* Professional development of staff to ensure they have relevant skills and qualifications.
* Stakeholder management to ensure that the Cybercrime meets the needs of the business and complies with all relevant laws, regulations and enforcing company policies and procedures.
* Contributing to the Cyber Security strategy and ensuring their team is aligned with the strategy.
* Responding to audit findings, prioritizing remediation measures and manage the budget your team, including staff, contracts, and technology.
* Identify demands, objectives and key results and define and monitor supporting KPIs and metrics.
* Ensure the availability, stability, performance of Cybercrime and Online Fraud prevention services.
* Assess and manage risks to the effectiveness of platforms and services to protect against current and emerging threats.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 To provide a secure, trustworthy, and always available experience to our customers, we are now transforming the way we address the continuously evolving and complex cyber security threats and risks. To do this we have created a new Tech Centre focused solely on managing Cyber Security for all our brands and majority investments. Within this Cyber Security Tech Centre, we have a unit that focuses on Cyber Security Architecture & Engineering, with the mission to protect our customers, colleagues, and company by establishing and managing safe and secure technology use.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to lead our Global Cybercrime team, to drive our delivery and services portfolio for preventing cybercrime and online fraud throughout the whole H&M Group and all our brands. You will report to the Head of Cyber Security Architecture & Engineering Unit.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We believe you have several years' experience as a manager within online fraud prevention, preferably within retail or e-commerce, using driving metric-based business value and implementing modern technologies in complex organisations at scale. You have strong leadership skills with experience as staff responsible and you excel at stakeholder management collaboration across business units. You also have experience from working in an agile team with both analysts and engineers
   

  

 You also have the ability to practice creative and critical thinking by adding ideas and solutions to ongoing challenges with outstanding troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving thinking.
   

  

*We are looking for people with*
* Have a track record of successful Cybercrime, Online Fraud and Loss prevention deliveries in complex and large environments, both operations and change programs/projects.
* Have experience from designing, implementing, and deploying Cybercrime and online Fraud prevention solutions in a global enterprise environment, and driving process change and implementation activities.
* People management experience in leading online fraud teams, and metrics driven delivery in the areas of payment optimisation, policy abuse etc. optimising the team and delivery around metrics such as, approval rates, false positives, chargeback rates, fraud rates etc.
* Have working hands-on experience of cybercrime, online fraud and loss prevention, cyber forensics investigations or proactive pattern recognitions, including behavioural.
* Have a proven ability to drive and catalyst the creation, maintenance, and enforcement of policies and procedures to ensure effective provisioning, de-provisioning, and entitlements of identities and accesses.
* Have managed end to end delivery of projects around Cybercrime and online Fraud prevention.
* Have worked with online fraud prevention tools and vendors, such as Forter, Riskified or similar.
* Have a security mindset and general knowledge around security concepts to go with it.
* Have experience with at least one major cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GCP).


*And people who are*
* Are an experienced leader that understands team dynamics and personal development of staff.
* Have top-notch collaboration and communications skills.
* Holding a relevant certification is beneficial: CISSP, CISM, ACFE.
* In addition, we truly want you to be passionate and proud of your achievements, and that you share this with your colleagues.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
* All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET.
* In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*

title: Servicetekniker/produktspecialist till NI Solutions
description:
**NI Solutions söker Servicetekniker / Produktspecialist - Stockholm** 




  





 NI Solutions är i en expansiv fas och söker en servicetekniker att förstärka teamet med. NI Solutions är Nordens bästa partner för mediaproducerande och kreativa produktionsenheter. Vårt mål är att varje dag och med hjälp av våra värdeord, driv, ansvar och glädje, leverera de allra bästa lösningarna och den främsta kompetensen på marknaden.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter:** 




 Dina främsta arbetsuppgifter kommer bli att installera och reparera utrustning för storformatsproduktion. I detta ingår storformatsskrivare från välkända varumärken som Epson och HP, efterbehandlingsutrustning som skär- och fräsbord, laminatorer, rullskärare och tillhörande mjukvaror.
 



 Bland dina kunder finns allt från fineart-producenter och skyltmakare till större industriföretag och tryckerier.
 



  





 Du kommer utgå från vår kontor i Nacka Strand men hela Norden ingår i ditt arbetsområde och du får räkna med övernattningar då och då.
 



 Du kommer även stötta försäljningskanalen med demonstration av utrustning och hjälpa till med utskriftsprover samt underhåll av demomaskiner i våra showroom i Nacka Strand och Nässjö.
 



  





**Förmåner:** 




 Vi erbjuder stor frihet under ansvar och attraktiva förmåner såsom tjänstebil. Vi erbjuder dessutom stora utvecklingsmöjligheter såväl personligt som professionellt.
 



  





**Förkunskaper och personliga egenskaper:** 




 Din yrkesmässiga bakgrund tror vi är som tryckoperatör med tekniskt intresse eller från annan teknisk roll / IT. Vi fäster större vikt vid att få in rätt person än förkunskaper. Vi kommer tillhandahålla all utbildning som du behöver för tjänsten i egen regi och via våra leverantörer.
 



 Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska samt B-körkort är absolut krav. Det viktigaste av allt är ett brinnande intresse för ny teknik och en vilja att ständigt lära sig nya saker. Hos oss är kundnöjdhet vår högsta prioritet och vi vilar inte förrän produktionen rullar smidigt hos våra kunder. 
 



 På det nyrenoverade huvudkontoret i Nacka Strand finns merparten av dina kollegor men du har också kollegor i övriga Sverige och Norden. Du samarbetar nära med våra övriga säljare och tekniker.
 



 Vi kommer att trivas med dig därför att du är en driven person med nyfikenhet, serviceanda och ett mycket stort tekniskt intresse. Du är kreativ, har hög arbetsmoral och trivs bäst när du arbetar i en verksamhet under ständig utveckling.
 



  





 Du kommer att trivas med oss därför att vi är ett familjärt företag med korta beslutsvägar och mycket eget ansvar. Vi erbjuder en stimulerande arbetsmiljö med internationella kontakter med leverantörer, kunder och kollegor. Engagemang och sunt förnuft är egenskaper som vi värderar högt på NI Solutions.
 



  





 För mer information om tjänsten kontakta Kristoffer Hermansson på telefon 0708-122878 eller e-post kristoffer.hermansson@nisolutions.se. Din ansökan skickar du så snart som möjligt till jobb@nisolutions.se då urval kan ske löpande.

title: Windows Systemadministratör
description:
*Har du gedigen erfarenhet av Windows-miljöer och brinner för att arbeta med drift, förvaltning och utveckling av IT-infrastruktur? Vi söker nu Windows Systemadministratörer som vill fortsätta utvecklas inom området och bidra med sin expertis i komplexa IT-miljöer* 
 .
   

  

 Hos oss trivs du som motiveras av problemlösning, gillar att ta ansvar och har ett genuint intresse för att fördjupa dig i tekniken.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Trygga anställningsvillkor och en fast månadslön
* Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter som konsult och en långsiktig plan hos Nexer


*Dina arbetsuppgifter*
 Som
 **Windows Systemadministratör** 
 kommer du att arbeta ute hos någon av våra kunder med fokus på drift, administration och utveckling av deras IT-miljö.
   

  

**Rollen innebär bland annat att**
* Ansvara för drift, underhåll och optimering av Windows Server-miljöer
* Administrera och utveckla Active Directory, inklusive GPO:er
* Arbeta med applikationspaketering, klienthantering och distribution (ex. via SCCM/Intune)
* Automatisera och effektivisera processer med hjälp av PowerShell
* Förvalta och supportera Microsoft 365-miljöer
* Delta i projekt såsom molnmigreringar, uppgraderingar och säkerhetsförbättringar


**Vi söker dig som**
* Har flera års erfarenhet av systemadministration inom Windows-miljöer
* Har erfarenhet av: Windows Server, Active Directory, GPO:er, SCCM/Intune, PowerShell, VMware, M365 och Windows OS
* Har god förståelse för IT-drift, förvaltning och felsökning på en avancerad nivå
* Behärskar svenska obehindrat i både tal och skrift


**Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av**
* ITIL-processer
* Nätverk och säkerhet
* Cloud-tjänster (Azure, M365)


**Om dig**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är analytisk, initiativtagande och ihärdig när det gäller felsökning och problemlösning. Du har god samarbetsförmåga och trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team.
   

  

**Mer om Nexer Infrastructure**
 Nexer Infrastructure (tidigare Sigma IT Tech) startade sin verksamhet 2018 och är specialister på en sak – talanger inom drift, support och infrastruktur. Vi hjälper företag att växa och framtidssäkra sin kompetens med flexibla konsulttjänster. Våra kunder är välkända aktörer och marknadsledande inom sina respektive branscher.
   

  

 Som konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att du ska trivas, bland annat genom gemensamma aktiviteter som föreläsningar, after works och lunchträffar. Hos oss lyssnar vi alltid på dina behov och vilken riktning du vill utvecklas i.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Urval sker löpande – skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vi ser fram emot att läsa den. Har du frågor är du varmt välkommen att kontakta: pauline.ryott@nexergroup.com

title: IT Supporttekniker
description:
Vi på Iver brinner för innovationer och god laganda, vi är särskilt intresserad av dig som gillar att tänka nytt och dela med dig av dina tankar. Vi söker en
 **IT Supporttekniker** 
 som vill bidra till bättre IT-lösningar för våra kunder. Är du vår nya kollega?
   

  

****We** 
**empower** 
**our** 
**Nordic** 
**society****
 Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation. Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort. Med huvudkontor i Stockholm verkar Iver främst i Norden med en agenda att fortsätta expandera. Iver omsätter drygt 3 miljarder SEK och har cirka 1 400 anställda som arbetar på ett av våra 23 kontor i Norden.
   

  

**Din roll på Iver**
 Du arbetar som del i Ivers affärsområde Bank & Fintech med ansvar för tjänsteleverans av kritisk kundinfrastruktur. Våra kunder är ofta stora nordiska företag inom bank och finans eller myndigheter, med krav på hög nivå av informationssäkerhet och infrastruktur som kod. Vissa av dem utgör samhällskritisk verksamhet och/eller har en särskild hotbild.
   

  

 Du arbetar i vår Technical Assistance Center med ansvar för Ivers tjänsteleverans, så som infrastruktur, system- och applikationsdrift, användarnära tjänster och cybersäkerhetstjänster. Du arbetar strukturerat och är van att planera ditt arbete samt är mycket noggrann i det du gör och gillar att arbeta i team.
   

  

 Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Utförande av Service Requester: exempel är uppsättning av servrar, ändring av konfiguration samt server-, system- och kontoadministration
* Monitorering av olika system i drift
* Dokumentation
* Kundkontakt via telefon och i ärenden
* Ärendehantering


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 På Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. Vi är inkluderande och strävar efter ett genuint samarbete mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi finns här för att inspirera dig till att nå dina yrkesmässiga mål. Vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden. Hos Iver är du också en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser för att vi ska utvecklas.
   

  

 Vi på Iver ger samma löfte till våra kollegor som till våra kunder. Löftet är att alltid vara ”beside you”, ”behind you” och ”before you”. Vi kallar det för "
 **The Iver way** 
 ".
   

  

**Förmåner hos oss:**
 📄 Kollektivavtal & trygga villkor
   

  

 🏠 Hybridarbete
   

  

 💪 Friskvårdsbidrag
   

  

 👓 Terminalglasögon
   

  

 ⏳ Tidsbank – 24 h extra ledighet/år
   

  

 🩺 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension (ITP) & flexpension
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du uppfyller en majoritet av dessa krav**
* För tjänsten relevant eftergymnasial utbildning
* Ca 1-2 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom IT
* Erfarenhet av arbete på en teknisk Servicedesk eller driftavdelning eller liknande med erfarenhet av ITIL-baserade ärendehanteringssystem
* God erfarenhet av Windowsmiljöer inklusive Active Directory, AAD, Windows Server, MSSQL server och backup
* Förståelse och medvetenhet inom tekniskt och processmässigt informationssäkerhetsarbete
* Övervakning och datavisualisering med exempelvis Zabbix, Prometheus och Grafana/Kibana
* Grundläggande kunskaper inom nätverk och brandvägg
* Grundläggande Linuxkunskaper
* Du talar och skriver såväl svenska som engelska obehindrat


**Placeringsort:** 
 Iver finns på 23 orter i Norden. För denna roll ser vi att du utgår från ett av våra kontor i Solna.
   

  

**Övrig information:** 
 Vi har kunder inom alla branscher och sektorer inklusive säkerhetsklassad verksamhet, därför genomför vi bakgrundskontroller i samtliga av våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

**Sök till oss!** 
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-11-30**
 Välkommen att kontakta Maria Skoglund-Robertsson (maria.skoglund-robertsson@iver.se) vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

title: Digital Content Producer
description:
****Grow with us****
 At Ericsson, we’re changing how creative content is made and shared. As a Digital Content Producer, you’ll help us build faster, smarter, and more engaging social content—at scale. Your role will focus on blending creativity with smart tools and systems, making sure our content stands out and stays relevant in today’s digital world.
   

  

**Social-first and attention-driven**
 Do you know what stops the scroll in a crowded feed? Smart creative, delivered fast—and with purpose. We're hiring a Digital Content Producer  to rethink how our stories show up across digital & social, using systems and insights to build content that wins both clicks and hearts. This global role blends storytelling and systems thinking—driving smart automation while never losing sight of what makes content resonate. You'll be at the forefront of shaping our digital and social media presence through automated content creation, dynamic frameworks, and Generative AI technologies.
   

  

 As part of the Paid & Social Media team within Group Function Marketing, and reporting to the Global Head of Paid & Social Media, you’ll help ensure that creativity and automation fuels attention—not replaces it—and that Ericsson shows up with creative that’s as relevant as it is efficient.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**AI-Driven Creative Strategy & Innovation**
 Develop and execute automated creative workflows powered by GenAI tools.
   

  

 Explore AI-driven content personalization for social media and digital campaigns.
   

  

 Optimize creative production using machine learning and automation techniques.
   

  

 Provide thought leadership on AI trends and creative automation.
   

  

**Social Media & Content Execution**
 Creative production for engaging digital experiences.
   

  

 Manage social media content production, ensuring brand alignment and storytelling consistency.
   

  

 Leverage design and creative tools for scalable, high-quality assets.
   

  

 Work closely with internal teams to integrate AI-driven solutions into marketing workflows.
   

  

**Center of Excellence for Social Channels**
 Act as Ericsson’s Center of Excellence for digital & social media, driving innovation and consistency across platforms.
   

  

 Implement creative best practices for LinkedIn, Meta, Reddit, and emerging channels.
   

  

 Develop channel-specific creative strategies that maximize engagement, reach, and brand impact.
   

  

 Stay ahead of social media trends, algorithm shifts, and platform innovations.
   

  

 Ensure cross-platform synergies while maintaining unique storytelling approaches for each channel.
   

  

**Tool Implementation & Optimization**
 Evaluate and implement AI-powered creative tools.
   

  

 Define KPIs for creative performance and audience engagement.
   

  

 Continuously optimize automation processes for efficiency and scalability.
   

  

 Ensure ethical and compliant use of AI in content production.
   

  

**Collaboration & Leadership**
 Globally partner up and collaborate to scale creativity and content strategies.
   

  

 Train internal teams on creative tools and methodologies.
   

  

 Act as a subject matter expert, driving innovation in creative automation.
   

  

 Foster a culture of experimentation and creativity within the paid and social team and the broader organization.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
 We’re looking for someone who’s not just creative, but who
 **understands how content performs** 
 and how to make it resonate in a professional, business-oriented context.
   

  

* 7+ years of experience in social creative production and digital content production.
* Expertise in AI-driven creative tools and Generative AI applications.
* Proven experience creating high-impact video content — from concept to finished product.
* A solid understanding of platform-specific best practices (LinkedIn, YouTube, Instagram, TikTok, etc.), especially for B2B brands.
* Hands-on experience with AI-powered marketing platforms and their implementation.
* Exceptional ability to merge creativity, automation, and strategic thinking.
* A forward-thinking mindset with a passion for innovation in digital marketing.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 769346

title: Senior Specialist - Production IT Infrastructure & Security Support - Solna, Sweden
description:
Location
   

  

 Solna, SE
   

  

*Do you have a background in Production IT and strong experience in Information Security? Are you able to take regional responsibility for steering and clearly articulating Production IT business needs and direction to senior stakeholders? Then we are looking for you!*
*Join our new regional teams driving and uplifting our Production IT and Security posture across all End-to-End Supply Chain sites. Together with other regional leads, you will support Europe’s largest dairies through implementation and maintenance plans—standardising and uplifting Production IT solutions and security. You will personally own regional responsibilities for supporting, standardising and uplifting Production IT systems, aligning sites with central security initiatives and requirements.*
*In this role, you can be based at a regional head office (Stockholm, Solna) or a production site. This is a remote-first role with 50–70% travel within your region.*
**How You Will Make An Impact**
 Overall, you will be part of the cross-region “Production IT Infrastructure & Security Support Team,” taking regional responsibility for Production IT and Security across assigned sites. Using deep domain knowledge of Production IT (OT) infrastructure, networks, servers and clients, you will collaborate closely with site IT technicians, Central Infrastructure Solutions, Security Operations and the CISO to drive improvements, maintenance and security initiatives. You will also coordinate with senior stakeholders to ensure alignment and integration of standards, business continuity plans and patching requirements from an IT perspective.
   

  

 Your responsibilities will be
   

  

* Leading and engaging sites on IT security patch plans and maintenance, NIS2 requirements and actions, incident response and standardisation assistance.
* Supporting and uplifting Production IT (OT) infrastructure across sites, aligning with central security initiatives and requirements.
* Coordinating with senior stakeholders to align on standards, business continuity plans, and patching roadmaps.
* Driving continuous improvement in OT infrastructure in collaboration with central and site teams.
* Ensuring robust disaster recovery strategies and testing are in place and maintained.
* Facilitating clear communication of technical topics to non-technical stakeholders.
* Monitoring and reporting on regional security posture, risks and mitigation plans.
* Contributing to harmonised ways of working and documentation across regions


**What Will Make You Successful**
 You may have an educational background within Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering or a related field. Most importantly, you have years of professional experience in Production IT Infrastructure and Security across servers and backup, firewalls and networks, or a strong background in FMCG OT production environments in implementation and/or maintenance. You are familiar with NIS2, NIST and IEC 62443-3 standards and have experience in designing, implementing and maintaining disaster recovery strategies. Your expertise includes risk assessment and business continuity planning to ensure critical operations continue during disruptions.
   

  

 You bring excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical audiences. You are experienced in working in multicultural environments and are proficient in English written and spoken.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 You will join a new, impact-driven regional function with the mandate to uplift Production IT and Security across one of Europe’s largest dairy networks. The role offers autonomy and influence, broad stakeholder exposure and the ability to standardise and improve critical OT infrastructure at scale. You will collaborate with skilled colleagues across regions and functions, with flexibility to work remotely, on-site or from our offices as needed.
   

  

**Would you like to join us?**
 If you want to help shape the industry, then seize this exciting opportunity. Please apply as soon as possible, as we will process applications on a continuous basis. For additional information, please contact Nathan Hill at nathi@arlafoods.com.
   

  

***Shape the Future of Dairy***
*Arla is a global leader in the dairy industry, committed to producing high-quality products while championing sustainability and innovation. We're passionate about people and our planet, striving to unleash the full potential in each of us. Our goal is to make healthy dairy nutrition and good food habits accessible to all. Join us at Arla Foods and become part of a worldwide cooperative dedicated to making a significant impact on the planet and steering the dairy industry towards a sustainable future.*
*We are devoted to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered to bring their authentic selves to work. Diversity and collaboration are key to our success, propelling us to new heights in the dairy industry.*
 Ref. 103423
