title: Senior Game Product Owner
description:
*“We’re actually looking for a slot creator, someone that can make music out of mechanics, math and look & feel, someone that can feel when it's right without having to lean on data or on what others might think."*
**Location** 
 : Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid)
   

  

**Employment Type** 
 : Full-time
   

  

**Industry** 
 : iGaming / Slot Game Development
   

  

**Welcome to Thunderkick!**
 With ambitious plans for growth and expansion into a new version of the company we have several key roles to fill. Not only will we scale our business, but we will also add to it new interesting verticals.
   

  

 Enter the future of slot game development and distribution where curious and ambitious people have the best chances to shine and thrive. If you’re someone who likes turning bold ideas into real action, you will feel at home here.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a Senior Product Owner to join the vision and delivery of world-class slot games — from concept to launch and beyond.
   

  

 In this key role, you’ll oversee a team of talented mathematicians, game designers, and artists, ensuring that every title we create delivers both exceptional entertainment value and commercial success.
   

  

 You’ll be the bridge between creative ambition and strategic execution — translating ideas into structured roadmaps, setting priorities, and managing stakeholders across design, development, and commercial teams.
   

  

 Enter the future of slot game development where you can create and build games according to your own vision.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Lead and manage game development teams working on multiple concurrent slot titles.
* Define and communicate product vision, goals, and success metrics for the slot portfolio.
* Oversee the game development lifecycle — from ideation and prototyping to release and performance analysis.
* Collaborate with designers, mathematicians, engineers, and commercial teams to deliver cohesive, data-informed, and innovative games.
* Balance creative experimentation with disciplined product management, ensuring timely delivery and quality output.
* Analyse player behaviour, market trends, and KPIs to guide future roadmap decisions.


**About You**
 You’re a passionate product leader who thrives at the intersection of creativity, data, and strategy. You have a proven track record in slot or casino game production, a sharp eye for player experience, and strong people leadership skills.
   

  

**We’re looking for:**
* Experience mentoring or leading other designers or product owners.
* 5+ years in a similar role with proof of top-performing games.
* Strong understanding of slot game mechanics, player psychology, and market dynamics.


**Why Join Us?**
* Work in a team of passionate creators who value artistry, humour, and precision.
* Work in a studio that encourages innovation, experimentation, and autonomy.
* Enjoy a supportive, flexible work culture with room for experimentation and professional growth.
* A culture built on trust, collaboration, and fun.


**Recruitment process:**
 Simple, transparent, and human:
   

  

* Apply – Send us your CV/portfolio.
* Intro Call – A quick chat about you, us, and the role.
* Competence Step – Interview, case, portfolio review, or technical interview depending on the position.
* Team Fit – Meet the crew you’ll work with.
* Offer – If we’re aligned, welcome aboard.


**Life at Thunderkick**
 We offer a friendly, inspiring workplace with great people, creative energy, and lots of opportunities to explore new ideas. Our centrally located Stockholm office, minutes away from T-Centralen, gives you an easy, vibrant workspace to collaborate and create. Social events, hybrid flexibility, fika moments, and a balanced pace make Thunderkick a place where you can do your best work — and enjoy it.

title: Product Manager
description:
**An Amazing Career Opportunity for a Product Manager SW Tools!!**
**Location: Austin, Texas / Cardiff, Wales /** 
**Stockholm, Sweden / Krakow, Poland**
**Job ID: 42038**
**Who are we?**
 HID powers the trusted identities of the world’s people, places, and things, allowing people to transact safely, work productively and travel freely.
   

  

 We are a high-tech software company headquartered in Austin, TX, with over 4,500 worldwide employees. Check us out here: www.hidglobal.com and https://youtu.be/23km5H4K9Eo
   

  

**Identification Technologies (IDT):**
 IDT is creating trusted identities for IoT applications through Smart Components and Enabling Services.
   

  

 HID’s Identification Technologies powers the trusted identities of the world’s people, places and things through smart components and cloud services. We make it possible for people and organizations to transact safely, work productively, and travel freely. Our contactless identification and sensing (RFID, NFC, and BLE) components and solution enabling technologies address the dynamic requirements across multiple industries to wirelessly connect, identify, collect and manage data quickly and accurately across virtually any IoT application.
   

  

**As our** 
**Product Manager SW Tools** 
**, you’ll support HID’s success by:**
* Managing the SW Tools & SDK portfolio and developing it further
* Providing services and APIs so that the customer can manage our readers within their solutions
* Being aware of the latest changes in the market (including competitors) when it comes to device management within networks
* Maintain market and competitive awareness by analyzing market data and applying it to the product strategy, with strategies for monetization
* Coordination of go-to-market strategies for software tools with marketing communications and sales
* Close cooperation with Product Owners (PO) and Business Owners (BO) by acting as the voice of the customer
* Priority balancing between customer needs, market, business case, and internal capabilities
* Communication with various internal stakeholders, customers, the market, and partners
* Sales, Pre-Sales, Tech Support, and Professional Services teams training, and all relevant stakeholders in the context of Software Tools & SDK


**Your Experience and Background include:**
* Bachelor’s degree in engineering
* Candidates with equivalent education plus relevant work experience may also be considered
* Understanding of Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) processes
* Demonstrated ability to work across cultural, geographical, and disciplinary team boundaries
* Modern programming languages such as C, C++, Rest
* Knowledge about cloud architectures and commercial cloud service providers
* Proficient with Jira and Confluence or similar Product Management software
* Proficient in MS Office applications, such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Miro etc.
* Familiar with MS Windows, Mac OS, Linux, and mobile OS (Android, iOS)
* Compliance with all relevant HID Global policies and procedures related to Quality, Security, Safety, Business Continuity, and Environmental systems
* Up to 10% of travel and fieldwork, including international travel may be required. Therefore, employee must possess or be able to acquire a valid passport
* Ability to work flexibly to direct and support colleagues located in other time zones


**What we can offer you:**
* Competitive salary and rewards package
* Competitive benefits and annual leave offering, allowing for work-life balance
* A vibrant, welcoming & inclusive culture
* Extensive career development opportunities and resources to maximize your potential
* To be a part of a global organization that is pioneering the hardware, software and services that allow people to confidently navigate the physical and digital worlds


**Why apply?**
* Empowerment: You’ll work as part of a global team in a flexible work environment, learning and enhancing your expertise. We welcome an opportunity to meet you and learn about your unique talents, skills, and experiences. You don’t need to check all the boxes. If you have most of the skills and experience, we want you to apply
* Innovation: You embrace challenges and want to drive change. We are open to ideas, including flexible work arrangements, job sharing or part-time job seekers
* Integrity: You are results-orientated, reliable, and straightforward and value being treated accordingly. We want all our employees to be themselves, to feel appreciated and accepted


 HID is committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce that reflects the global communities we serve. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We evaluate applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. Our goal is to create a workplace that empowers everyone to thrive and be their authentic selves, fostering an environment of mutual respect and inclusivity. If you have a disability and require assistance or accommodation to participate in the application process or to perform essential job functions, please contact accommodations-ext@hidglobal.com .
   

  

 We would like to inform you that the ‘Procedure for reporting violations of the law applicable at ASSA ABLOY Opening Solutions Poland S.A company’ has been introduced. , the content of which is available at www.assaabloy.com.pl/pl under ‘Company documents’ and ‘Privacy Center’
   

  

**We make it easier for people to get where they want to go!**
 On an average day, think of how many times you tap, twist, tag, push or swipe to get access, find information, connect with others or track something. HID technology is behind billions of interactions, in more than 100 countries. We help you create a verified, trusted identity that can get you where you need to go – without having to think about it.
   

  

 When you join our HID team, you’ll also be part of the ASSA ABLOY Group, the global leader in access solutions. You’ll have 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally. As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: 2 IT-utvecklare till Svevia, BI och App/AI
description:
*Att bygga och sköta om vägar och infrastruktur är stort. Att bidra till samhällsutvecklingen är ännu större. Hos oss får du göra båda delarna och med en teknisk tvist. Nu söker vi 2 IT-utvecklare till vår stabsfunktion och IT-avdelning. En av dessa kommer dessutom vara DevLead på 50% och leda ett av våra tre utvecklingsteam. Inom Svevia kombinerar vi det lilla företagets gemenskap och lagkänsla med storföretagets stabilitet. Här får du möjlighet att utvecklas som en specialist på väg - med engagemang, samarbete och ansvar.*
*Placering på ett av Svevias många kontor med flexibilitet till hemarbete och urval kommer att ske löpande. Vi söker:*
**BI-utvecklare**
 Som BI-utvecklare kommer du att arbeta med utveckling av PowerBI och datamodellering i Svevias Dataplatform för att lösa verksamhetens behov. Du arbetar nära andra utvecklare som jobbar med integration- och datalagerutveckling samt även nära samarbete med arkitekter, produktledare och verksamheten för att skapa hållbara och skalbara lösningar.
   

  

 Verksamheten genomgår nu en digital transformation och ditt arbete kommer att underlätta för många kollegor.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen som BI-utvecklare har du ett par års erfarenhet av liknande roller; BI-utvecklare, Datalagerutvecklare, Data Engineer.
   

  

 Snowflake (eller likvärdigt), DAX, SQL och Power-BI är du helt bekväm med och har du dessutom erfarenhet i AI, integrationsutveckling, app-utveckling och API Management ses detta som meriterande.
   

  

 Du har goda erfarenheter i moderna utvecklingsverktyg samt en erfarenhet / vilja av att arbeta i organisation i transformation och där det är nära till leverans.
   

  

**App/AI utvecklare**
 Som App/Ai utvecklare utvecklar du automationsflöden, appar och AI-funktioner till en verksamhet som genomgår en digital transformation. Du ansvarar över att både kod och dokumentation är skrivna på ett bra sätt, och att det finns en långsiktighet i det som byggs, lösningarna ska hålla över tid och inte bara här och nu.
   

  

 Du är trygg i det tekniska med tyngden i C# och .net samt med Power Platform. Vidare trivs du med arbete nära en verksamhet i transformation och god kontakt med beställare.
   

  

 Du trivs i tvärfunktionella och distribuerade team, där samarbete, ansvar och engagemang leder er framåt. Tidigare har du arbetat med apputveckling och automatiserade flöden.
   

  

 Har du erfarenhet av CI/CD och molntjänster (Azure, AWS eller liknande) ses det som meriterande, likaså arbete med AI, datamodellering, rapportskapande och integrationsutveckling (Snowflake, PowerBI, API Management).
   

  

**DevLead**
 En av dessa roller kommer att vara 50% utveckling och 50% Devlead. I Devlead-rollen ingår det även säkerställa leverans från beställare i verksamheten, stöttning vid framtagande av estimat, tasknedbrytning, planering och koordinering av arbetsfördelning i teamet du leder.
   

  

 Du kommer även vara med att lösa incidenter tillsammans med övriga i teamet och Svevias Servicedesk.
   

  

 När du har ansökt kommer du att få svara på några enkla frågor kring vilken av rollerna du är mest intresserad av, samt om du har erfarenhet av att leda team.
   

  

 För båda rollerna ser vi gärna att du har en teknisk utbildning samt ett par års erfarenhet. Du är säker i det tekniska och har en förmåga att tänka helhet och har ett sinne för kvalitet och förvaltningsbarhet.
   

  

 Du har goda erfarenheter i moderna utvecklingsverktyg samt en erfarenhet / vilja av att arbeta i organisation i transformation och där det är nära till leverans.
   

  

 Du hanterar svenska i tal och skrift flytande.
   

  

 Denna roll passar dig som vill ha en bred roll i tryggt och stabilt företag, där du kommer att få kombinera teknik och ansvar.
   

  

**Varför Svevia?**
 Utifrån Svevias strategier, mål och värdegrund får du de förutsättningar som krävs för att göra skillnad och bidra till företagets utveckling. Beslutsvägarna är korta, det är lätt att påverka och göra sin röst hörd. Och hos oss står ledarskapet i fokus vilket gör att du kontinuerligt får möjlighet att utvecklas i din roll.
   

  

 Vi månar om att vara en arbetsplats för alla. Att du ska leda genom dina medarbetare ser vi som en självklarhet. Det är som lag vi skapar framgång. Det är så vi gör affärer och genererar resultat. Det är så vi får stad och land att fungera. Vill du dela väg med oss?
   

  

**Ansökan och information**
 Du ansöker enkelt genom att skicka in ditt CV och svara på några urvalsfrågor. Vår rekryteringsprocess bygger på ett kompetensbaserat arbetssätt, det är en förutsättning för att rekrytera kvalitetssäkert, inkluderande och fördomsfritt. Därför vill vi inte ha ett personligt brev.
   

  

 Rekryteringsprocessen omfattar tester av personlighet- och problemlösningsförmåga, intervjuer, referenstagning och bakgrundskontroll.
   

  

 Skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt och som senast den 7 december. Urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Fredrik Kestran på fredrik.kestran@svevia.se
   

  

 För frågor angående processen kan du även kontakta Talent Acquisition Partner, Marcus Rosenblom på marcus.rosenblom@svevia.se
   

  

 Vi har tagit ställning till annonsering, vilket gör att vi inte önskar säljsamtal för ytterligare frågor kring annonsering, rekrytering eller bemanning.

title: Video & Audio Manager
description:
**Company Description**
*Publicis Groupe is one of the largest communications groups in the world. We are building the agency model of the future and take a holistic approach to our clients’ challenges. By fusing together our media, creative, data and technology expertise, we are able to provide clients with integrated solutions, transformative ideas and compelling consumer experiences. We call it the Power of One.
   

  

 We are proud winner of many awards and nominations, both in Sweden and internationally. But nothing makes us prouder than to work with clients and brands such as P&G, Disney, H&M, Mondelez, Volvo, VISA, Lantmännen, LEGO, Spotify, Perrigo, Renault and many more.
   

  

 At Publicis, we put our people first. We are proud to be certified by Great Place to Work (2022, 2023, 2024, 2025) and have won the Diversity Charter Sweden Awards in the category Mental Health (2025). We have also been recognized with a Magnet Award for our engaging culture (2023). Our goal is to become the leading workplace in our industry. We are based in a fantastic office in Odenplan and offer a flexible work policy.*
**Overview**
 Are you ready to lead innovative campaigns that shape how audiences experience video and audio across every screen and speaker? At
 **Publicis Groupe** 
 , we believe in creativity, collaboration, and courage—and we’re looking for a
 **Video & Audio Manager** 
 who shares that mindset.
   

  

 In this role, you will lead the development and hands-on execution of video and audio strategies and campaigns for our clients, across both traditional and digital environments such as YouTube, BVOD, podcasts, linear TV, and streaming platforms. You’ll be responsible for building effective, data-driven campaigns that reach the right audiences through the right channels.
   

  

 As Video & Audio Manager, you’ll act as a thought leader in holistic planning, maintaining day-to-day client contact and consistently building campaigns that drive business results. You’ll create comprehensive media strategies, lead negotiations, plan and buy media, optimise performance, analyse results, and manage campaigns across all video and audio platforms.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 We believe you are genuinely curious about media and passionate about exploring new solutions and emerging platforms, combined with an analytical mindset that helps you turn insights into action. You value collaboration and have a collective mindset, able to identify opportunities and solutions. You bring a strong understanding of technology and marketing on digital platforms and enjoy working both strategically and operationally in a fast-paced environment.
   

  

**Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To**
* Strategic Leadership: Develop and lead strategic plans for video and audio, ensuring alignment with broader cross-channel tactics and overall marketing objectives.
* Campaign Management: Oversee and execute advanced campaign set-up, targeting, and budgeting, while ensuring adherence to best practices.
* Data Analysis & Insight Generation: Conduct in-depth analysis of campaign data to generate actionable insights and prepare comprehensive performance reports for client presentations and internal reviews.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with other channel specialists and client managers to ensure cohesive and integrated campaign strategies that drive overall success.
* Reach & Frequency Planning: Drive reach and frequency planning across linear TV, BVOD, OLV, and digital audio formats.
* Platform Execution: Collaborate with Programmatic Specialists to ensure optimal platform execution and performance.
* Holistic Strategy: Champion holistic video and audio strategies that maximise effective reach across fragmented audiences.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or other relevant post-secondary education.
* 3-5+ years of work experience in digital marketing or a relevant field.
* Knowledge of applicable buying and measurement platforms relevant to online video channels (e.g. DV360, Google Ads, Google Analytics, Audience Report).
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to generate actionable insights.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (excels in Excel); experience building simple reporting dashboards is a plus.
* Meticulous attention to detail to ensure accuracy in campaign set-up and reporting.
* Effective communication skills for internal collaboration and client support.
* Verbal and written proficiency in English and Swedish.
* Ability to contribute to product development and internal thought leadership initiatives.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines.


**Additional Information**
 In addition to a welcoming culture and inclusive environment with passionate colleagues we offer you:
   

  

**Career Opportunities**
 Local and Global opportunities through the Power Of One.
   

  

**Personal and Professional Learning**
 Global AI learning platform where you can participate in +30 000 classes and connect with colleagues from all over the world.
   

  

**Flexible Ways of Working**
 We want to be an employer where work life balance is cherished. We love to spend time with our colleagues at the office but also believe in the output of your work not where the work is being done.
   

  

**Work Your World**
 For six weeks a year, the world is yours. Every employee can work anywhere on the planet where there's a Publicis office. A new city, a favorite locale, or even a different country - Go. Grow. Explore.
   

  

**Mental Health**
 The happiness and health of our people is paramount to us. We work continuously on maintaining a healthy and safe working environment through initiatives that facilitate the well-being of our employees.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Generous benefit package.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Manager, Enterprise Applications Operations
description:
**FULL-TIME JOB VACANCY** 




**Manager, Enterprise Applications Operations** 




**Enterprise Applications Division** 




**Multiple Locations Considered** 




**Application Date: December 16, 2025** 




  





 The Enterprise Applications Division of Human Rights Watch (HRW) is seeking a highly organized
 **Manager, Enterprise Applications Operations** 
 to oversee the day-to-day activities of the three technical teams that support the Enterprise Applications division within Human Rights Watch:
 **Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Team, Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Team, and the Integration Team.** 




  





 This individual will be responsible for coordinating, tracking, and optimizing the technical tasks related to maintaining and enhancing the core system. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of strong technical project management skills, and the ability to drive efficient cross-team execution of complex technical deliverables. This position reports to CRM Director, Information Technology based in San Francisco. This position may be based in the following locations where HRW has an office: New York, Washington, Stockholm, Miami, London, Brussels, Amsterdam, Berlin, Nairobi, Stockholm, Sao Paulo or Johannesburg. This position is fully remote and will have the option to work as desired from an HRW office.
 



  





**Responsibilities:**



1. **Coordinate Technical Operations Across Teams:** 
 Act as the primary technical lead between the ERP, CRM, and Integration teams, ensuring effective collaboration and execution of tasks related to Salesforce, ERP systems, and integrations, within the framework of HRW’s SDLC processes.


* **Cross-Functional Requirements Validation** 
 : Collaborate with stakeholders from the ERP, CRM, and Integration teams to ensure technical requirements are well-defined and achievable. Ensure that all technical solutions align with HRW’s goals and SDLC standards.


1. **Salesforce Administration & Customization** 
 : Oversee the technical configuration and customization of HRW’s Salesforce platform, including managing data models, automation (Salesforce Flow, Process Builder), custom development (Apex, Visualforce, Lightning components), and ensuring alignment with HRW’s operational needs.
2. **Release & Team Management:**


* **Architectural Integrity:** 
 Maintain consistency and quality across competing pressures, such as projects with varying priorities, timelines, and technologies.
* **Project Planning and Tracking** 
 : Develop and track detailed project plans that outline technical milestones, deadlines, and dependencies between teams. Ensure all technical deliverables are met on time and to specification.
* **SDLC Oversight for Enterprise Applications** 
 : Manage the full SDLC process for technical activities related to enterprise applications. This includes overseeing planning, design, development, testing, deployment, and post-production support for all Salesforce-related tasks, system integrations, and custom solutions.
* **Change Management & Release Control** 
 : Ensure that all changes, configurations, and customizations within Salesforce and other enterprise applications are properly documented, reviewed, and deployed following formal change management processes, aligned with SDLC methodologies.
* **Quality Assurance & Testing** 
 : Oversee the QA process for Salesforce-related configurations, integrations, and custom development. Ensure that testing protocols are followed to verify that all applications meet functional, security, and performance standards before deployment.
* **Post-Deployment Monitoring & Optimization** 
 : Monitor the performance of enterprise applications post-deployment, ensuring that any issues are promptly addressed. Work with the relevant teams to optimize the Salesforce platform and other systems for efficiency, reliability, and security
* **Data Security & Compliance** 
 : Ensure that HRW’s Salesforce platform and other enterprise systems comply with data privacy and security regulations, particularly in the handling of sensitive human rights data. Implement best practices for data protection across all integrated systems.
* **Documentation & Reporting** 
 : Maintain thorough technical documentation for all system changes, configurations, integrations, and customizations. Provide clear, concise reports on project milestones, technical risks, and resolutions to HRW leadership.
* **Manage Data Models and Data Flow** 
 : Ensure that the ERP, CRM, and Integration teams adhere to best practices for data management, including designing data models, ensuring data integrity, and facilitating data migration where applicable.
* **Technical Issue (Ticket) Resolution** 
 : Act as the point of escalation for any technical challenges or roadblocks that arise during system builds or integrations. Work with the ERP, CRM, and Integration teams to resolve issues efficiently and ensure minimal disruption to project timelines.
* **System Integration Management** 
 : Oversee the technical integration efforts between core and third-party applications, and other internal tools. Ensure data flows smoothly and accurately across platforms, and troubleshoot integration challenges as needed.
* **Technical Documentation & Reporting** 
 : Maintain detailed technical documentation for configurations, system enhancements, and integrations. Provide clear reports on system changes, deployment statuses, and project milestones.
* **Optimize Workflow Automation** 
 : Work with the CRM Team to implement and manage automation solutions such as workflow rules, process builder, and Salesforce Flow to streamline business processes across the ERP and CRM systems.
* **Performance Monitoring** 
 : Oversee the monitoring and analysis of system performance across Salesforce, ERP, and integration points. Ensure optimal performance and stability by identifying potential issues and working with the teams to address them.
* **Training and Knowledge Transfer** 
 : Assist in developing technical training materials for internal teams and end-users. Provide guidance on technical best practices for the CRM, ERP, and Integration teams.



  





**Qualifications:**




  





**Education:** 
 A bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience is required.
 



 The following certifications, or work experience demonstrating the relevant competency, are required: Salesforce Administrator Certification; Platform Developer I Certification; Netsuite Suite Foundation; Non-Profit Cloud or NPSP Certification; Marketing Cloud Administrator Certification; and Platform App Builder Certification.
 



 The following certifications, or work experience demonstrating the relevant competency, are preferred: Salesforce Advanced Administrator Certification; Netsuite Administrator; Dell Boomi Associate Developer; Platform Developer II Certification; Business Analyst Certification; and Engaging Networks experience.
 



  





**Experience:** 
 A minimum of five years of relevant experience is required
 



  





**Related Skills and Knowledge:** 



1. Strong organizational and time-management skills, showing an ability to work under pressure and multi-task, consistently deliver on established schedules, guidelines, protocols, and deadlines.
2. Ability to translate business needs, requirements, and solutions into technical language and to document that information using existing templates in order to capture functional requirements for design and development.
3. Strong knowledge of
 **system architecture, data modeling** 
 , and
 **data flow management** 
 ,
 **APIs** 
 , Dell Boomi
 **.**
4. Experience in executing and maintaining best practices in SDLC frameworks,
 **Project Management tools** 
 (Asana) and methodologies (Agile, Waterfall).
5. Proven track record of successfully managing technical teams and driving complex system integrations.


* Experience working with teams domestically & internationally that demonstrates effective interpersonal skills that led to productive relationships with a diverse population of colleagues.
* Experience managing off shore teams is required.


1. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to convey complex technical information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


* Demonstrated ability to communicate data and Data management systems to both technical and non-technical audiences.


1. Strong attention to detail and organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple technical initiatives simultaneously.



  





**Technical Applications:** 



* Salesforce: NPSP – currently reviewing Non-Profit Cloud
* Salesforce: Marketing Cloud
* Engaging Networks
* Dell Boomi
* NetSuite
* Concur
* Ultipro



  





**Preferred Skills:** 



* Dev Ops level understanding of Salesforce structure and data in order to perform basic admin tasks including, user management, data management, security management, enhancement requests (design, document, build, test, deploy) and production ticket support.
* Familiarity with
 **DevOps** 
 practices and tools for Salesforce preferred.



  





**Salary and Benefits:**
 HRW seeks exceptional applicants and offers competitive compensation and employer-paid benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance. HRW offers a relocation assistance package and will assist employees in obtaining necessary work authorization, if required; citizens of all nationalities are encouraged to apply. The salary range for this position if based in the US is USD 80,000 – 88,000 plus benefits. Salary ranges outside of the US vary based on location, and you will receive specific salary ranges based on your location early during the recruitment process.
 



  





**How to Apply:**
 Please apply
 **December 16, 2025** 
 by visiting our online job portal at
 
 careers.hrw.org
 
 and attaching a cover letter and resume, preferably in PDF format. No calls or email inquiries, please. Only complete applications will be reviewed, and only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Digital Sales Enablement Projects Lead
description:
As a
 **Digital Sales Enablement Projects Lead** 
 you will play a pivotal role in accelerating
 **Camfil** 
 ’s digital transformation journey across the EMEA region. You will work closely with local country teams to plan, implement, and optimize digital initiatives that enhance customer engagement, sales efficiency, and business performance.
 



 Your focus will be on enabling adoption and value creation from new digital tools and processes — spanning marketing automation, CRM workflows, customer journey improvements, and eCommerce platform developments.
 



 You will act as the bridge between business stakeholders, digital solution owners, and technical teams to ensure smooth implementation, alignment with local needs, and measurable impact on sales and customer experience.
 



  





 You will travel regularly (20-25%) to our EMEA locations to support local stakeholders in their digital transformation journey.
 



  





**What you will do:** 



* Manage and coordinate digital sales enablement projects across EMEA markets from concept to launch.
* Translate global digital strategies into local implementation plans and measurable outcomes.
* Ensure project timelines and quality standards are met.
* Facilitate cross-functional collaboration between marketing, sales, IT, and customer service teams.
* Support local markets in adopting and optimizing new digital tools and workflows, such as CRM enhancements and lead management workflows; marketing automation campaigns; eCommerce feature rollouts; sales enablement dashboards and analytics.
* Identify opportunities to improve efficiency and user adoption across platforms.
* Act as a change champion, promoting best practices in digital sales processes.
* Develop training materials, onboarding sessions, and communication plans to support adoption.
* Gather and share success stories, use cases, and lessons learned across countries.
* Serve as the main contact point between the central digital transformation team and local market teams; work with vendors and internal technical partners to ensure smooth system integration.
* Report project progress, risks, and performance metrics to senior management.



  





**What you will bring to this role:** 



* Proven experience in digital project management, digital sales enablement, or marketing operations — ideally in a multinational B2B environment.
* Strong understanding of CRM systems (preferably Microsoft Dynamics), marketing automation (e.g. Click Dimensions or Microsoft Customer InsightsJourneys), and eCommerce platforms.
* Experience leading cross-functional projects involving multiple countries or business units.
* Experience in change management and training facilitation; proven track record of driving adoption and measurable results through digital initiatives.
* Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and presentation skills.
* Strategic mindset paired with strong business acumen and understanding of the sales and marketing funnel.
* Analytical thinker with a data-driven approach to problem solving.
* Collaborative, culturally aware, and comfortable working in a matrix organization.
* Fluent in English (additional European languages are a plus).



  





 Does this sound like you? Let us know by sending in your application!
 



  





***About Camfil***




**Camfil** 
 is a leading company in the industrial sector with a global presence. The company group consists of 41 companies in 30+ countries with 30 factories worldwide. Headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, worldwide Camfil has 6000 employees. We prioritize a decentralized steering model with a trend towards a more structured and integrated model to manage our growth effectively.
 



  





**Camfil Group** 
 , has a foundation of high entrepreneurial culture with a down-to-earth leadership style. Our organization values experience, effectiveness, common sense, and mutual respect. We prioritize inclusivity, diversity and a supportive work environment where humor and interpersonal support make challenging tasks easier. You can read more about
 **Camfil** 
 at: www.camfil.com.
 



  





*\*Please note that as we don´t provide visa sponsorship for this opportunity, in order to be considered for this position you need to have the right to work in the country where this role is based.*

title: Staff Software Engineer
description:
**The Company**
 PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.
   

  

 We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.
   

  

 We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.
   

  

 Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 Come join the PayPal Wallet Mobile Engineering team. We’re embarking on a multi-year journey to revamp wallet functionality adding valuable new features that will impact PayPal’s 350 plus million users. You will be contributing to the foundation of PayPal’s wallet for years to come guiding the team on design and architecture and contributing to the implementation that powers that functionality. Collaborating with product owners, architects, and developers of downstream systems, you will set the technical direction of the mobile wallet functionality. Your contributions will help ensure PayPal is the preferred choice for digital payments.
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Essential Responsibilities:**
* Acts as a project or system leader, coordinating the activities of other engineers on the project or within the system
* Determines the technical tasks that other engineers will follow
* Actions result in the achievement of customer, operational, program or service objectives
* Proactively improves existing structures & processes
* Exercises judgement in reconciling diverse and competing priorities (time, quality, complexity risk) to identify optimal solutions to problems
* Notices patterns and condenses repetition into densely meaningful generalized solutions
* Collaborates with management to set/improve standards for engineering rigor
* Trusted to represent PayPal, Inc to the outside world via interactions with partners, customers, or industry organizations


**Expected Qualifications:**
* 5+ years relevant experience and a Bachelor’s degree OR Any equivalent combination of education and experience.


**Additional Responsibilities And Preferred Qualifications**
 We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Staff Engineer with an in-depth understanding of iOS architecture, to join our dynamic fintech engineering team. Your expertise will drive the development of innovative features, ensuring high performance, scalability, and security in our iOS applications.
   

  

 As a Staff Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and implementing crucial features, shaping the iOS architecture that underpins our digital payment solutions. This position requires a strong technical background, excellent problem-solving skills, and a passion for staying at the forefront of mobile technology.
   

  

**Your day-to-day:**
**As an iOS Software Engineer, you will:**
* Be a strategic thinker and problem solver.
* Define and execute the mobile technology roadmap.
* Build and lead high-performing mobile engineering teams.
* Drive innovation and experimentation in mobile development.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver world-class mobile experiences.
* Mentor and coach senior engineers and foster a culture of innovation and experimentation.
* Partner effectively with product and engineering leadership to oversee mobile architecture and design.


**What you need to bring:**
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field.
* 8+ years of hands-on mobile development experience (iOS).
* Experience in designing, developing and delivering software and/or platforms (libraries)
* Deep expertise in mobile technologies and architecture.
* Solid understanding of Cocoa Frameworks
* Strong object-oriented skills including design, coding and testing patterns.
* Familiarity with database technologies (SQL and NoSQL databases) and ORM frameworks (Hibernate, JPA).
* Ability to design scalable, reliable, and maintainable software systems.
* Thorough understanding of XCode
* Proven ability to lead and influence cross-functional teams.


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience with mobile payment technologies and integrations
* Proficiency in Swift, Objective-C, or React Native.
* Familiarity with continuous integration (Jenkins), application monitoring (Crashlytics and fabric.io), mocking tools (Appium and Apiary), build tool development and enhancements, using unit testing and cucumber tests for functional tests
* Familiar and comfortable with iOS technologies, the tradeoffs, and emerging design patterns.
* Knowledge of mobile performance optimization techniques.
* Strong ability to influence and inspire teams.


 PayPal does not charge candidates any fees for courses, applications, resume reviews, interviews, background checks, or onboarding. Any such request is a red flag and likely part of a scam. To learn more about how to identify and avoid recruitment fraud please visit https://careers.pypl.com/contact-us.
   

  

 For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.
   

  

**Our Benefits:**
 At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset-you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.
   

  

 We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com
   

  

**Who We Are:**
 To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx
   

  

**Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.
   

  

**Belonging at PayPal:**
 Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.
   

  

 Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.
   

  

 We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.
   

  

 REQ ID R0132783

title: QA-testare - Process- och kvalitetsdrivande roll (Utbetalningsområdet)
description:
Vill du bidra till att våra utbetalningssystem håller hög kvalitet och utvecklas på ett hållbart sätt? Som QA-testare arbetar du nära kollegor och samarbetspartners för att planera, genomföra och förbättra testprocesser som gör verklig skillnad.
   

  

 Tillsammans får vi Sverige i arbete. Vill du bli en av oss?
   

  

**Enhetens uppdrag**
 Vi ansvarar för att utveckla och förvalta de IT-lösningar som är avgörande för myndighetens arbete inom inköp, redovisning, ekonomi, utbetalningar och dokumenthantering.
   

  

 Vårt uppdrag är att skapa effektiva och säkra digitala lösningar som underlättar arbetet för hela organisationen. Genom att förbättra och effektivisera processer bidrar vi till ökad intern produktivitet och ett mer hållbart arbetssätt.
   

  

 Vi arbetar i nära samverkan med andra delar av myndigheten för att säkerställa att våra lösningar inte bara möter dagens behov utan även rustar organisationen för framtiden.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Arbetsförmedlingen utvecklar och underhåller egenbyggda system för utbetalningar. För att säkerställa leveranser med hög kvalitet, stabilitet och korrekthet söker vi en erfaren QA testare
   

  

 Du har nyckelroll och ansvarar tillsammans kollegor:
   

  

* övergripande testarbete - är med från behov och kravställning till uppföljning och leverans
* planera och genomföra testaktiviteter i varje iteration
* stötta i arbetet att öka testomfattning och effektivitet
* driva kontinuerliga förbättringar av testprocesser


 Du arbetar i nära dialog med andra produkter, intressenter och samarbetspartners inom och utanför myndigheten.
   

  

**Vårt erbjudande**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid som kan komma att inledas med sex månaders provanställning. Placeringsort är Arbetsförmedlingens huvudkontor i
 **Solna** 
 .
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig möjligheten att arbeta på en arbetsplats där vi värdesätter balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Du får tillgång till ett generöst semesteravtal, flexibla arbetstider samt möjlighet att arbeta på distans.
   

  

 Mer om att jobba hos oss
   

  

**Grundläggande krav för tjänsten**
* Relevant högskoleutbildning inom systemutveckling eller motsvarande YH-utbildning
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av testarbete
* God kännedom om testmetodik - inklusive manuell testning, automatisering, regression, integration och prestandatestning.
* Förmåga att skriva tydliga testfall och testplaner - med koppling till verksamhetskrav.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med testverktyg, ex SQL, Swagger & JMS Toolbox
* Goda kunskaper i svenska, såväl tal som skrift


**Övriga meriter för tjänsten**
* Erfarenhet av arbete med komplexa affärsflöden - särskilt inom utbetalningar, ekonomi, eller liknande kritiska system.
* Erfarenhet av att arbete med egenbyggda system - med fokus på stabilitet, säkerhet och korrekthet.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med mätvärden och visualisering av kvalitet (t.ex. dashboards, trendanalys).
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av modeller, ramverk och processer inom IT-verksamhet, såsom produktstyrning, agila metoder och ITIL.


 Den statliga värdegrunden guidar oss i vårt dagliga arbete. Som anställd hos oss förväntas du arbeta rättvist, opartiskt och med hög integritet, samt bidra till att upprätthålla och stärka förtroendet för vår myndighet.
   

  

 Mer om statliga värdegrunden
   

  

 Utöver dessa kvalifikationer har du personlig förmåga och fallenhet att arbeta i enlighet med Arbetsförmedlingens medarbetarskap:
   

  

 Medarbetare på Arbetsförmedlingen:
   

  

* Tar ansvar för sina arbetsprestationer och sitt bidrag till helheten
* Anpassar sig till förändring och oförutsedda händelser
* Tar initiativ till utveckling och bidrar till förbättring


**Ansökan**
 Låter det här som en tjänst för dig? Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-12-10.
   

  

 Bifoga ditt CV där du specificerar årtal, månad och arbetsuppgifter för varje anställning, samt intyg som styrker kraven om utbildning och/eller arbetslivserfarenhet i din ansökan.
   

  

 Det är viktigt att du besvarar urvalsfrågorna detaljerat och sanningsenligt, för att vi ska få en tydlig bild av din erfarenhet. Om efterfrågad information inte framgår riskerar du bli bortsållad i urvalet. Du behöver inte skicka in ett personligt brev.
   

  

 Under rekryteringsprocessen kan urvalstester förekomma. Vi kommer att hålla dig informerad genom hela rekryteringsprocessen. Mer om vår rekryteringsprocess.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter kontaktar du den rekryteringspartner som finns namngiven i annonsen så får du hjälp med att skicka in din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en myndighet fri från diskriminering. Det är viktigt för oss att all kompetens tas tillvara och vi välkomnar alla sökande. Vi ser positivt på om du har kunskaper i något av våra nationella minoritetsspråk.
   

  

**Välkommen till jobbet som får Sverige i arbete! Här arbetar du på regeringens uppdrag för en arbetsmarknad som hjälper människor framåt. Vi frigör möjligheter så att arbetssökande hittar sysselsättning och arbetsgivare sin nästa medarbetare. För att nå målet behöver vi samarbeta, i myndigheten men också med olika externa aktörer i hela landet. Tillsammans driver vi förändring, utvecklar nya arbetssätt och skapar lösningar som gör att Sverige kan fortsätta framåt.**
 Mer om vår organisation och vårt uppdrag.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Solna | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: Af-2025/0104 7714 | Kontakt: Sam Jensen, Rekryteringspartner sam.jensen@arbetsformedlingen.se, Anna Kviberg, Sektionschef anna.kviberg@arbetsformedlingen.se, | Facklig företrädare: Andreas Deniz, SACO-s 0104862198, Per Olov Olsson & Tobias Person, Seko 0771508508,0104880131, Per Samuelsson, ST 0104869234, | Publicerat: 2025-11-26 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-10

title: Product Manager
description:
***Product Manager***




  





 Applications are considered on a rolling basis
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Oslo
 



  





**Shape the future of HR with AI-augmented product work** 




  





 At Simployer, we simplify work-life for thousands of companies across the Nordics by delivering HR and people solutions that actually get used. We are now hiring Product Managers who wants to evolve how product management is done—combining strong product sense with modern AI fluency to deliver value faster and with greater precision.
 



  





**This is not a traditional “ticket-moving” PM role.** 




 You will own outcomes, shape strategy, and lead your product area.
 



  





 This is a role for someone who enjoys owning outcomes, not just backlogs. You’re curious, structured, and motivated by solving real problems for real users. Whether you come from Product, Operations, Customer Success, or Engineering, if you care about building useful products and are keen to work with modern tools (including AI), we want to talk to you.
 



  





**Why this role?** 




 As a Product Manager at Simployer you will:
 


* **Shape how HR is practiced** 
 through the products you own. Your work directly affects how thousands of managers and millions of employees experience work-life.
* **Be recognized as a leader of your domain.** 
 You are the expert on your area, your product, and your users. People look to you for clarity on where we’re going and why.
* **Make the calls on product direction.** 
 Commercial and technical leadership will challenge, support, and collaborate with you — but ultimately defer to your judgement on what creates the most value.
* **Grow as a leader over time.** 
 We invest in you through leadership development opportunities so your influence and capability can keep up with your scope.



  





**Why Simployer?** 




 Simployer is a leading HR tech company in the Nordics. You’ll work in a product organization that:
 


* Takes product seriously – PMs are expected and trusted to drive strategy, not just manage tickets.
* Invests in people – through learning opportunities, leadership programs, and access to experienced colleagues.
* Embraces modern ways of working – including AI-assisted workflows, data-informed decisions, and continuous discovery.
* Is big enough to matter but small enough that your work is visible, appreciated, and has clear impact.



  





**What we offer** 



* **Collaborative culture** 
 – Work with cross-functional teams who care about users and about each other. You’ll be part of a supportive, knowledgeable product community.
* **Growth and leadership development** 
 – Access to development opportunities to grow as a PM and leader.
* **Continuous learning** 
 – A dedicated budget for courses, books, or tools that help you grow your craft.
* **Competitive compensation** 
 – Market-aligned salary and benefits.
* **Modern tools** 
 – Access to enterprise-grade AI and productivity tools (e.g. ChatGPT, Cursor) to support discovery, analysis, and execution
* **Modern offices** 
 - Access to modern and centrally located office spaces in Oslo (Rebel) or Stockholm (Posthuset)



  





**Skills & Requirements** 




**What you will do** 




 As a Product Manager at Simployer, you will own the strategy and execution for your product area. We are not looking for a “ticket manager.” We are looking for someone who uses modern tools and methods to shorten the path from insight to shipped value.
 



  





 You will be responsible for the full product lifecycle—discovery, definition, delivery, and iteration. AI and automation will be part of your toolkit for handling data, research material, and drafting, so you can focus more of your energy on strategy, user understanding, and commercial outcomes.
 



  





 In practice, this means you will:
 


* **Strategic discovery**
* Lead customer and stakeholder discovery. Use AI tools to help synthesize feedback, analyse customer support logs, and spot patterns faster—paired with your own judgement and conversations with users.
* **Rapid prototyping**
* Move beyond static text requirements. Use prototyping tools and, where it makes sense, generative AI to create mockups, flows, or logic that clarify intent for design, engineering, and stakeholders.
* **Data-informed decisions**
* Explore and interpret data independently. You’re comfortable using available tools to understand usage patterns, behavior, and product performance, and using that insight to shape priorities.
* **Stakeholder alignment**
* Clearly communicate problem framing, trade-offs, and roadmaps to commercial teams and leadership.
* You act as the translator between business goals and technical execution, making sure everyone shares the same picture of what we’re doing and why.



  





**What you will bring** 



* **Product experience -** 
 You have experience shipping digital products or internal tools, in any role close to product (Product, Operations, Customer Success, Design, Engineering, etc.).
* *Engineer with a product mindset?*
* If you’ve found yourself caring more about user value and outcomes than the details of implementation, this can be a natural next step. We value the technical intuition you bring.
* **Operational AI fluency -** 
 You treat AI as a collaborator, not a gimmick. You can show how you already use LLMs or automation to improve your workflow (for research, drafting, analysis, or similar) and you’re excited to push this further.
* **Builder mindset -** 
 You focus on outcomes and shipped value rather than process for its own sake. You’re comfortable with ambiguity and iterating toward a solution based on feedback and learning.
* **Technical intuition -** 
 You understand the basics of how modern software and AI systems work (including concepts like risk, hallucinations, context windows, and trade-offs), and can have substantive conversations with engineers.
* **Communication and leadership -** 
 You communicate clearly in writing and in person, can facilitate discussions, and are comfortable acting as a leader for your product area.
* **Ownership and proactivity -** 
 You don’t wait for permission to fix things. When you see a bottleneck or opportunity, you raise it and propose a path forward.



  





**The AI toolkit and culture** 




  





 We don’t just talk about innovation; we put it into how we work. As a Product Manager at Simployer, you get:
 


* **AI-accelerated toolset** 
 – You won’t have to justify using AI – it’s our default. We actively encourage you to use LLMs and automation as part of your everyday workflows.
* Tools: ChatGPT Business, Cursor Pro, Github Copilot
* **A culture of experimentation** 
 – If something in your own workflow feels slow or inefficient, you’re encouraged to
 *“just hack yourself”* 
 —prototype, automate, or streamline it. And if you see a shared process or workflow that could be better, you don’t need permission to improve it:
 *just fix it.* 
 We celebrate curiosity, initiative, and pragmatic innovation.
* **An AI chapter that keeps you sharp** 
 – Our Product & Tech AI chapter moves fast enough to keep everyone on their toes—and often at the edge of their seats. You’ll be surrounded by people who push boundaries, share breakthroughs, and constantly explore what’s possible with modern AI.
* **Unleash your own potential** 
 – Our product tagline is
 *“Unleash the full potential in people.”* 
 That applies internally too. If you feel there’s more potential in you waiting to be unlocked, this is a place where you can actually do that—supported, challenged, and surrounded by people who want to level up together.
* **AI-accelerated toolset** 
 – You won’t have to justify using AI – it’s our default. We actively encourage you to use LLMs and automation as part of your everyday workflows.
* **Learning culture** 
 – We see mistakes made in honest experimentation as tuition. If something breaks because we moved fast, we fix it, learn, and improve together.



  





**Message from the hiring managers** 




 We’re currently hiring multiple Product Managers across different teams. We - Jonatan and Daniel - are partnering closely and genuinely looking forward to meeting the right people to join our journey.
 



  





*Hi, I’m Jonatan, and I’m Head of Product for our Core HRM experience at Simployer. What truly motivates me is building products that make people’s lives meaningfully better. I also get a lot of energy from coaching PMs and teams—it’s incredibly rewarding to see people gain confidence, clarity, and real momentum in their craft. People often tell me I’m a personal, dedicated, and positive leader. I believe deeply in empowered product teams that stay close to customers, own their outcomes, and have the trust and autonomy to do their best work. Right now is a special moment for us: AI is opening new doors, our platform is evolving quickly, and our products shape how millions experience work across the Nordics. If you’re curious, ambitious, and want to be part of that journey, I’d genuinely love to talk.* 




  





*Hello! I'm Daniel Tollefsen, Head of Product (AI) at Simployer. Having built and shipped products across different teams, startups, scale-ups, industries and geographies has taught me one consistent truth: the best products come from PMs who stay close to customers and close to the craft. I’ve always been a builder—from Lego to AI systems—and I believe modern PMs should feel comfortable using AI, data, and integrations as natural extensions of their problem-solving toolkit. I aim to lead with transparency, trust, and a focus on meaningful outcomes. If you’re excited about creating products that people love because they make life simpler, you'll fit right in at Simployer.* 




  





**Our hiring process** 



1. **Intro chat** 
 – A short conversation about your background and motivations.
2. **Meet & greet** 
 – Meet with your future manager (Jonathan or Daniel) to dive deeper into your experience and discuss the role
3. **Alva Labs Tests** 
 – Personality and ability assessments to understand how you work best.
4. **Case interview** 
 – A product + AI problem-solving session with our CPO, Nima Samimi.
5. **HR chat** 
 – A final conversation about culture, values, and ensuring this is the right match.



  





 Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
 



  





 At Simployer, we believe in empowering our employees to do their best work. Join us and contribute to a workplace where your skills and ideas actually shape the product and our company.
 



  





 We look forward to meeting you!

title: DBA
description:
Vi på Iver brinner för innovationer och god laganda, vi är särskilt intresserad av dig som gillar att tänka nytt och dela med dig av dina tankar. Vi söker en
 **Databasadministratör** 
 som vill bidra till bättre IT-lösningar för våra kunder. Är du vår nya kollega?
   

  

****We** 
**empower** 
**our** 
**Nordic** 
**society****
 Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation. Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort. Med huvudkontor i Stockholm verkar Iver främst i Norden med en agenda att fortsätta expandera. Iver omsätter drygt 3 miljarder SEK och har cirka 1 300 anställda som arbetar på ett av våra 23 kontor i Norden.
   

  

**Din roll på Iver**
 I rollen som
 **DBA** 
 blir du en del av Ivers affärsområde
 **Financial services and Fintech** 
 med ansvar för Ivers tjänsteleverans av cybersäkerhetstjänster och drift för kunder med särskilda säkerhetskrav.
 **Financial services and Fintechs** 
 kunder är ofta stora nordiska fintech företag eller myndigheter med krav på hög nivå av informationssäkerhet där vissa av dem utgör samhällskritisk verksamhet och har en särskild hotbild.
   

  

 Du kommer att vara en del av ett team om ca 35 personer med ansvar för drift och plattformsutveckling gentemot en specifik kund. Kunden är ett teknikdrivet och branschledande fintechbolag med höga krav på informationssäkerhet. Du kommer få en viktig roll där du är drivande i arbetet med att ta fram nya lösningar och guida kunden framåt och du arbetar i nära dialog med kunden för ständig förbättring och effektivisering.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifterna involverar klassiskt DBA arbete med att förbättra databasplattformarna, rådgiva utvecklare och operations, blandat med datawarehouse, dataanalys, ML/AI arbete & strategier. Vi strävar efter att modernisera arbetet kring databaser, därtill kommer man också arbeta i Kubernetes miljöer med t.ex. Git, Grafana, Prometheus där databaserna även har sin plats.
   

  

 DBA-teamet i sig består idag utav 5 personer, där man även arbetar tillsammans med utvecklare, operations och datanalytiker. Teamet driver projekt där de utforskar nya tekniker och implementerar kontinuerligt nya lösningar i Ivers plattformar. Teamet arbetar agilt och strukturerat i de olika projekten tillsammans med kund. I den här rollen har du goda möjligheter att utforma din roll efter vad du tycker är intressant.
   

  

 Vi arbetar bland annat med tekniker/metoder som
 **Kubernetes, Linux, DB2, Postgres, IaC, CI/CD, Bash, Python, GitOps, Grafana, Prometheus och Go** 
 .
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 På Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. Vi är inkluderande och strävar efter ett genuint samarbete mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi finns här för att inspirera dig till att nå dina yrkesmässiga mål. Vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden. Hos Iver är du också en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser för att vi ska utvecklas.
   

  

 Vi på Iver ger samma löfte till våra kollegor som till våra kunder. Löftet är att alltid vara ”beside you”, ”behind you” och ”before you”. Vi kallar det för "
 **The Iver way** 
 ".
   

  

**Förmåner hos oss:**
 📄 Kollektivavtal & trygga villkor
   

  

 🏠 Hybridarbete
   

  

 💪 Friskvårdsbidrag
   

  

 👓 Terminalglasögon
   

  

 ⏳ Tidsbank – 24 h extra ledighet/år
   

  

 🩺 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension (ITP) & flexpension
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
 Vi söker dig som är en lagspelare med ett stort tekniskt intresse och som har en vilja att förstå hur saker fungerar i grund och botten. Som person är du prestigelös, ansvarstagande och har en förmåga att förmedla lösningar på problem. Du gillar nära samarbeten mellan utveckling, kunder och operations där dina åsikter och kunskaper bidrar till teamens gemensamma mål.
   

  

 Vi tror att Cybersäkerhet är ett område du finner intressant och du ser behovet av att förstå komplexa system, deras sårbarheter och att ständigt utveckla dessa. Du har gärna en viss erfarenhet av DB2, eller erfarenhet av andra databaser (Postgres, Redis m.m.) samt god erfarenhet av att arbeta med Linux. Vidare behärskar du ett eller flera script/programmeringsspråk samt har kunskap av Git.
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Iver finns på 23 orter i Norden. För denna roll ser vi att du utgår från ett av våra kontor i Solna.
   

  

**Övrig information:** 
 Vi har kunder inom alla branscher och sektorer inklusive säkerhetsklassad verksamhet, därför genomför vi bakgrundskontroller i samtliga av våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

**Sök till oss!** 
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag:** 
 2025-12-20.
   

  

**Start:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Välkommen att kontakta joacim.forsman@iver.se eller Kajsa.holzwart@iver.se vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

 Våra kunder är ofta stora nordiska företag, fintech, eller myndigheter, med krav på hög nivå av informationssäkerhet och infrastruktur som kod. Vissa av dem utgör samhällskritisk verksamhet och/eller har en särskild hotbild.

title: Managing Partner - Defence
description:
**Managing Partner**
**IT Strategy Consulting – Defence sector
   

  

 Sweden (Hybrid)**
 Backed by the incredible insight of Gartner Research, Gartner Consulting helps the world’s leading organisations to stay ahead of the digital curve.
   

  

**What we do:**
 Gartner’s Consulting business provides independent support for International organisations across the Defence industry and National Governments. Providing 'right practice' data driven support to decision making, informed by world class research across a range of current and emerging digital challenges, our teams aim to save taxpayers money and improve citizen outcomes for national, regional and local government.
   

  

 We are currently looking for highly talented Defence professional, ideally with consulting experience (at Senior Manager, Associate Director, Director, Managing Director, Engagement Manager, Associate Partner or Principal level), with a strong understanding of technology and strategic transformation, to join our world-class Strategy Consulting team helping Defence and Public Sector clients.
   

  

**What you will do:**
 The Managing Partner, Defence will provide technology foresight, market intelligence to senior leaders within Defence and military organisations. Strategic Planning for the CEO, CDO, CFO, CIO and senior IT executives ranging from roadmaps and operating models, to organisational design and governance, enabling data driven decision making, innovation and IT cost optimisation
   

  

**What you need:**
 We seek candidates with the ability to advise at the highest level, experience we’re looking for:
   

  

- Technology-driven transformational change experience for the defence/military industry (Försvarsmakten, FMV, FRA, Fortifikationsverket) or experience working within a military-industrial organisation;

- An understanding of consulting and strategy principles/frameworks (ideally gained from a consulting firm) would be advantageous;

- MBA qualification desirable;

- An excellent understanding of the trends within the defence industry and the wider Public Sector

- Experience in one or more of:

* CIO Advisory Services
* Value Realisation and Programme assurance
* End-to-end Technology-led Transformation
* Applications modernization
* Cloud transformation
* Sourcing and Contract Optimisation
* Ideally experienced in leading IT strategy engagements, and contributing to sales pursuits and proposal writing


 This is a great opportunity to join a world-class consulting team in Sweden that already has a very strong track record working in the Defence industry.
   

  

**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective business and technology insights, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our vast, virtually untapped market potential offers limitless opportunities – opportunities that may not even exist right now – for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:104598
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
   

  

**For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.**

title: Lead Auditor - Information Security ISO 27001
description:
**About Us**
 We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
   

  

 As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
   

  

**About Business Assurance**
 We help companies ensure compliance, build high-performing management systems, and meet competence needs within a wide range of industries. DNV helps companies understand Working with us, you can be involved in technically challenging and innovative projects worldwide demanding a broad variety of expertise. Our strong focus on research and innovation opens an array of opportunities, and allows you to engage in projects which develop next generation solutions. and manage their risk picture through our management system certification and training portfolios.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a result of further growth of our Business Assurance Unit in Sweden we are looking for qualified
 **Lead Auditors** 
 within the
 **Information Security ISO 27001** 
 area, preferably combined with ISO 9001.
   

  

**Your place of employment can be anywhere in Sweden, with visits to the client site.**
 As a
 **Lead Auditor** 
 you will be part of our team of auditors. Your assignments will be performing audits according to standards for information security – normally at the customer’s premises - in a wide variety of industries.
   

  

 You will be part of a professional team of colleagues with experience in many industries. As a Lead Auditor you will work both independently and in multidisciplinary teams.
   

  

**The Assignment May Include**
* Performing audits for Swedish and international clients
* Project management of larger certification projects
* Development of new services, training services, etc. on an ad hoc basis
* Supporting sales team and contributing to sales revenue.


 What we offer
   

  

 In DNV we are proud to lead the development in our main industries. Whether we work with some of the world’s leading companies to help solve some of their risk or safety challenges or we initiate joint industry projects to solve an industry-wide technical issue, we always aim to deliver expert insight and value to our customers and stakeholders. You will work with experts from a wide range of disciplines and build your competence, problem-solving abilities. It will broaden your view.
   

  

**We offer**
* A strong company culture with an emphasis on competence development
* Great colleagues who value teamwork and support
* Attractive total compensation package
* International working environment
* Flexible working hours and focus on work/life balance
* Interesting and challenging customers and projects, both national and international
* Be part of a world-leading company that has a global reach with more than 12 000 employees around to world and is headquartered in Norway.
* The possibility to grow and develop your competencies and ambitions within DNV.


**Requirements**
 About you
   

  

* Relevant educational background
* At least four years full-time practical work experience in information technology, of which at least two years in a role or function relating to information security
* Experience with one or more of the following standards: ISO 27001 and ISO 9001 and knowledge of best practices regarding information security.
* ISO 22301 - Business continuity and ISO 20000 - Service Management is not a requirement but is an advantage.
* Good communication and collaborative skills
* Must be able to travel, including overnight stays, often involving travel outside of normal working hours
* Good English skills in speech and writing, as well as fluent in Swedish, both in speech and writing
* Great commercial and sales skills preferred
* Strong communication and training skills preferred.


**Personal qualities**
* Are organized, service-minded, and focused on timely delivery with the right quality
* Are both a team player as well as self-reliant
* Like working in an international organization
* Are business- and customer-oriented
* Good communication and commercial skills, able to choose appropriate methods and style to suit the situation and audience.


 For more details about this role please contact: Patrik Flink, Operations Manager, Sweden at +46 708 301 683
   

  

 Please submit your CV in English or Swedish.
