title: Product Manager
description:
**Shape the future of HR with AI-augmented product work**  

  

At Simployer, we simplify work-life for thousands of companies across the Nordics by delivering HR and people solutions that actually get used. We are now hiring Product Managers who wants to evolve how product management is done—combining strong product sense with modern AI fluency to deliver value faster and with greater precision.


**This is not a traditional “ticket-moving” PM role.**  

You will own outcomes, shape strategy, and lead your product area.



This is a role for someone who enjoys owning outcomes, not just backlogs. You’re curious, structured, and motivated by solving real problems for real users. Whether you come from Product, Operations, Customer Success, or Engineering, if you care about building useful products and are keen to work with modern tools (including AI), we want to talk to you.


**Why this role?**



As a Product Manager at Simployer you will:

  

* **Shape how HR is practiced** through the products you own. Your work directly affects how thousands of managers and millions of employees experience work-life.
* **Be recognized as a leader of your domain.** You are the expert on your area, your product, and your users. People look to you for clarity on where we’re going and why.
* **Make the calls on product direction.** Commercial and technical leadership will challenge, support, and collaborate with you — but ultimately defer to your judgement on what creates the most value.
* **Grow as a leader over time.** We invest in you through leadership development opportunities so your influence and capability can keep up with your scope.


**Why Simployer?**  

Simployer is a leading HR tech company in the Nordics. You’ll work in a product organization that:


* Takes product seriously – PMs are expected and trusted to drive strategy, not just manage tickets.
* Invests in people – through learning opportunities, leadership programs, and access to experienced colleagues.
* Embraces modern ways of working – including AI-assisted workflows, data-informed decisions, and continuous discovery.
* Is big enough to matter but small enough that your work is visible, appreciated, and has clear impact.


**What we offer**


* **Collaborative culture** – Work with cross-functional teams who care about users and about each other. You’ll be part of a supportive, knowledgeable product community.
* **Growth and leadership development** – Access to development opportunities to grow as a PM and leader.
* **Continuous learning** – A dedicated budget for courses, books, or tools that help you grow your craft.
* **Competitive compensation** – Market-aligned salary and benefits.
* **Modern tools** – Access to enterprise-grade AI and productivity tools (e.g. ChatGPT, Cursor) to support discovery, analysis, and execution
* **Modern offices** - Access to modern and centrally located office spaces in Oslo (Rebel) or Stockholm (Posthuset)


**Work with great people**
--------------------------

**Thomas Ellingsen**
Senior DevOps


"I really enjoy my job because I work with a talented and supportive team. In my work I’m able to make mistakes and learn from them. This encourages me to take risks and continuously improve my skills."
**Karoline Brynildsen**
Engineering Manager


"I started in Simployer as a developer before transitioning in to team lead and later engineering manager. Working here for almost 10 years I have had the opportunity to continuously grow and develop."
**Maria Dahlqvist**
Senior Customer Consultant


"In my work I help our customers to find the best way to use our products and how to simplify their processes. Sharing our experiences help us to develop ourselves, our customers and products."
**Sally Russel**
Head of Product Marketing


"The best thing about Simployer? The people. Smart, kind, and always up for a challenge. We push each other to grow and have fun while doing it."
**Michał Sekuła**
Engineering Manager


"In Simployer amazing things are delivered by amazing people. With our culture where we take care of each other we are able to grow individually and as a company and go beyond any limitations."
**Ida Ljungberg**
Legal Adviser HR & Management


"Our HR Services would have been very useful for me in my previous HR jobs. So contributing to our customers within labour law, HR and payroll is one of the reasons why I really enjoy working here!"
Skills & Requirements


**What you will do**  

As a Product Manager at Simployer, you will own the strategy and execution for your product area. We are not looking for a “ticket manager.” We are looking for someone who uses modern tools and methods to shorten the path from insight to shipped value.



You will be responsible for the full product lifecycle—discovery, definition, delivery, and iteration. AI and automation will be part of your toolkit for handling data, research material, and drafting, so you can focus more of your energy on strategy, user understanding, and commercial outcomes.  

In practice, this means you will:

  

* **Strategic discovery**  

Lead customer and stakeholder discovery. Use AI tools to help synthesize feedback, analyse customer support logs, and spot patterns faster—paired with your own judgement and conversations with users.
* **Rapid prototyping**  

Move beyond static text requirements. Use prototyping tools and, where it makes sense, generative AI to create mockups, flows, or logic that clarify intent for design, engineering, and stakeholders.
* **Data-informed decisions**  

Explore and interpret data independently. You’re comfortable using available tools to understand usage patterns, behavior, and product performance, and using that insight to shape priorities.
* **Stakeholder alignment**  

Clearly communicate problem framing, trade-offs, and roadmaps to commercial teams and leadership.  

You act as the translator between business goals and technical execution, making sure everyone shares the same picture of what we’re doing and why.


**What you will bring**


* **Product experience -** You have experience shipping digital products or internal tools, in any role close to product (Product, Operations, Customer Success, Design, Engineering, etc.).


+ *Engineer with a product mindset?*  

If you’ve found yourself caring more about user value and outcomes than the details of implementation, this can be a natural next step. We value the technical intuition you bring.


* **Operational AI fluency -** You treat AI as a collaborator, not a gimmick. You can show how you already use LLMs or automation to improve your workflow (for research, drafting, analysis, or similar) and you’re excited to push this further.
* **Builder mindset -** You focus on outcomes and shipped value rather than process for its own sake. You’re comfortable with ambiguity and iterating toward a solution based on feedback and learning.
* **Technical intuition -** You understand the basics of how modern software and AI systems work (including concepts like risk, hallucinations, context windows, and trade-offs), and can have substantive conversations with engineers.
* **Communication and leadership -** You communicate clearly in writing and in person, can facilitate discussions, and are comfortable acting as a leader for your product area.
* **Ownership and proactivity -** You don’t wait for permission to fix things. When you see a bottleneck or opportunity, you raise it and propose a path forward.


**The AI toolkit and culture**  

We don’t just talk about innovation; we put it into how we work. As a Product Manager at Simployer, you get:

  

* **AI-accelerated toolset** – You won’t have to justify using AI – it’s our default. We actively encourage you to use LLMs and automation as part of your everyday workflows.
	+ Tools: ChatGPT Business, Cursor Pro, Github Copilot
* **A culture of experimentation** – If something in your own workflow feels slow or inefficient, you’re encouraged to *“just hack yourself”*—prototype, automate, or streamline it. And if you see a shared process or workflow that could be better, you don’t need permission to improve it: *just fix it.* We celebrate curiosity, initiative, and pragmatic innovation.
* **An AI chapter that keeps you sharp** – Our Product & Tech AI chapter moves fast enough to keep everyone on their toes—and often at the edge of their seats. You’ll be surrounded by people who push boundaries, share breakthroughs, and constantly explore what’s possible with modern AI.
* **Unleash your own potential** – Our product tagline is *“Unleash the full potential in people.”* That applies internally too. If you feel there’s more potential in you waiting to be unlocked, this is a place where you can actually do that—supported, challenged, and surrounded by people who want to level up together.
* **AI-accelerated toolset** – You won’t have to justify using AI – it’s our default. We actively encourage you to use LLMs and automation as part of your everyday workflows.
* **Learning culture** – We see mistakes made in honest experimentation as tuition. If something breaks because we moved fast, we fix it, learn, and improve together.


**Message from the hiring managers**  

We’re currently hiring multiple Product Managers across different teams. We - Jonatan and Daniel - are partnering closely and genuinely looking forward to meeting the right people to join our journey.  

  

*Hi, I’m Jonatan, and I’m Head of Product for our Core HRM experience at Simployer. What truly motivates me is building products that make people’s lives meaningfully better. I also get a lot of energy from coaching PMs and teams—it’s incredibly rewarding to see people gain confidence, clarity, and real momentum in their craft. People often tell me I’m a personal, dedicated, and positive leader. I believe deeply in empowered product teams that stay close to customers, own their outcomes, and have the trust and autonomy to do their best work. Right now is a special moment for us: AI is opening new doors, our platform is evolving quickly, and our products shape how millions experience work across the Nordics. If you’re curious, ambitious, and want to be part of that journey, I’d genuinely love to talk.*  

  

*Hello! I'm Daniel Tollefsen, Head of Product (AI) at Simployer. Having built and shipped products across different teams, startups, scale-ups, industries and geographies has taught me one consistent truth: the best products come from PMs who stay close to customers and close to the craft. I’ve always been a builder—from Lego to AI systems—and I believe modern PMs should feel comfortable using AI, data, and integrations as natural extensions of their problem-solving toolkit. I aim to lead with transparency, trust, and a focus on meaningful outcomes. If you’re excited about creating products that people love because they make life simpler, you'll fit right in at Simployer.*


**Our hiring process**


* **Intro chat** – A short conversation about your background and motivations.
* **Meet & greet** – Meet with your future manager (Jonathan or Daniel) to dive deeper into your experience and discuss the role
* **Alva Labs Tests** – Personality and ability assessments to understand how you work best.
* **Case interview** – A product + AI problem-solving session with our CPO, Nima Samimi.
* **HR chat** – A final conversation about culture, values, and ensuring this is the right match.



Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.  

  

At Simployer, we believe in empowering our employees to do their best work. Join us and contribute to a workplace where your skills and ideas actually shape the product and our company.


We look forward to meeting you!

  

**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------

Hybrid and flexible work model


Modern offices


Pension and health care


Laughs, develops, and celebrates together


HR tech company


Career opportunities


Simployer is a “people first” company. We offer a unique combination of high-value and people-centric products, services and expertise. Our simplifying solutions are the preferred choice of more than 15,000 customers and 1,2 million users in Northern Europe. For almost four decades, we have helped our customers unleash the full potential in people, the core asset of any company. Managers who want to lead better – by inspiring, engaging and developing their employees – choose our solutions. We are on an exciting journey where we will continue to grow our company into new markets in Northern Europe. In Simployer we have a culture where it is possible to grow, and to have a direct impact on the business through empowerment and flat structure. You will work with colleagues who are passionate about their work and we can promise you that we have a lot of fun at work. To succeed in the market, reach our growth goals and continue to fulfil our vision, we need top talent who shares our conviction that people make businesses grow. Are you our next Simployee?  



  

Enable "functional cookies" to watch the video


**Our Values****Learn, Lead and Deliver**With every new piece of information we acquire, and every new skill we develop, we become stronger, wiser, and more capable of delivering good products and meaningful experiences. We will never stop seeking knowledge, for it is the key that unlocks the door to our greatest potential.
We are open to new ideas and perspectives, eager to make the next move. We are curious about way of working and stay ahead of the curve. We lead by example and dare to fail fast. We're on a fun journey, as a team and together with our customer.
We put passion and dedication into our work, because we know that every delivery is an opportunity to make a difference. We approach each task with our hearts and a drive to exceed expectations. We don't just deliver, we do it with a passion for both our customer and Simployees.
We embrace what makes us human, take time to play and have fun together.
  
Ulrika Rosén | Contact Person
 +46 72-142 48 17

title: Ingenjörer till Comatec Sweden – Göteborg
description:
**Vill du vara med och göra skillnad – och ha roligt på vägen?**


Hos oss på Comatec Sweden tror vi att konsultlivet ska vara både personligt, utvecklande och inspirerande. Vi är ett sammansvetsat team i Göteborg, med tryggheten och möjligheterna från den internationella Comatec Group i ryggen. Här får du det bästa av två världar: den familjära känslan och flexibiliteten från det lilla bolaget, och resurserna och tryggheten från en större koncern.


Vi samarbetar med allt från världsledande fordonsjättar till innovativa start-ups inom industri, mjukvara, automation, produktion, energi, elektronik och digitalisering. Som konsult hos oss matchas du mot spännande projekt där din kompetens verkligen gör skillnad – ofta på plats hos kund, men alltid med stöd från Comatec-teamet.

**Vad gör oss unika?**  

Vi värdesätter äkta samarbete, kunskapsdelning och en varm, inkluderande kultur. Vi ses regelbundet för sociala aktiviteter, teknisk inspiration och för att fira våra framgångar tillsammans. Dina idéer och ambitioner är viktiga här – och du får friheten att forma din egen utveckling.


Om du söker en arbetsplats där du blir sedd, stöttad och utmanad – och där du kan växa både som ingenjör och människa – då vill vi gärna höra från dig!


www.comatec.fi/en/companies/comatec-sweden-ab/

 **Vi söker dig med erfarenhet inom :**

* Embedded systems
* Elektronik
* Elkraft
* Automation
* Produktionsteknik
* Systemutveckling
* Mjukvaruutveckling (C, C++, Python, Matlab/Simulink)
* Test & verifiering
* DevOps, CI/CD, Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes
* Projektledning
* Konstruktion
* Dataingenjör, AI, digitalisering
* Fordonsteknik, elektrifiering, ADAS, infotainment
* Hårdvarunära kod/utveckling, realtidssystem
* Kommunikation (CAN, LIN, Ethernet, SPI)


Har du annan relevant ingenjörsbakgrund är du också välkommen att söka.

**Vem är du?**


Du är ingenjör, har EU-medborgarskap eller arbetstillstånd i Sverige och vill arbeta på plats i Göteborg.


**Comatec Group**


Vi är ett internationellt ingenjörsföretag med cirka 600 engagerade experter på tjugo orter i Finland, Sverige, Polen, Estland och Rumänien. Vår styrka ligger i att leverera innovativ konstruktionsdesign, projektledning och specialisttjänster för teknikindustrin.

**Vi skapar värde i projekt som rör:**

* Mobila maskiner och kommersiella fordon
* Industriell automation och modernisering
* Materialhantering och produktionssystem
* Kraftverk och pannlösningar


Med en tydlig vision om tillväxt och internationalisering söker vi ständigt nya talanger. Är du expert inom mekanisk, elektrisk eller automationsdesign – eller har erfarenhet av projektledning? Då vill vi gärna träffa dig!

**Bli en del av vårt team och forma framtidens teknik tillsammans med oss!**


Läsr mer: www.comatec.fi/en/

**Viktigt om CV och AI-matchning hos Comatec Sweden**


Comatec Sweden använder AI som stöd vid matchning mot uppdrag som komplement till traditionella intervjuer. Tänk därför på att ditt CV bör innehålla sökbara detaljer om dina meriter, verktyg, standarder, processer och relevanta “buzz-words”. Ju tydligare och mer specifik du är, desto större chans att du matchas mot rätt uppdrag.

title: QA Engineer
description:
At Umain, we're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto "Shape, Ship, Scale," we empower our team to not only envision the future but also play a pivotal role in building it. We're a dynamic team where you can shape the future, ship groundbreaking solutions, and scale your abilities in many different ways.


We're on the lookout for QA Engineers who see testing as more than checking features. You understand that the purpose of testing is to make risks visible and reduce uncertainty, and you care about improving not only the product but also how the team ensures quality.  

You enjoy methodical, structured testing, but you’re equally curious about automation and how to make testing smarter, faster, and better integrated into the delivery flow.


What We Offer:

* A chance to work on unique projects that explore and push the boundaries of what's possible.
* A fun and fair work environment where your you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
* A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
* Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


As a QA Engineer at Umain, your role will involve:

* Analysing user stories and requirements to identify risks and define test cases
* Design, execute, and maintain functional, regression, and exploratory tests
* Build and extend automated tests for UI, API, or backend
* Collaborate with developers to integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines
* Report and communicate quality insights, focusing on what the results mean
* Suggest and implement improvements in testing practices, tools, and processes

  

What you bring

*Structured and analytical testing skills*

* Strong understanding of structured and risk-based test design, drawing on principles from frameworks such as ISTQB or TMAP
* Experience across different test levels including component, integration, system, and UAT
* Ability to design, prioritise, and maintain test cases based on business impact and risk

*Automation and technical mindset*

* Hands on experience with modern automation tools such as Cypress, Playwright, Appium or Postman
* Comfortable writing basic scripts in JavaScript, TypeScript, or Python
* Understanding of APIs, JSON, and CI/CD pipelines such as GitLab, Azure DevOps, or Jenkins
* Treats automation as part of the product codebase, versioned, reviewed, and maintained

*Collaboration and communication*

* Works closely with developers, designers, and product owners to clarify and test assumptions early
* Communicates findings clearly and constructively, focusing on understanding and action
* Helps stakeholders make informed release decisions by putting risks into context
  

*Ownership and continuous improvement*

* Takes initiative to improve how the team works instead of waiting for others to define it
* Brings ideas for smarter ways of testing or automating repetitive work
* Contributes to making quality a shared team responsibility

  

*Experience we’d love to see*

* 3 to 6 years of experience in QA, test engineering, or a similar quality focused role
* Experience working in agile, iterative delivery environments such as Scrum or Kanban
* Exposure to end to end digital product development across web, mobile, or backend systems
* Experience from consultancy or multi client projects is a plus
* Fluent in English; other languages are an advantag

  

Why Umain?

* Career Framework:
We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.
* Work-Life Balance:
At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.
* Innovations and Learning:
Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.
* Skills Over Degrees:
We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.

**Are You Ready to Shape, Ship, and Scale with Us?**


If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.

title: Problemlösare - Tech Lead till Sogeti Västerås

title: Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)
description:
**Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) - Terraform, Github Actions, Jenkins, CI/CD, Operations.** 




  





**Location** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
 



**Hybrid** 
 3 days onsite per week
 



**Contract** 
 12-month freelance contract, extendable
 



  





 Our client, a rapidly scaling technology organisation, is seeking an experienced Site Reliability Engineer to strengthen their operations and reliability function. This role is ideal for an SRE who enjoys working close to production environments, improving automation, refining CI/CD pipelines, and ensuring the stability and scalability of critical services.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Maintain, optimise and automate CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins and GitHub Actions
* Manage and enhance infrastructure using Terraform and modern IaC practices
* Support operational reliability across production systems, including monitoring, alerting and incident response
* Collaborate closely with engineering teams to improve deployment processes and reduce manual toil
* Ensure system performance meets defined SLOs, SLIs and error budgets
* Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives across reliability, automation and operational efficiency
* Participate in on-call rotations where required



  





**Required Skills & Experience** 



* Strong experience as an SRE, DevOps Engineer or Operations Engineer within cloud or distributed systems environments
* Hands-on expertise with CI/CD tooling, specifically Jenkins and GitHub Actions
* Proficiency with Terraform and Infrastructure as Code methodologies
* Solid understanding of production operations, monitoring and troubleshooting
* Experience working in fast-paced or scaling technology environments
* Ability to partner with cross-functional engineering teams in a collaborative setting
* Excellent communication skills and a proactive mindset

**CI/CD Strategy & Implementation** 



* Architect and implement robust, scalable CI/CD pipelines for application and data platform deployments.
* Lead automation of build, test, and release processes using tools like Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, Jenkins, or GitLab CI/CD.
* Define and enforce best practices for version control, branching strategies, and release management.







**Databricks / Snowflake Integration (Preferred)** 



* Support deployment and configuration of Databricks notebooks, jobs, and clusters.
* Automate Snowflake data workflows and integrations within CI/CD pipelines.
* Collaborate with data teams to ensure seamless integration with cloud infrastructure.
* 



**Required Qualifications:** 



* Experience in DevOps, Cloud Engineering, or related roles.
* Proven expertise in CI/CD pipeline development, deployment automation, and release management.
* Deep hands-on experience with AWS or Azure cloud platforms.
* Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python, Shell, or PowerShell.
* Strong knowledge of IaC tools like Terraform, CloudFormation, or ARM templates.
* Experience with containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).

title: Senior AWS Specialist
description:
**Senior AWS Specialist – Altostruct** 




 Stockholm / Hybrid
 



  





 Är du redo att ta nästa steg som AWS-expert och vara med och bygga framtidens molnlösningar?
 



 Hos Altostruct får du arbeta med ambitiösa kunder, ta stort ansvar och vara med på vår resa att demokratisera molnet – vi vill göra det enkelt för alla företag, oavsett storlek, att dra nytta av AWS på ett smart, säkert och kostnadseffektivt sätt.Vi är ett lönsamt, växande bolag och AWS Advanced Partner som redan idag hjälper några av Sveriges mest spännande startups och scaleups att växa och modernisera sin infrastruktur. Vår ambition är tydlig: att bli Sveriges ledande AWS-partner och den självklara aktören för bolag som vill få ut maximalt värde av sin molnresa.Här får du arbeta i ett litet, dedikerat team med högt tekniskt fokus, där din insats gör direkt skillnad – både för våra kunder och för Altostructs framtid.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Senior AWS Specialist hos Altostruct får du en nyckelroll i att designa, implementera och optimera molnplattformar för våra kunder. Du kommer att:
 


* Designa skalbara, säkra och kostnadseffektiva AWS-arkitekturer
* Leda implementeringsprojekt från strategi till drift
* Ge råd kring best practices, säkerhet och kostnadsoptimering
* Automatisera infrastruktur med Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
* Delta i pre-sales och tekniska workshops med kunder
* Vara en trusted advisor till både kunder och kollegor
* Coacha och stötta juniora kollegor och kunder i deras molnresa



  





 Detta är en bred roll där du kommer arbeta nära beslutsfattare och utvecklingsteam hos våra kunder. Projekten varierar – allt från att bygga en modern molnplattform från grunden, till att optimera och säkra befintliga miljöer.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




 Vi letar efter någon som har en djup teknisk förståelse för AWS och erfarenhet av att arbeta nära kunder i roller med stort ansvar.Vi tror att du har:
 


* 5+ års erfarenhet av AWS-miljöer i större skala
* Starka färdigheter inom cloud architecture och solution design
* Erfarenhet av Infrastructure as Code, t.ex. Terraform eller AWS CDK
* Förståelse för säkerhet, nätverk, och compliance i molnet
* Praktisk erfarenhet av automatisering och CI/CD pipelines
* Goda kunskaper inom ett eller flera programmeringsspråk (t.ex. Python, Node.js eller Go)
* Erfarenhet av containerteknologier, t.ex. Docker och Kubernetes (EKS)
* Förmåga att kommunicera tydligt med både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter
* Flytande svenska, engelska är krav



 Extra plus om du även har:
 


* AWS-certifieringar, t.ex. AWS Solutions Architect – Professional eller DevOps Engineer – Professional
* Erfarenhet av startups/scaleups eller produktbolag
* Djupare kunskap inom FinOps eller AWS-kostnadsoptimering
* Erfarenhet av molnmigreringar eller multi-account setups (AWS Organizations, Control Tower)



  





**Vem du är** 




 Vi tror att du är en person som:
 


* Har passion för att bygga snygga, hållbara lösningar som gör verklig skillnad
* Är proaktiv, ansvarstagande och van att driva projekt framåt
* Gillar att arbeta nära kunder och fungera som en rådgivare
* Är nyfiken och vill hålla dig uppdaterad inom det senaste i AWS- och cloud-världen
* Värdesätter teamarbete och kunskapsdelning, samtidigt som du kan arbeta självständigt



  





**Varför Altostruct?** 




 Hos oss får du inte bara en arbetsplats, utan en möjlighet att forma både din egen roll och företagets framtid.
 



 Vi erbjuder:
 


* Högt tekniskt fokus – du arbetar med AWS på riktigt, varje dag
* Påverkan – var med och bygg ett bolag i tillväxtfas
* Flexibilitet – hybridarbete och stort eget ansvar
* Utveckling – AWS-certifieringar, utbildningar, nätverkande och personlig coachning
* Bra villkor – marknadsmässig lön, pension och andra förmåner



  





 Låter det här som en roll för dig?
 



  





 Skicka din ansökan till oss redan idag – vi intervjuar löpande.
 



 Placering: Stockholm (hybridmöjlighet)
 



 Språk: Svenska
 



 Stockholm / Hybrid

title: AWS DevOps Engineer
description:
We are looking for a
 **Senior AWS / DevOps Engineer** 
 to take technical ownership of a cloud-based workshop platform. You will work at the intersection of
 **platform engineering and DevOps** 
 , enabling development teams to deliver secure, scalable, and reliable solutions in an agile environment.
 



  





**Your Role** 




 You will design, operate, and continuously improve the AWS platform while driving automation, CI/CD excellence, and infrastructure scalability. You’ll collaborate closely with development teams, take part in architectural decisions, and ensure high availability, security, and cost efficiency.
 



**Responsibilities** 



* Design and maintain AWS infrastructure (ECS, Lambda, API Gateway, IAM, VPC)
* Build and optimize CI/CD pipelines using GitLab
* Manage Infrastructure as Code using Terraform, CDK or CloudFormation
* Ensure platform stability, security, compliance, and observability
* Support development teams with deployments, integrations, and automation
* Contribute to architecture, performance tuning, and cost optimization



  





**Required Skills** 



* 5+ years of hands-on AWS production experience
* Strong knowledge of ECS, Lambda, API Gateway, IAM, and VPC
* Strong experience with GitLab CI/CD
* Infrastructure as Code using Terraform, CDK or CloudFormation
* Docker and container orchestration
* Scripting with Python or Bash
* Solid understanding of microservices and API integrations
