title: Spontanansökan – IT-infrastrukturkonsult till Nexer Infrastructure
description:
Detta gäller inte ett specifikt uppdrag, utan framtida möjligheter vid rätt matchning.
   

  

 Är du nyfiken på nästa steg inom IT-infrastruktur?
   

  

 Vi på Nexer Infrastructure söker löpande kontakt med skickliga och engagerade personer inom IT-infrastruktur – även om vi just nu inte har ett aktivt uppdrag att tillsätta. Vi vet ännu inte exakt vilka uppdrag som kommer in i höst – men genom att skicka in en spontanansökan finns du med i våra tankar när vi söker rätt kompetens för framtida uppdrag. Så kikar du runt efter nya utmaningar och är intresserad av Nexer - skicka gärna in din ansökan!
   

  

 Vi är särskilt intresserade av dig som har erfarenhet inom något/några av områdena nedan:
   

  

* Drift, övervakning och förvaltning av IT-miljöer
* Nätverk, brandväggar och säkerhetslösningar
* Linux (Automatisering i Ansible eller Bash)
* Microsoftmiljöer (AD, Exchange, M365, Windows Server)
* Virtualisering (VMware, Hyper-V)
* Molntjänster (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud)
* ITIL och arbete med ärendehanteringssystem


 Vem är du?
   

  

 Du har flera års erfarenhet inom IT-infrastruktur och är van att arbeta både självständigt och i team. Du har ett konsultmässigt förhållningssätt, kommunicerar tydligt och gillar problemlösning.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har:
   

  

* Förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya miljöer
* God problemlösningsförmåga och vana att arbeta proaktivt
* Obehindrade kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift


 Vad kan vi erbjuda?
   

  

 Hos oss blir du en del av ett bolag med passion, framtidstro och teknik i fokus. När rätt uppdrag dyker upp matchar vi dig med det – och stöttar dig hela vägen, både inför och under uppdraget.
   

  

 Du får ett starkt nätverk av kollegor, en engagerad konsultchef och chansen att göra skillnad ute hos våra kunder.
   

  

 Låter det intressant?
   

  

 Skicka in ditt CV och några rader om din kompetens, tillgänglighet och vilken typ av uppdrag du är intresserad av. Vi återkommer efter semestrarna om vi får in ett uppdrag som matchar din profil.

title: Fullstack Developer - Java/React
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Techstack: Java/Kotlin/Spring boot/React
* Design, develop, and operate backend and frontend solutions
* Build user-facing features and applications using modern full-stack strategies.
* Ensure the services your team develops are fast, scalable, secure, and observable.
* Collaborate with domain experts to grasp business needs and translate them into effective technical solutions.
* Contribute to cultivating a robust engineering culture, including automated testing, continuous delivery, and comprehensive documentation.
* Work in tandem with other development teams, product teams, and domain stakeholders to deliver valuable and maintainable solutions.


**Application deadline:** 
 03-12-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Konsulter inom Data Governance till KPMG Financial Services Consulting
description:
*Vill du ta nästa steg i din karriär och vara med och påverka hur framtidens finansiella sektor använder tekniska lösningar för att digitalisera, effektivisera och skapa innovativa lösningar till sina kunder? Som teknisk konsult på KPMG Financial Services Consulting får du arbeta med ledande aktörer i branschen och bidra till framgångsrika transformationer och implementera värdeskapande lösningar.*
**Om oss**
 KPMG Financial Services Consulting (FSC) är ledande i Sverige inom riskhantering, governance och regulatorisk transformation i den finansiella sektorn. Vi består av specialister och transformativa konsulter som hjälper banker, försäkringsbolag, fondbolag och andra finansiella aktörer att utveckla, automatisera och digitalisera sin verksamhet, bland annat med utgångspunkt i nya regulatoriska krav.
   

  

 Vi arbetar med olika typer av tekniska lösningar och allt från förstudier till hela transformationsprogram. Vi har ett antal tjänste- och mjukvaruleverantörer som partners och vi är ofta involverade i införandet av den senaste tekniken, inte minst inom AI. Genom att kombinera analytisk skärpa, teknisk kompetens och djup branschinsikt hjälper vi våra kunder att övervinna tekniska hinder och få ut största möjliga värde av sina teknikinvesteringar.
   

  

 Hos oss på FSC blir du en del av ett drivet och mångsidigt team som samarbetar med några av marknadens mest spännande finansiella aktörer, både i Sverige och internationellt.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som teknisk konsult inom Financial Services Consulting får du en nyckelroll i våra kunders transformationsresor, där fokus ligger på att förbättra verksamhet och processer med utgångspunkt i nya regulatoriska krav samt ökande krav på effektivitet och kundorientering.
   

  

 Just nu ser vi en ökad efterfrågan från våra kunder inom data governance och vi letar efter dig som har erfarenheter av data governance.
   

  

**I rollen kommer du att:**
* Stödja våra kunder med deras tekniska utmaningar, t.ex. genom att arbeta med att sätta upp rätt governance, säkerställa kvalité eller projektledning.
* Bidra till digitalisering och effektivisering av olika affärsprocesser.
* Samarbeta med seniora experter och rådgivare inom KPMG:s globala nätverk.


*Du får snabbt ta ansvar i uppdrag och arbeta nära kundernas ledning, i en miljö som uppmuntrar nytänkande, kvalitet och personlig utveckling.*
 ,
   

  

* Vi söker dig med 6-8 års erfarenhet från finanssektorn, rådgivning eller annan relevant verksamhet.
* En akademisk examen inom ekonomi, teknik eller systemvetenskap.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med teknik och system, antingen direkt eller på affärssidan med tillämpningen av tekniken.
* Konsultarbete eller projektledning inom teknik, governance eller transformation.
* En lösningsorienterad inställning, är mycket driven och självgående.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet inom Data och/eller Data Governance, antingen teknisk erfarenhet eller med processer och införande av Data Governance
* Konsulterfarenhet.


**Meriterande erfarenheter:**
* Erfarenhet från bank, försäkring eller annan tillståndspliktig verksamhet.
* Du är drivande, samarbetsinriktad och trivs med att skapa struktur i komplexa miljöer. Framför allt gillar du att arbeta nära kunden för att leverera verklig nytta.


**Vårt erbjudande**
 Hos KPMG får du möjlighet att arbeta med ledande aktörer i finansbranschen och vara med och forma framtidens riskhantering. Som medarbetare får du stöd av en personlig Performance Manager som coachar dig i din karriär och utvecklingsplan. Du verkar i en flexibel, digital och internationell arbetsmiljö och blir del av ett starkt nätverk av specialister inom risk, regelverk, teknik och hållbarhet.
   

  

 Kulturen hos oss präglas av laganda, lärande och kvalitet och vi tror på att ge våra medarbetare frihet att växa och samtidigt ansvar att påverka. Hos KPMG får du möjlighet att utvecklas både professionellt och personligt.
   

  

**Vill du göra skillnad med oss?**
 Skicka in din ansökan redan idag, då urval sker löpande. Har du frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta vår Talent Acquisition Specialist, Hedvig Gåve på hedvig.gave@kpmg.se.

title: Embedded Solution Architect (ESA)
description:
**Build your future with Sovos.**
 If you're seeking a career where innovation meets impact, you've come to the right place. As a global leader, Sovos is transforming tax compliance from a business requirement to a force for growth while revolutionising how businesses navigate the ever-changing regulatory landscape.
   

  

 At Sovos, we're dedicated to more than just solving compliance challenges – we're committed to making a positive and lasting difference in everything we do. Our teams operate on the modern edge of digital technology, working not only to solve complex business challenges but also to enrich our personal, professional, and local communities.
   

  

 Our purpose-built systems provide the tools you need to thrive in a world where governments demand increased visibility, faster reporting and greater control over business processes. Excited about the possibilities? So are we!
   

  

 Don’t worry if you don't check all the boxes – apply anyway! We're focused on hiring the right people, not just the "right" resume. It's not about what you've done elsewhere; it's all about what you're capable of doing here.
   

  

**The Work You’ll Do**
 We are seeking a Sovos compliance knowledgeable Embedded Solution Architect (ESA) to drive the success of our embedded Independent Software Vendor (ISV) partners through strategic onboarding, technical enablement, and ongoing technical relationship management. This role primarily focuses on Sovos product technical expertise but also requires solid business acumen and collaboration skills to ensure our embedded partners maximize value from our platform while accelerating their time-to-market and revenue growth.
   

  

**More Specifically You Will**
 Partner Onboarding & Enablement
   

  

* Guide our partners through every step of their journey—from the first technical discovery to full production rollout and beyond. You’ll blend high-level strategic vision with technical expertise, ensuring seamless integrations that drive mutual success and lasting relationships.
* Lead technical discovery sessions with partner engineering teams to understand ISVs system architecture, data models, and integration requirements. Design optimal API integration patterns including RESTful APIs, webhooks, and real-time streaming connections. Evaluate authentication methods (OAuth 2.0, JWT, API keys) and recommend security best practices for each partner's specific use case. Architect data synchronization strategies, error handling protocols, and rate limiting approaches that scale with partner growth
* Design and execute comprehensive technical onboarding programs for embedded partners that educate partners on Sovos integration and usage best practices while ensuring a smooth technical integration leading to delivering great solutions in a timely manner.
* Serve as the primary technical point of contact throughout the partners lifecycle; build and maintain strong relationships with partner technical leaders, architects, and development leads.
* Advise on the design on comprehensive testing frameworks for partner integrations including unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end validation scenarios. Establish automated testing pipelines using tools like Postman, Newman, or custom test harnesses to validate API functionality across different environments.
* Create performance benchmarking protocols to ensure integrations meet latency and throughput requirements. Implement monitoring and alerting systems to proactively identify integration issues and API performance degradation
* Leverage deep understanding of our products and global e-invoicing and tax regulations to advise ISVs on the most suitable solutions for their product landscape. Partner with our compliance teams to embed the latest regulatory requirements into every integration


 Strategic Growth & Optimization
   

  

* Analyze partner technical usage patterns and business metrics to identify expansion opportunities
* Develop technical strategies to help partners optimize their integrations and improve performance
* Support partners in achieving technical milestones, certifications, and go-to-market objectives
* Facilitate connections between partners and relevant internal stakeholders for joint initiatives
* Monitor partner health metrics and proactively address risks to partnership success


 Cross-functional Collaboration
   

  

* Collaborate with internal engineering, professional services, product, and support teams to resolve technical issues and feature requests
* Work closely with Sales, Partner Account Managers, Professional Services, Support and Marketing teams to ensure aligned partner experience
* Collaborate with Product Management to influence roadmap based on partner feedback and requirements
* Partner with Engineering teams to resolve complex technical issues and drive product improvements
* Support Business Development in technical aspects of new partner evaluations and negotiations


**What We Need From You**
 Technical Skills
   

  

* Deep knowledge of Sovos Compliance technologies including eInvoicing and/or eReporting
* Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field highly recommended
* 5+ years of experience in technical customer-facing roles (Customer Success, Solutions Engineering, or Technical Account Management)
* Demonstrated experience working with ISV / embedded partners, with in-depth knowledge of ordering, purchasing, and invoice generation and exchange processes.
* Strong understanding of software development lifecycles, APIs, cloud architectures, and integration patterns
* Experience with modern development technologies (REST APIs, microservices, containerization, CI/CD)
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and DevOps practices
* Knowledge of enterprise software ecosystems and SaaS business models


 Business & Relationship Skills
   

  

* Proven track record of managing complex technical relationships with enterprise clients or partners
* Experience in partner ecosystem management, channel partnerships, or ISV relationships preferred
* Strong project management skills with ability to coordinate multiple stakeholder initiatives
* Excellent communication skills with ability to translate technical concepts for business audiences
* Experience conducting executive-level presentations and technical reviews


*Sovos is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an environment that celebrates diversity and where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate against race, color, religions, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic provided by law. At Sovos, all employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work.*
**Company Background**
 Sovos is a global provider of tax, compliance and trust solutions and services that enable businesses to navigate an increasingly regulated world with true confidence. Purpose-built for always-on compliance capabilities, our scalable IT-driven solutions meet the demands of an evolving and complex global regulatory landscape. Sovos’ cloud-based software platform provides an unparalleled level of integration with business applications and government compliance processes.
   

  

 More than 100,000 customers in 100+ countries – including half the Fortune 500 – trust Sovos for their compliance needs. Sovos annually processes more than three billion transactions across 19,000 global tax jurisdictions. Bolstered by a robust partner program more than 400 strong, Sovos brings to bear an unrivaled global network for companies across industries and geographies. Founded in 1979, Sovos has operations across the Americas and Europe, and is owned by Hg and TA Associates. For more information visit http://www.sovos.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

title: Oracle Database Administrator
description:
**About Us:** 




 At Dabster, we specialize in connecting top talent with leading global companies. We are currently seeking a skilled and dedicated
 **Oracle Database Administrator** 
 to join our client's team in
 **Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid).** 
 Our mission is to be the foremost recruitment specialist in securing exceptional talent for a diverse range of global clients.
 



  





**Who You Will Work With:** 




 Our client is a globally recognized technology company delivering IT services, consulting, and business solutions. They partner with leading organizations worldwide to drive digital transformation, leveraging innovation and deep industry expertise to solve complex business challenges.
 



  





**Job Description:** 




 The Oracle RA Senior Expert will be responsible for designing implementing and managing Oracle Zero Data Loss Recovery Appliance ZDLRA solutions for Exadata environments. This role requires deep expertise in backup and recovery strategies high availability and disaster recovery for mission critical Oracle databases.
 







**Key Responsibilities**



* Design and implement backup and recovery strategies for Oracle Exadata on premise environments
* Configure and manage Oracle Zero Data Loss Recovery Appliance ZDLRA for optimal performance and compliance
* Perform capacity planning and ensure scalability of backup infrastructure
* Integrate ZDLRA with Oracle RMAN and other backup tools
* Monitor and optimize backup performance ensuring zero data loss objectives
* Troubleshoot complex backup and recovery issues across Exadata and RA platforms
* Collaborate with DBA and infrastructure teams to ensure seamless disaster recovery readiness
* Document processes and provide knowledge transfer to operations teams



**Required Skills Experience**



* 10 years of experience in Oracle Database administration
* 5 years of hands-on experience with Oracle Exadata and ZDLRA
* Expertise in RMAN Data Guard and advanced backup recovery strategies
* Strong understanding of Oracle RAC ASM and storage architecture
* Experience with on premise Exadata deployments and integration with RA
* Familiarity with OCI Exadata Cloud Customer and hybrid backup solutions is a plus
* Certifications Preferred
* Oracle Certified Professional OCP or Oracle Certified Master OCM
* Oracle Zero Data Loss Recovery Appliance certification



**Skills**




**Mandatory Skills :** 
 OCI Database Migration, EXADATA, Oracle DBCS, Oracle RAC, ORACLE RMAN, DATAGUARD, Oracle DB Administration
 



  





**How to Apply** 




 Apply by submitting your resume today, showcasing your relevant experience and passion for the position via LinkedIn Easy Apply or directly to
 **james.a@dabster.net**

title: Legal Counsel
description:
Vi på Iver brinner för innovationer och god laganda, vi är särskilt intresserad av dig som gillar att tänka nytt och dela med dig av dina tankar. Vi söker en
 **Legal Counsel** 
 som vill bidra till bättre IT-lösningar för våra kunder. Är du vår nya kollega?
   

  

****We** 
**empower** 
**our** 
**Nordic** 
**society****
 Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation. Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort. Med huvudkontor i Stockholm verkar Iver främst i Norden med en agenda att fortsätta expandera. Iver omsätter drygt 3 miljarder SEK och har cirka 1 300 anställda som arbetar på ett av våra 23 kontor i Norden.
   

  

**Din roll på Iver**
 Iver söker en vass Legal Counsel till vårt team. I denna nyckelroll kommer du att arbeta nära olika avdelningar på Iver men med basen i det kommersiella.
   

  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**
* Kontraktshantering: Standardisera mallar, playbooks och godkännandeflöden. Gör avtal snabba, repeterbara och skalbara.
* Samarbeta med säljteamet under komplexa förhandlingar.
* Driva initiativ inom GDPR, DORA, NIS2, AI Act och ISO 27001 i samarbete med Ivers avdelning för regelefterlevnad.
* Stöd vid behov i leverantörs- och partnerskapsavtal.
* Underhålla och ta fram interna policyers.
* Utbilda organisationen för att säkerställa medvetenhet om avtalsvillkor och regler vid behov.
* Hantera tvister


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 På Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. Vi är inkluderande och strävar efter ett genuint samarbete mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi finns här för att inspirera dig till att nå dina yrkesmässiga mål. Vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden. Hos Iver är du också en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser för att vi ska utvecklas.
   

  

 Vi på Iver ger samma löfte till våra kollegor som till våra kunder. Löftet är att alltid vara ”beside you”, ”behind you” och ”before you”. Vi kallar det för "
 **The Iver way** 
 ".
   

  

**Förmåner hos oss:**
 📄 Kollektivavtal & trygga villkor
   

  

 🏠 Hybridarbete
   

  

 💪 Friskvårdsbidrag
   

  

 👓 Terminalglasögon
   

  

 ⏳ Tidsbank – 24 h extra ledighet/år
   

  

 🩺 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension (ITP) & flexpension
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
* Du strävar efter att ge god juridisk rådgivning och arbeta proaktivt och affärsmässigt för organisationens bästa.
* Du är konsekvent och flexibel i en snabbrörlig och ibland varierande miljö med flera intressenter.
* Nyfiken, självmotiverad och engagerad i ett kontinuerligt lärande.
* Du har en stark förmåga att etablera goda relationer och samarbeta med människor på alla nivåer inom organisationen.
* Vi tror att du är analytisk och har en problemlösande attityd med förmåga att effektivt hantera komplexa uppgifter och prioriteringar.
* En god stilistisk förmåga i engelska och svenska, norska är meriterande


**Kompetens och erfarenhet:**
* Juristexamen eller motsvarande juridisk utbildning
* 5+ års juridisk erfarenhet.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av kommersiella avtal och förhandlingar.
* Erfarenhet av IT-juridik och närliggande lagstiftning
* Kännedom om ISO 27001 eller liknande ramverk är ett plus.
* Goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska är ett obligatoriskt krav.
* Erfarenhet av outsourcingavtal är ett plus.
* Förmåga att hantera komplexa och pressade miljöer och prioritera uppgifter därefter.


**Placeringsort:** 
 Iver finns på 23 orter i Norden. För denna roll ser vi att du utgår från ett av våra kontor i Solna.
   

  

**Övrig information:** 
 Vi har kunder inom alla branscher och sektorer inklusive säkerhetsklassad verksamhet, därför genomför vi bakgrundskontroller i samtliga av våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

**Sök till oss!** 
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-20.**
 Välkommen att kontakta
 **selma.becirbegovic@iver.se** 
 eller
 **Kajsa.holzwart@iver.se** 
 vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

title: Embedded Solutions Business & IT architect
description:
**What You Will Help Us Achieve**
 Speed, Modularization, Automation and Rationalization across global markets for our brands, these are keywords in TRATON R&D these days. Do you want to be part of a team turning this into reality?
   

  

 We do this by developing global and certified IT-solutions to allow our global production and aftermarket solutions. With the ultimate target to deliver software fast, safe and secure on the various brands products and services. This role includes enabling the information flow, lifecycle logic and methods needed for embedded engineering across the product lifecycle. You will translate business strategies and engineering needs into processes and IT architecture supporting embedded software development.
   

  

**What Will You Do**
 You will be working on the edge of business and technology, working cross-functional and cross-brand to enable the development of the embedded engineering platform. Your drivers will be to realize, enable and evolve the Embedded engineering platform capabilities and enable Software Defined Vehicle (SDV) strategies. To realize this, you will be working with breaking down the different strategies and realize tangible capabilities to manage the strategy implementations. The main areas of expertise will be the enablement of embedded SW deliveries, focusing on re-inventing the Embedded IT and process landscape. You will use your skills in Product Data Management & Information Management, always keeping the operational Product Life cycle Management (PLM) mindset. We also need to support smooth enablement of functional safety, Cybersecurity and other legal compliance areas in our solution proposals.
   

  

**Who Are We**
 we are a small team of architects and other specialists supporting our flow teams, management and triads to change brand legacy into data driven compliant global TRATON solutions. We also give hands-on support to current product operations and development. We are working in a challenging environment balancing priority and demands from a diverse crowd of stakeholders, and we are still forming our scope and roles towards future needs. We do work very agile and are supporting continuous change and flexibility. We infuse product and project requirements with our enablement needs and visions to improve and shorten the product cycle and make the products easier to develop and maintain over time.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for you that can translate complex requirements into understandable logic. You will be translating strategic and business requirements into process, methods and IT solutions. You have extended architect experience, preferably of Scania or other TRATON brands, and modularized thinking should come natural to you. You can untangle and decode Product, Embedded engineering and IT architectures over various platforms and brands. The role requires effective communication and pedagogical skills/abilities, including leading workshops and inspiring adoption across diverse stakeholders. Experience in process development, change enablement, complex IT-landscaping and stakeholder education is
   

  

 beneficial. We love to recruit a person with a holistic IT and industrialization perspective and has own visions on how to realize this with the team and stakeholders. We believe you have effective communication and pedagogic. It is vital you can motivate users, colleagues and leaders to adopt and buy in on your ideas. You like to see the bigger picture and you enjoy sharing your view with and educate others.
   

  

**We Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally. Benefits include wellness allowance, TRATON result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes. Apply as soon as possible. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role. If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Richard de Geus Manager TGRESIA richard.de.geus@scania.com.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Business Resiliency Planner
description:
**Business Resiliency Planner - Staines, Bristol, Cheadle (Hybrid)**
 ADP is hiring a Business Resiliency Planner
   

  

* Are you looking to build a career in Business Resiliency in a global company that offers career advancement opportunities throughout your career journey?
* Are you looking to join a global company with a culture of inclusion, collaboration and belonging?


 Well, this may be the right fit for you. Ready to make your mark?
   

  

 In this role, you will be responsible for protecting the organization’s business assets through a Global Business Resiliency Program that establishes a single framework for how ADP manages, and controls risks associated with the recovery from business disruptions and disaster events.
   

  

 You will be involved in providing insight, guidance, and direction on the continued development and effectiveness of the global Business Resiliency Program. This includes foundational activities such as performing Business Impact Analyses, developing BCPs with the business, and modeling diverse types of exercises. You will leverage your technical skills and expertise developing scripts, APIs, and working with business intelligence and reporting tools and workflow automation.
   

  

 In addition to maintaining our world-class program, you will work with various business teams to coordinate exercises ranging from Plan Walkthroughs to Tabletop Exercises, and integrated testing with stakeholders such as Global Product and Technology (GPT), Crisis Management, and Business Protection & Technology Assurance (BPTA) Teams. With guidance from management, this role will collaborate with essential business functions to uncover opportunities for improvement and strategic enhancement.
   

  

 Within this role, you will have the opportunity to identify and address areas for improvement – to include areas where innovation and automation will advance ADP’s business resiliency capabilities. You will also train end users on our internal business resiliency systems, processes, and practices.
   

  

 Integrity, resilience, positivity, and a “refuse to lose” attitude are must-haves in this job. To thrive in this role, you must be eager to learn about the business, take challenges head on, be a dedicated team player, and be comfortable working in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. Interacting and communicating with our business partners to ensure their Business Continuity Program is fit for purpose is a great way to develop trust, respect, and cooperation, and keeps ADP moving forward and able to deliver world-class customer service. You will be joining an industry leading Business Resiliency Team with over one hundred years’ combined experience.
   

  

 A little about ADP: We are a global leader in human resources technology, offering the latest AI and machine learning-enhanced payroll, tax, human resources, benefits, and much more. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We’ve received recognition as a global Best Places to Work and a recipient of many prestigious awards for diversity, equity, and inclusion, including a DiversityInc® Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more. As part of our deep DEI commitment, our CEO has joined the OneTen coalition to create one million jobs for Black Americans over the next ten years. Learn more about DEI at ADP on our YouTube channel: http://adp.careers/DEI\_Videos
   

  

 Ready to #MakeYourMark? Apply now!
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Develop expertise with ADP’s business continuity systems, platforms, tools, and services, including the following activities: configure custom objects, fields, and page layouts; build workflow and approval processes; build formulas and validation rules; build reports & dashboards; build flows and process builders; configure user roles, profiles, record sharing, and security settings
* Work with vendors in troubleshooting or addressing issues with BCP tool/software and dev/test environments
* Maintain data imports/exports and troubleshoot errors/issues with BCP tools/software
* Contributes to developing, implementing, and maintaining business continuity program framework including, but not limited to, Business Impact Analysis (BIA), Business Continuity Planning (BCP), Plan Walkthrough, and Tabletop Exercising
* Responsible for ensuring BC Program governance of Business Resiliency Policy and Standard to ensure compliance with ADP's business continuity requirements
* Provides business & technical guidance to the Global Business Resiliency partners; drives engagement and accountability for Business Continuity planning and preparedness by Business Resiliency teams involved in operationalizing and executing what is required under the program.
* Become a trusted advisor and contribute to raising operational risk and business resiliency awareness throughout the organization
* Provides training and access to business continuity program resources
* Work with and facilitate discussions and business continuity planning with the Business and ensure integration of concepts/design for existing and/or new systems, software, applications, and processes critical to services. Verify that services align with Business expectations
* No supervisory responsibilities but provides informal guidance to new team members
* Provide 24x7 support for any emergency which may require activation of all or part of Global Business Resiliency plans. In the event BC activation is required, assist recovery/business resumption teams in the implementation of response and alternate operating strategies. If required, this resource would provide support on business resiliency coordination activities


**To Succeed In This Role**
* Typically requires a Bachelor’s Degree in Business, IT or Security
* Conceptual and practical expertise in Business Resiliency and basic knowledge of related disciplines.
* Ability to be a self-starter; able to work independently and as part of a team, especially remotely
* Soft skills to build client rapport and relationships, while maintaining scope, focus, and desired performance
* Must possess critical thinking skills to provide consultative solutions
* Strong analytical, organizational, and decision-making skills. Strong verbal and written communication skills; must be able to interface and coordinate work effectively with business leaders; strong project skills
* Able to interface and coordinate work efficiently and effectively with business partners and senior level management in remote locations. Team oriented self-starter, with a high degree of initiative
* Recognize and deal appropriately with sensitive and confidential information
* Detail oriented and can meet inflexible deadlines.
* Possess a mature ability to deal with stress and use sound professional judgment
* Solve practical problems and react quickly and calmly to changing or emergency circumstances.
* Willing to work extended hours including nights, weekends, and holidays. Working hours are based on the working hours of the country assigned.
* Willing to travel domestically and internationally, sometimes on short notice
* Customer support oriented


**Bonus Points For These**
* Prior experience with business continuity software or other internationally recognized tools.
* Ability to successfully deliver training in various business continuity subjects
* Fluent in multiple languages (e.g., Spanish, French, German, Italian, Portuguese )


**You'll Love Working Here Because You Can**
* Be yourself in a culture that values equity, inclusion, and belonging and creates a safe space for diverse perspectives and insights.
* Belong by joining one of nine Business Resource Groups where you can connect globally with networks and allies who share common interests and experiences.
* Grow your career in an agile, fast-paced environment with plenty of opportunities to progress.


**A little about ADP:** 
 We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down-to-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at ADP Awards and Recognition.
   

  

**Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP:** 
 ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP’s operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.
   

  

**Ethics at ADP:** 
 ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP’s culture and our full set of values.

title: Senior Penetration Tester
description:
**About Us**
 We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
   

  

 As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Senior Penetration Tester, you will play a crucial role in advising our clients as they rely on us to find vulnerabilities in their network setups, web and mobile applications, physical devices or cloud deployments. In addition, you will have an opportunity to work with some very security-minded colleagues and clients.
   

  

**Most of your daily work will revolve around security assessments where the following tasks are expected:**
* Identify vulnerabilities in applications, systems and networks.
* Document the vulnerabilities by describing them, providing reproduction and remediation steps and classifying their severity according to industry standards.
* Ensure project deadlines are met, and clients are kept up to date on meeting project milestones.
* Interact with customers in a collaborative, consultative manner to deliver world-class results.


 What we offer
   

  

 DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity.
   

  

**About You**
**You have the following**
* Proven experience as a penetration tester, with hands-on experience in ethical hacking.
* Deep understanding of cybersecurity and strong technical skills.
* Strong understanding of web application security, network security, and operating system security.
* Ability to identify vulnerabilities in both Windows and Linux systems.
* Experience with different hacking tools.


**Excellent consultant skills are essential for long term success; these soft skills will make you successful in this role:**
* Communication skills; able to adapt the message to different situations and audiences.
* Listening skills; understand the customers and be able to empathize with them.
* Relaxed attitude; able to adapt to moving requirements and ways of working.
* Constant learning attitude; not afraid to take on new challenges.


 As a Senior Penetration Tester, you actively want to stay up to date with the latest technologies. To succeed in this role, we believe you are a specialist in a particular area or technology, driven by the ambition to create a meaningful impact.
   

  

*Security and compliance with statutory requirements in the countries in which we operate is essential for DNV. Background checks will be conducted on all final candidates as part of the offer process, in accordance with applicable country-specific laws and practices.*

title: Integrationsarkitekt
description:
**Vill du forma framtidens integrationsarkitektur på SPP?** 




 Hos SPP får du möjlighet att utveckla robusta och skalbara integrationslösningar som kopplar samman våra interna system, externa partners och koncernnivåns integrationsfrågor tillsammans med Storebrand. Som Integrationsarkitekt blir du en nyckelperson i arbetet med att skapa en framtidsanpassad integrationsplattform, där säkerhet, prestanda och långsiktighet står i fokus. Du ansvarar för SPP:s core/kärnlösning, navet dit alla centrala och affärskritiska integrationer kopplas. Du arbetar nära utvecklare, andra arkitekter och integrationsteamet och får en central roll i vår molnresa, med möjlighet att påverka både strategi och tekniska lösningar.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 I rollen som Integrationsarkitekt driver du SPP:s arbete med en enhetlig och framtidsanpassad integrationsarkitektur. Du tar fram, vidareutvecklar och förvaltar arkitekturen för att säkerställa effektiva och skalbara lösningar för både interna system och externa partners. Rollen innebär nära samarbete med utvecklare, andra arkitekter och integrationsteamet, och du bidrar med teknisk expertis, strategiskt tänkande och en proaktiv inställning till säkerhet och prestanda. Du deltar i kodning av proof-of-concepts, utvärderar nya tekniker och verktyg och stödjer teamet i att realisera integrationer på ett långsiktigt hållbart sätt, med ett helhetsperspektiv på SPP:s core/lösning och koncernövergripande integrationsfrågor.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som har** 




**Krav:** 



* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom system-/datavetenskap eller motsvarande
* Bakgrund som integrationsutvecklare och arbetat med huvudansavar för arkitekturfrågor med fokus på integrationer
* Erfarenhet av cloudmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en miljö med CI/CD pipelines.
* Docker / Kubernetes
* Flytande svenska och engelska



  





**Meriterande:** 



* Erfarenhet av försäkring/bank och plattformar som Lumera, Salesforce eller Snowflake
* Erfarenhet av API-management och meddelandesystem (t.ex. Kafka)
* Våra integrationer är skrivna i Java



  





**Om oss** 




 SPP är en del av norska finanskoncernen Storebrand. Tillsammans skapar vi en framtid att glädjas åt genom att vägleda till ekonomiska beslut som gynnar individen, samhället och planeten långsiktigt.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar vi med Ants Tech Recruiters. Läs mer och ansök via deras annons här: Integrationsarkitekt till SPP - Ants
 



  





 Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta gärna rekryteringsansvarig Louise Wernblom på louise.wernblom@ants.se. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande – så vänta inte med din ansökan!
 



  





*Med kandidatens samtycke görs en bakgrundskontroll under anställningsprocessens slutskede som innebär kontroll av personalia, ekonomiska förhållanden och juridiska frågor. Även CV och annan ansökningsdokumentation kan komma att verifieras.*

title: Sr. Software Engineer
description:
**Senior Backend Developer – Join Us in Building the Future of Dairy Farming at DeLaval**
 Are you a seasoned backend developer who enjoys solving real-world problems with clean, scalable code? Do you want your work to have a meaningful impact beyond the screen? At DeLaval, we’re looking for a technically driven and collaborative S
 **enior Backend Developer** 
 to join our cross-functional team developing
 **DeLaval Plus** 
 – our digital platform supporting modern dairy farmers around the world.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
 In this role, you’ll work closely with
 **Product Owners, Project Managers, Scrum Masters, UX Designers, QA Engineers, and other developers** 
 to build and maintain the backend services powering the
 **DeLaval Plus** 
 website. You’ll be involved in the
 **entire feature lifecycle** 
 – from design and development to testing, deployment, monitoring, and incident handling.
   

  

 You’ll help shape robust,
 **secure, scalable, and observable backend services** 
 using modern, cloud-native technologies. This role is ideal for someone who’s excited to deliver
 **reliable systems at scale** 
 , enjoys working with
 **data-intensive applications** 
 , and is passionate about making a difference in the lives of real users.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Design, build, and maintain backend services for DeLaval Plus
* Collaborate with a cross-functional team to deliver high-quality features end to end
* Write secure and testable APIs following OWASP and clean code principles
* Manage infrastructure and deployments using modern IaC and DevOps tools
* Work on data-heavy services that are central to our platform’s performance and reliability
* Monitor services in production, respond to incidents, and continuously improve system resilience
* Contribute to our culture of learning and knowledge sharing


**Qualifications**
 We’re looking for someone with
 **at least 7 years of backend development experience** 
 . You should also have a
 **solid foundation in computer science** 
 , with strong knowledge of
 **algorithms, data structures, and system design** 
 .
   

  

 You also have hands-on experience with most or all of the following:
   

  

* Languages & Runtime: JavaScript, TypeScript, Node.js, npm
* Cloud & Infrastructure: AWS (Lambda, S3, DynamoDB, RDS, VPC), CDK, Kubernetes, Terraform
* Architecture & Patterns: REST API development, API security (authentication, authorization, OWASP best practices), event-driven architecture
* Testing & Quality: Jest (unit testing), Cypress (E2E), JMeter (load testing), SonarQube
* DevOps & Observability: Git, CI/CD pipelines, Docker, Grafana, Loki, Sentry, OpsGenie
* Best Practices: Clean code, secure coding, code reviews, production monitoring, incident response
* Special Focus: Experience working with data-intensive and high-traffic applications
* Computer Science Fundamentals: Algorithms, data structures, system design


**Who You Are**
 You’re not just a developer – you’re a team player and a problem solver. We believe you’ll thrive here if you:
   

  

* Take responsibility for your work and follow through
* Have strong technical curiosity and a drive to continuously learn
* Are proactive and enjoy taking initiative
* Value collaboration and helping others succeed
* Have experience handling incidents and working with customer service to improve production systems
* Have worked with production-grade systems and understand the importance of qu ality, reliability, and supportability
* Are fluent in English (required) and preferably also in Swedish
* Are able and willing to work from our Tumba office at least 3 days per week


****Why DeLaval?****
 DeLaval is a global leader in dairy farming technology. We combine over 135 years of experience with cutting-edge digital innovation. By joining us, your code won’t just power a website – it’ll help farmers feed the world in a more sustainable way.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely.
   

  

 Applications close on September 26. Please ensure your application is submitted before then. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us. Apply today and help us shape the future of farming — one clean, simple line of code at a time. We’re growing our team and looking for more developers! Visit our careers page to explore all open roles.
   

  

**Contact**
 Hiring manager: Magnus Storbjörk, magnus.storbjork@delaval.com
   

  

 Recruiter: Agnes Edbom, agnes.edbom@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions. Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group. See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Solution Architect - SAP Transportation Management
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 Scania is undergoing a big business transformation program for industrial operations and with that building the Industrial ERP backbone based on SAP S/4HANA. This will allow Scania to be more data centric, have a single source of truth and a modular IT landscape to enable speed and flexibility for existing and new business models. Having the standards and fundamentals in place, we will increase our agility and rapidly differentiate where we can have a competitive advantage.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We are looking for SAP Transportation Management Solution Architect to join our team who have an interest to work with business change development and world-class IT deliveries. An important part of the change in the IT landscape will be deliveries based on SAP. As an SAP Solution Architect you are a member of the Scania SAP IT team at Digital Core. If you like challenges, now is the perfect time to join this exciting journey.
   

  

 You will get to be a part of an exciting environment where we are setting the future IT landscape for our procurement, production & logistics and finance processes. Our SAP deliveries are an important part of the change and we can see and hear the value in that. You get to be involved in setting up and enhancing the global template and drive activities in the ongoing and upcoming project releases for transport management. On top of that, you will lead initiatives to look into available SAP products in this area and identify potential fits for Scania
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 In these projects, you will be in the forefront to design architecture based on process requirements and application and system landscape. You need to also guard the integrity of the solution and stick to standard. When required, analyze and define requirements for customer-specific development needs or integration requirements, support in the review process and also support in the change process.
   

  

 Our environment is open to your suggestions! Depending on your interest and skills, other tasks can be combined in your daily tasks for the best job possible!
   

  

**Who You Are**
* 5+ years’ experience in SAP transportation management area
* Knowledge and understanding of transport management processes and carrier communication is required
* Experience in each phase of the complete SAP TM project lifecycle required
* Strong stakeholder management with the different departments (business, IT, IT suppliers,…)
* Holistic thinking combined with a pragmatic approach
* Knowledge in SAP BN4L, SAP Yard Logistics and connecting areas like warehousing (SAP EWM) or operational procurement (S/4HANA) would be an advantage
* SAP BTP experience would be an advantage
* Experience from automotive industry would be an advantage
* Excellent communication skills in English, Swedish an added plus


 Beside those experiences you get to bring out your solution-oriented and creative mindset to help us deliver results.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: andy.arens@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Experienced SAP S/4HANA consultant - Business controlling
description:
At PBS Nordics, a Capgemini business unit, we empower individuals to shape their careers within a collaborative global community.
   

  

 Specializing in ERP transformation services for both public and private sectors, PBS Nordics delivers tailored solutions using top ERP systems like SAP, Microsoft Dynamics, and IFS. With a strong Nordic presence and a diverse global client portfolio, we guide organizations through seamless ERP transformations, driving operational excellence and strategic growth.
   

  

**Your Role**
 As a business controlling consultant you will be responsible for optimizing end-to-end cost controlling and decision making processes, delivering client value in complex and innovative SAP programs for leading global organizations. This including:
   

  

* Lead the design, configuration, and implementation of SAP S/4HANA controlling modules, ensuring alignment with business requirements and best practices.
* Provide strategic advice and expertise to clients on SAP S/4HANA controlling areas including e.g. cost accounting, product costing/variance analysis, transfer pricing, management reporting and margin analysis.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to integrate SAP S/4HANA FICO with other SAP modules (e.g., SD, MM, PP, WM, PM) and external systems.
* Manage and mentor junior consultants, fostering their professional development and ensuring high-quality project delivery.
* Stay current with industry trends, the latest developments in SAP S/4HANA controlling, and emerging technologies to continuously enhance service delivery.


**Your Profile**
* Passionate about S/4Hana, growing people and delivering client value.
* At least 5 years of hands-on experience and proven track record in implementing SAP business controlling solutions in a complex environment.
* Strong understanding of business controlling processes and best practices with the ability to align SAP solutions with business objectives.
* Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment and strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Relevant SAP certification is highly desirable.
* Experience from both Greenfield and brownfield projects is a plus.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* A challenging career in a vibrant environment with access to extensive training, a global network of experts and an innovative culture that promotes learning, growth, and shared success.
* Opportunities to work on real-world problems and help transform leading organizations.
* A company culture driven by core values: Honesty, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, modesty, Fun, and Boldness.
* A strong commitment to inclusion, diversity, and supporting the whole person.


**Application**
*In this recruitment process, we review applications and hire on an ongoing basis. As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted.*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Senior Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE
description:
We are currently looking to strengthen our organization with developers who have business analyst knowledge of the Dynamics platform and experience with integration technologies in the Azure platform to work on a customer management and trading platform.
   

  

 With your team, you directly contribute to Vattenfall’s vision to become fossil-free within one generation and enable customers to make that choice.
   

  

 You will become part of Customer IT. Customer IT develops and operates specialized IT solutions closely together with business colleagues to create value for our customers. Customer IT is set up locally, in Sweden, Germany, Netherlands, and Poland. Customer IT Nordics is divided into four teams located in Sweden.
   

  

**Your Tasks And Responsibilities**
* You will provide expertise in the areas of implementation of an ongoing project, governance, and technical support to ensure software solutions are designed, developed, and implemented in Dynamics and Azure to meet business needs.
* You will assist in planning, designing, and customizing new Dynamics solutions.
* You will also work with continuous improvements of the delivered services.
* You are a person who wants to develop colleagues by proactively coaching and supporting them.


**Qualifications**
**Key Objectives in the role:**
* Dynamics 365 CE Solution Design.
* Dynamics 365 CE Plug-in Development.
* Integrations and technologies built in Azure.


**As Our Senior Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE You**
* Have at least 3-5 years of related experience in developing and supporting Dynamics 365 CE Online Sales applications.
* Have experience in working in Azure.
* Are fluent in Swedish in writing and verbally.
* Worked in an agile environment and practiced agile software development.
* Are self-motivated, proactive and analytical.


 Additional Information
   

  

**Our Offer**
 We offer a challenging and international work environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues as ‘Ask and Share’ concept is essential for the way we work. We offer attractive employment conditions (smart working, flexible working hours and a good work-life balance) and opportunities for personal and professional development. Click here for further information.
   

  

**Location**
 Solna, Sweden
   

  

**For more information** 
 about the position you are welcome to contact hiring manager Vidhu Agarwal vidhu.agarwal@vattenfall.com. For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our recruiter Ewa Krajewska at ewa.krajewska@vattenfall.com
   

  

 Trade Union representatives in Sweden via Vattenfall´s switchboard +46 8 739 50 00.
   

  

**We welcome your application in English** 
 . We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website and that you refrain from submitting a cover letter with your application. You apply quickly and easily by answering screening questions and attaching your CV.
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be a good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. Click here for further information.
   

  

 The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall.
   

  

 Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**Company Description**
 Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 21 000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years.

title: Hardware Systems Architect - Pluggable Optical Coherent Transceivers
description:
**Job Description**
 In an increasingly connected world, the pandemic has highlighted just how essential telecom networks are to keeping society running. The
 **Network Infrastructure** 
 group is at the heart of a revolution to connectivity, pushing the boundaries to deliver more and faster network capacity to people worldwide through our ambition, innovation, and technical expertise
   

  

 Join
 **Optical Networks** 
**division** 
 , where innovation meets scale in the AI-driven data center era. With the recent acquisition of Infinera, we’ve united two industry leaders to create an optical networking powerhouse—combining cutting-edge technology with proven leadership to redefine the future of connectivity.
   

  

**How You Will Contribute And What You Will Learn**
 Nokia develops leading DWDM transmission systems. Key components of the optical transport system are coherent line interfaces consisting of Digital Signal Processors and optical electrical conversion for best-in-class cost, data rate, reach and power consumption – e.g. in transponder and muxponder units – providing mapping of client signals, signal supervision, traffic protection and similar functions with Tbit/s throughput. Another key component in the transformation and development of the way optical networks are built are optical coherent pluggable modules.
   

  

 The Hardware system architect for XR pluggable modules develops and maintains the product architecture and detailed product features and requirements based on market requirements and industry feature requests for those coherent modules.
   

  

 HW Architect coordinates and leads cross-functional concepts preparing for smooth transition in the development organization and coordinates feature teams and provides technical & directional support to R&D, product management and customer teams.
   

  

**Primary responsibilities and key success factors are:**
 Develop innovative, competitive product architectures and concepts for optical coherent pluggable modules:
   

  

* Alignment of requirements and concepts and integration of Digital Signal Processor ASICs, Optics, FW & SW into best-in-class coherent interfaces
* Understanding of business requirements, use cases and operational concepts,
* Trade-off between cost, function, capacity and performance,
* Up-to-date, deep technical understanding of coherent interfaces and their application, including hand-on HW development experience, thorough understanding of coherent modulation formats, and optical components used in coherent receivers and transmitters,
* A good technical understanding of optical network equipment and optical network design in general,
* The ability to lead a cross-functional team of experts to a successful implementation of coherent pluggable modules.


**The tasks include:**
 Work in international, cross-functional product teams (product management, optical transmission experts, ASIC developers, integrated photonics technologists and component experts, HW, FW & SW developers) to facilitate & build consensus on innovative solutions meeting the product and customer requirements and schedule and cost constraints; break down product functions and requirements into functions and building blocks for the coherent pluggable modules.
   

  

 Technical thought leadership and innovation capability.
   

  

**Key Skills And Experience**
* The candidate requires a MSc/PhD degree in communications, electrical engineering or a related field and a minimum of 5+ years working experience in HW development of of coherent optical interfaces.
* In-depth knowledge of relevant telecommunication standard, optical coherent transmission technology, network protocols, trends and emerging technologies with focus on coherent systems.
* Experience with different CPU platforms and bus protocols like I2C, MDIO, SPI, PCIe, AMBRA (AXI)
* Experience in leading HW design and HW architecture of coherent pluggable modules or related telecommunications products.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills and ability to work in a multi-disciplinary, multi-site and multi-national team environment.
* Self-directed and highly motivated.


**About Us**
**Come create the technology that helps the world act together**
 Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.
   

  

 We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work
   

  

**What we offer**
 Nokia offers continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.
   

  

**Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer**
 Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:
   

  

* One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
* Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
* Workplace Pride Global Benchmark


 At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
   

  

 We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.
   

  

 Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

title: Validation Engineer
description:
**Bring more to life.**


Are you ready to accelerate your potential and make a real difference within life sciences, diagnostics and biotechnology?


Together with Danaher’s 15+ other operating companies, we unlock the transformative potential of cutting-edge science and technology to improve billions of lives every day.


You’ll thrive in a culture of belonging where you and your unique viewpoint matter. And by harnessing Danaher’s system of continuous improvement, you help turn ideas into impact – innovating at the speed of life.


HemoCue is a leading provider of point-of-care diagnostic solutions, enabling healthcare practitioners across clinical settings and geographies to improve patient outcomes and clinical workflows. For more than four decades we’ve been advancing what’s possible at the point of care. HemoCue offers point-of-care testing for hemoglobin, glucose and HbA1c as well as total and differential white blood cell count.


The *Validation engineer* for HemoCue is responsible for process validation and calibration in our production.


This position is part of the Integrated Engineering within operations located in Ängelholm and will be on-site. At HemoCue, our purpose is clear: advancing care, test by test, everywhere. Care is the bedrock upon which we stand. It’s manifested in our devices, our people and how we interact with the world.


You will be a part of the Integrated Engineering Operations and report to the Director Integrated Engineering responsible for maintaining production capacity. If you thrive in a senior validation role and want to work to build a world-class organization supporting medtech production, read on.

**In this role, you will have the opportunity to:**

* Lead and ensure process validations, including validation of methods (instrumentation) and software systems (both instrument and production environments).
* Plan and perform measurement system analyses
* Guide colleagues on validation matters
* Take the lead in executing and documenting validation activities
* Assist during audits regarding process validation-related questions
* Design and conduct experiments to improve manufacturing processes
* Use statistical methods as a basis for decision-making

**The essential requirements of the job include:**

* University degree in engineering or equivalent, with experience in similar positions
* Knowledge of FDA, CFR Part 820, and ISO 13485
* Broad validation experience, minimum 3 years
* Ability to apply statistical methods to practical problems

**It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:**

* Measurement technology
* Vision system


Union contacts: Henrik Pommer, Unionen, +46 431 481 244 or Katarina Cooper, Akademikerföreningen, +46 431 481 302


Join a winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.


For more information, visit www.danaher.com.


Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.


For more information, visit www.danaher.com.
company_description: HemoCue - part of the Radiometer Group, develops, produces and markets medical diagnostic products for Point of Care testing.
