title: Field Sales Engineer (Instrumentation)
description:
Are you a professional seeking a new challenge in a dynamic and fast developing business? By joining us in **Stockholm, Sweden** as **Field Sales Engineer (Instrumentation),** you will become part of the Nordics Global Sales team, with immediate responsibilities for **Central Sweden** .


This role is essential for primarily developing, as well as maintaining and improving direct customer contacts and relationships in line with the defined "Go to Market" philosophy for Manufacturers /Original Equipment Manufacturing companies (OEM’s). By engaging with our customers, you will work towards delivering the company's ambitious growth targets. The focus is on selling and promoting products, services, concepts, and solutions offered by the **Measurement Solutions Business Unit.**

**Let's Go, together!** We offer a dynamic environment where individual contributions and inventions are valued and provide opportunities for training and self-development.


Please note we follow a process of continuous selection and will close the vacancy as soon as we find the right candidate, so do not delay submitting the application.  



**In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:**

* Promoting products and services across the assigned sales area
* Visiting key accounts and prospects to assess potential and strengthen relationships
* Understanding customer drivers and staying current with their business needs
* Preparing annual booking budgets by product, value and period
* Submitting call plans, analyses and reports with timely accuracy
* Reporting sales plans and project potential through CRM updates
* Liaising with internal teams to prioritize quotations and maintain service levels
* Participating in relevant industry events

**Who You Are:**

You actively listen and check for understanding, and you adjust communication content and style to meet the needs of diverse stakeholders.


Your proactive approach to identifying and pursuing new business opportunities sets you apart. You diligently seek out and engage potential clients with enthusiasm and determination, always aiming to expand the customer base and drive sales growth.


You anticipate customer needs and provide services that are beyond customer expectations. You use customer insights to drive and guide the development of new offerings.


You create teamwork, allowing others across the organization to achieve shared objectives, fostering collaboration and ensuring that everyone works together towards common goals.  



**For This Role, You Will Need:**

* Technical degree, or equivalent experience
* Proven **sales / business development** experience in a **commercial role**
* Exposure to **industrial automation environment** (e.g. chemical, petrochemical, oil & gas, power, life science, refining), with a good **technical understanding (ideally measuring instrumentation)**
* CRM & MS Office tools
* Proficiency in **English and Swedish language**
* **Willingness to travel** in the country and regionally
* **Driver’s license**

**Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:**

* Previous experience with flow measurement solutions
* Matrix organization experience
* Interest in energy efficiency and sustainability

**Our Culture & Commitment to You**

At Emerson, we prioritize a workplace where every employee is valued, respected, and empowered to grow. We foster an environment that encourages innovation, collaboration, and diverse perspectives—because we know that great ideas come from great teams.


Our commitment to ongoing career development and growing an inclusive culture ensures you have the support to thrive. Whether through mentorship, training, or leadership opportunities, we invest in your success so you can make a lasting impact. We believe diverse teams, working together are key to driving growth and delivering business results.  



**What We Offer**

* A varied and creative role in the exciting and fast-growing field of automation
* Excellent opportunities for personal growth and long-term career development within EMERSON, a global leader
* A supportive and welcoming atmosphere within our dynamic Nordic team
* An international environment where motivated people truly make an impact
* Flexible working hours and the option to partially work from home
* A neutral company car available for both business and private use
* An attractive sales incentive plan (SIP) / bonus program
* Collective Agreement (Teknikavtalet)
* Pension plan
* Accident and life insurance
* Other (computer glasses, wellness allowance, subsidized lunch, optional insurances and many more)

  
**WHY EMERSON**

**Our Commitment to Our People**

At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration.


We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You’ll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor.


At Emerson, you’ll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let’s go. Let’s think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let’s go, together.


**Accessibility Assistance or Accommodation**

If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com .  



**ABOUT EMERSON**

Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability.


With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety.


We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you’ll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team – let’s go!


**No calls or agencies please.**
company_description: Emerson combines industry knowledge, manufacturing expertise, and technological innovation to offer a broad range of products and services.

title: Mechatronics Engineer Specialist
description:
**Company Description**  

Are you looking for a company that offers varied assignments and gives you the chance to work with innovation and new technology? At SEGULA Technologies, you will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects and help shape the digital domain while receiving support towards your dream career. Competence development is a big part of SEGULA Technologies DNA and we are always looking for new, brilliant and bold talents. Does this sound exciting? Join us on our journey in a fast-growing international company.

 **Job Description**  

We are looking for an experienced mechatronic hardware developer specializing in oil, cooling, or fluid-related systems.  

You will develop components for oil and cooling systems. The role covers the full development cycle—from early concept work to ongoing product maintenance. As product owners, we take broad responsibility for our components and collaborate closely with functions such as purchasing, quality, operations, and other engineering teams.


We believe you are a curious, self-driven person with a proactive, can-do mindset. Your previous experience has helped you develop strong analytical abilities and an understanding of structured product development processes. You pay close attention to detail and take initiative when necessary. You also have a solid understanding of component functionality and system behaviour.

 **Qualifications*** Master’s degree in Product Development, Mechatronics, or a related field.
* Experience in developing fluid system components (e.g., pumps, valves), with strong understanding of component functionality, system requirements, testing, technical documentation, and supplier interactions.
* Experience in developing mechatronic components with integrated or “smart” actuators, including defining technical requirements and supporting software verification and validation.
* Experience working with supplier-developed components and managing Statements of Work (SOW).
* Basic knowledge of 3D CAD tools is an advantage.

 **Additional Information**  

To thrive in this role, we see that you enjoy collaborating and that you are proactive and take initiative. To apply for this position, you must have a valid work visa within the European Union. We value diversity and equality and place great importance on your personal qualities. We are recruiting continuously, so please apply today.
company_description: SEGULA is a gobal engineering group helping boost competitiveness within all of the major industrial sectors.

title: Software Test Automation Engineer
description:
**Software Test Automation Engineer**
=====================================

Functional area: Research and Development
Location: Sweden
City: Stockholm
Company name: Atlas Copco Industrial Technique AB
Date of posting: Nov 26, 2025  

**Your role**
-------------

  


As a Software Test Automation Engineer, you are part of a cross-functional Scrum team consisting of backend developers, frontend developers, and testers (usually one tester per team). You collaborate closely with the Product Owner and stakeholders to define features, ensure quality, and deliver agreed functionality. Your responsibilities include creating automated tests for regression, maintaining the automation suite, identifying issues, and occasionally participating in manual regression testing. You also contribute to improving our test processes and strategies within the line organization.

  



We develop premium solutions that enhance performance, safety, and sustainability in the manufacturing industry. Our systems empower users worldwide to optimize and control their assembly processes.

  



You report to the Team Manager Software Test Office, R&D.

  

You will:


* Develop and maintain automated tests using Python and Pytest.
* Ensure features meet agreed requirements and quality standards.
* Collaborate with developers and stakeholders to define and verify functionality.
* Maintain and improve the automated regression suite.
* Participate in manual regression testing when needed.
* Contribute to continuous improvement of test processes and strategies.
**To succeed, you will need**
-----------------------------

  

* Senior experience in test automation using Python and Pytest.
* Familiarity with Selenium, and Agile methodologies.
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines and tools like Jira (preferred).
**In return, we offer**
-----------------------


* Culture of trust and accountability
* Lifelong learning and career growth
* Innovation powered by people
* Comprehensive compensation and benefits
* Health and well-being
**Job location**
----------------

  

This role offers a hybrid working arrangement, allowing you to split your time between working remotely and being on-site in Stockholm, Sweden (SE).

  


**Uniting curious minds**  

Behind every innovative solution, there are people working together to transform the future. With careers sparked by initiative and lifelong learning, we unite curious minds, and you could be one of them.
company_description: Atlas Copco provides compressed air and gas equipment, industrial power tools, construction equipment, and industrial vacuum equipment, as well as service and maintenance. www.atlascopco.com

title: Senior Mechanical Design Engineer - Wave Energy
description:
Working at CorPower Ocean you will be part of a world-class team, determined to make a big impact. We are on a mission to bring reliable and competitive wave energy to the world. We offer a high degree of autonomy and flexibility, combined with great personal responsibility. CorPower Ocean is a global leader in wave energy, with a technology that has shown game-changing performance. Your work will contribute to the global transition to renewable energy by unlocking one of the largest untapped sources of clean energy on earth.


**The Role**


The Mechanical team in CorPower is looking for a senior design engineer experienced in industrial equipment design to take a leading role in the development and optimisation of our innovative wave energy converters.


The role will be working closely with the mechanical design team but will involve a large amount of interaction with our entire organisation, requiring good collaboration skills.


**Responsibilities**


* Design of mechanical structures and mechanisms (from concept to release-for-production) Design of mechanical structures & mechanisms (from concept to release-for-production)
* Present to cross-disciplinary stakeholders during design reviews
* Perform structural analysis (hand calculation and FEA)
* Produce technical documentation for internal use & 3rd party verification and certification
* Perform failure mode, effects and criticality analysis for modules and system
* Manage your systems and components to meet performance, schedule and budget targets
* Investigate new solutions to improve performance, reliability or manufacturability
* Interface with requirement, supply chain, manufacturing and field-testing teams
* Support and coach more junior engineers
* Support assembly, testing, and pilot installations in the field

**Skills an****d Software**

You have a minimum of 10 years of relevant experience from designing mechanical systems and industrial equipment.


You have a work history where you have successfully led full product development cycles from design, build, test, deploy/release/produce for different projects.


You have a broad technical knowledge and genuine interest in the different aspects of machinery and mechanical design. Knowledge of mooring, gear box technology, pneumatics, hydraulics, structural optimization, pressure vessel, fabrication, sensors, routings and/or electricity generation equipment is qualifying.


You have experience working with Creo CAD, Windchill PLM and ANSYS for structural analysis. If you have experience with equivalent software and willing to get up to speed, this also qualifies.


You may have a B.Sc or a M.Sc. degree in mechanical engineering or related disciplines, but your personality, experience and interest in the field is the most important. You are proficient in English, both spoken and written. Your personality, experience and interest in the field are the most important and what is most highly valued at CorPower.


**As a person:**


* You are striving for excellence, put quality into everything you do
* You are self-motivated and constantly seek the most efficient ways to work
* You always search for simple and elegant solutions to difficult problems
* You love to learn new things, and take pride in constantly developing your skills
* You are persistent, knowing it takes stamina to reach pioneering goals
* You see your tasks through to completion
* You are comfortable in presenting your solutions internally and externally
* You are data driven and strive to always back your points with solid analysis

CorPower Ocean has a highly diversified team with many nationalities and backgrounds, all working towards the same goal. This is something we are very proud of. We are not perfect yet, but we hope you share our aim to achieve higher equality.

title: Test & Validation Engineer
description:
If you want to shape the quality of next-generation in-vehicle experiences – and see your testing expertise come alive in real machines – this could be your next step. We’re looking for a Test & Validation Engineer who enjoys working close to both hardware and software, designing smart test strategies, and ensuring that our infotainment platforms deliver reliable, high-performing user experiences.

**About us**
------------


CPAC Systems develops advanced control systems for marine and industrial applications. Since 1999, we’ve been turning complex operations into intuitive experiences. With 250 employees, a portfolio of 50 patents and more than 500,000 delivered products per year, we drive innovation in everything from electrification to intelligent automation, always working at the intersection of safety, efficiency and user experience. As part of Volvo Group, our role is to lead advanced technology development and explore the next generation of smart control systems.

**Your role**
-------------


As a Test & Validation Engineer, you will be responsible for ensuring the performance, stability and reliability of our Android-based infotainment ECUs. You will design test plans, validate system behavior across hardware and software layers, and work hands-on with major Android OS upgrades.


In this role, you will automate tests using Python, perform regression and compatibility testing, and collaborate closely with developers and system engineers to identify, analyze and resolve defects. Your work will directly impact customer experience and the robustness of our products in marine and industrial applications.


This is a hands-on role where you will turn technical requirements into effective test strategies, ensuring that our platforms meet high quality standards throughout the development lifecycle.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Develop and execute test plans for Android-based infotainment systems and ECUs
* Validate functionality, performance and system stability across hardware and software layers
* Automate test cases using Python or similar scripting languages
* Support Android OS upgrade validation, including regression testing and compatibility checks
* Collaborate with developers and system engineers to analyze issues and improve product quality
* Maintain clear and structured test documentation and reports

**Key qualifications**
----------------------

* Experience testing automotive infotainment systems or embedded platforms
* Familiarity with Android/AOSP testing frameworks and tools
* Proficiency in Python for test automation
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken

**It’s a plus if you also bring**
---------------------------------

* Experience validating OS upgrades or platform migrations
* Knowledge of automotive communication protocols and hardware interfaces

**Who you are**
---------------


You see complex systems as full of possibilities and enjoy working hands-on to understand how each part connects. You stay current in your field and willingly share your knowledge with others. You appreciate having responsibility from start to finish and are comfortable challenging assumptions to find smarter and more efficient solutions. With a solid understanding of both hardware and software, and how they interact, you bring clarity, solve problems and help turn ideas into reliable real-world systems.

**How to apply**
----------------


Submit your application today and feel free to reach out to David Andersson at *david.andersson2@cpacsystems.se* if you have any questions regarding the job.

title: System Engineer for Automotive Android Platform
description:
If you want to shape the foundation of next-generation in-vehicle experiences – and see your system engineering expertise come alive in real machines – this could be your next step. We’re looking for a System Engineer who enjoys working between hardware and software, defining system requirements, and helping teams build world-class infotainment and operator-interface solutions.

**About us**
------------


CPAC Systems develops advanced control systems for marine and industrial applications. Since 1999, we’ve been turning complex operations into intuitive experiences. With 250 employees, a portfolio of 50 patents and more than 500,000 delivered products per year, we drive innovation in everything from electrification to intelligent automation, always working at the intersection of safety, efficiency and user experience. As part of Volvo Group, our role is to lead advanced technology development and explore the next generation of smart control systems.

**Your role**
-------------


As a System Engineer, you will play an important role in defining and integrating complex infotainment systems. You’ll work where hardware, the Android platform and customer requirements meet, making sure everything fits together into a reliable, well-performing system.


You will define system architecture and technical requirements, coordinate integration across hardware and software, and support teams with system-level knowledge throughout the development process. You’ll work closely with developers, testers and customers to ensure high-quality, user-friendly solutions for marine and industrial applications.


This is a hands-on role where you will influence design, drive integration and turn technical requirements into production-ready systems.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Define system architecture and technical requirements for infotainment ECUs and integrated systems based on customer and supplier needs
* Coordinate integration between hardware, the Android platform and middleware components
* Analyze and solve system-level issues across hardware and software
* Work closely with developers, testers and customers to secure high-quality, user-focused solutions
* Maintain system documentation and interface specifications

**Key qualifications**
----------------------

* Strong system thinking and the ability to understand complex technical setups
* Good understanding of infotainment systems and ECU architecture
* Experience with system-level design and integration in embedded environments
* Familiarity with Android/AOSP and Linux-based systems
* Knowledge of automotive communication protocols such as Ethernet, CAN and GMSL
* Ability to read logs, debug system-level issues and suggest solutions
* Fluent in English

**Who you are**
---------------


You see complex systems as full of possibilities and enjoy working hands-on to understand how each part connects. You stay current in your field and willingly share your knowledge with others. You appreciate having responsibility from start to finish and are comfortable challenging assumptions to find smarter and more efficient solutions. With a solid understanding of both hardware and software, and how they interact, you bring clarity, solve problems and help turn ideas into reliable real-world systems.

**How to apply**
----------------


Submit your application today and feel free to reach out to David Andersson at *david.andersson2@cpacsystems.se* if you have any questions.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
**Full Stack Engineer - Erika Insurance** 




 Do you want to help shape the future of our platforms in a modern Azure environment and leverage AI and automation throughout the development lifecycle? We are looking for a
 **Full Stack Engineer** 
 who combines technical expertise in .NET and cloud architecture with a strong sense of structure, quality, and agile methodologies. You’ll be a key member of a small team where your contribution will have a direct impact, while also being part of a truly global business.
 



  





 Interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis, and we aim to fill the position as soon as possible. Submit your application today!
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Work on architecture and development in .NET/C#, Vue.js., Azure – from backend to integrations and user interfaces – ensuring high-quality deliveries and clean code.
* Participate in, and occasionally lead, technical testing and test automation initiatives.
* Contribute to the development of new and improved security strategies.
* Operate within structured yet pragmatic workflows, using backlogs and visual tools to provide clarity and focus for the team and stakeholders.
* Play an important role in ensuring the team works efficiently and transparently.



  





 You will report directly to Erika’s EVP Technology.
 



  





**Requirements** 



* Relevant IT education and at least 2 years of experience with .NET/C#, Azure, Vue.js., or related technologies.
* Relevant experience of testing.
* Understanding of API architecture and design patterns, including REST.
* Commitment to secure coding practices and awareness of compliance/privacy considerations.
* Enjoys working in an agile environment and has an interest in improving structure, workflows, backlogs, and visual tools to support team success.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills across technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Fluency in both Swedish and English, spoken and written.



  





**Desirable** 



* Experience with CI/CD and DevOps tools.
* Advanced experience in Azure, such as API gateways, Function Apps, Front Door, Data Factory and SQL server.
* Experience with Azure B2C, especially custom policies.
* UI design and prototyping experience in Figma.
* Experience with AI-driven development.
* Strong interest in emerging machine learning.



  





**We Offer** 



* An organization with few boundaries on what’s possible.
* The opportunity to help develop the next generation of our platforms in a modern cloud environment, applying AI and automation.
* Significant responsibility and varied tasks.
* The chance to take on challenges through collaboration with an action-oriented mindset.
* A work environment where your experience is valued, and where we encourage initiative and continuous improvement.
* The ability to combine strategic and technical development with influence over work methods and structure.
* A small core team within a truly global business.



  





**Other Information** 



* Start: Immediately
* Scope: Full-time
* Location: In-person - Strandvägen, Stockholm
* Recruiting Manager: Stefan Eriksson



  





**About Erika Insurance** 




 Erika Insurance, part of EF Education First, is a Swedish insurance company. For over 30 years, our mission has been to protect travelers as they discover new places, explore new cultures, and learn more about the world and themselves. We are a small and dynamic team in a flat organization where ideas become reality in a short time span. Learn more at https://erikainsurance.com.
 



  





**About EF Education First** 




 Some companies are in the business of technology. Others in finance, sports, or soft drinks. At EF, we’re in a different kind of business – one that’s less tangible, but far more important. Because what we do makes everything else possible. We’re in the Business of Understanding – between people – between cultures.
 



  





 For 60 years, we’ve been the leader in international educational programs and experiences designed to foster such understanding. Through language learning, cultural exchange, academic studies, and educational travel, we create immersive experiences that challenge biases, open minds, and pave the way for a more understanding world.
 



  





 You’ll find our 115 offices in some of the world’s greatest cities, filled with smart, driven people who push each other to be better every day. Yes, we have technology, finance, and even sports with our own professional cycling team – and we have an insurance company. But it’s what we do with these resources –building understanding, breaking down barriers, and creating a better world – that makes all the difference.
 



 Learn more at https://ef.com

title: Backend Engineer - User Platform
description:
We’re looking for a Backend Engineer II to join the User Platform (UP) studio, part of Spotify’s Platform Mission.
   

  

 User Platform is responsible for Spotify’s Customer Identity and Access Management (CIAM) capabilities - the foundation that connects users with Spotify and Spotify with its users.
   

  

 We build and operate the systems that store and serve user account data in a way that is compliant, reliable, cost-effective, and ensures data integrity. Our work powers many of the core services that enable Spotify to deliver seamless access to the audio experiences enjoyed by over 700 million users worldwide.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Design, develop, and deploy backend services and APIs that power Spotify's user management systems.
* Collaborate with different cross-disciplined teams on complex problems.
* Maintaining business-critical Spotify user data pipelines, ensuring high availability, stability, and adherence to SLAs.
* Embrace and promote sound engineering practices and contribute to a culture of high-quality, scalable, and reliable systems.
* Actively contribute to our learning culture by sharing knowledge and mentoring other engineers.
* Leverage AI to improve our systems, automate tasks, and drive business impact. We believe in "AI Fluency" and expect our engineers to be knowledgeable and willing to learn and apply AI to their work


 Who You Are
   

  

* You are a seasoned backend engineer with a proven track record of designing, building, and operating distributed systems.
* You have a T-shaped skill set, with deep expertise in Java backend development and a desire to learn and contribute to related areas like data engineering.
* You are a proactive collaborator who can operate across the stack and are not afraid to learn new skills to unblock yourself and your team.
* You are an expert in modern Java development, with practical experience in building and optimising high-traffic, highly available backend services. Knowledge of Scala and/or C++ is a plus.
* You have proven experience in systems architecture, data analysis, and building resilient distributed services.
* You believe in operating across the entire stack and can learn the skills needed to unblock yourself and your team.
* You have a passion for learning new technologies, including AI, and are keen to apply them to solve business problems.
* You are an exceptional communicator, capable of translating complex technical concepts for both technical and non-technical stakeholders with clarity and precision.
* You are an inclusive colleague who thrives in a collaborative, agile environment.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London, United Kingdom or Stockholm, Sweden.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Javautvecklare Stockholm
description:
*Vill du som systemutvecklare bidra till ett bättre samhälle genom smarta tekniska lösningar?* 




  





 Tillsammans med engagerade kollegor bygger du lösningar som effektiviserar vården, stärker samhällsfunktioner och förbättrar vardagen för tusentals människor. Som Javautvecklare hos oss blir du en viktig del av våra agila teamleveranser och arbetar nära både kollegor och kund. Vi har långsiktiga uppdrag inom till exempel offentlig sektor, telekom och energi, där du får möjlighet att skapa verklig nytta för många. Läs mer här.
 



 Hos oss finns ett starkt fokus på kunskapsdelning och utveckling, både tekniskt och som team. Du kommer att arbeta i en Java-miljö med ramverk som Spring Boot, Angular, React eller Vue, och med tekniker som Kubernetes, Git, Maven eller Gradle samt testning med JUnit eller Mockito. Vi arbetar agilt och har väl etablerade CI/CD-flöden som stödjer våra leveranser.
 



  





**Vi tror att du har:** 



* Minst 6 års erfarenhet av Javautveckling
* Goda kunskaper i Java och Spring Boot
* Erfarenhet av unit- och integrationstestning (exempelvis med JUnit eller Mockito)
* Vana av Git samt byggverktyg som Maven eller Gradle



  





**Det är ett plus om du också har erfarenhet av:** 



* Molnplattformar, container-orkestrering eller frontendramverk
* Konsultuppdrag inom offentlig sektor, telekom eller energi



  





**Att jobba på Sopra Steria** 




 Vi växer tillsammans, delar kunskap och har roligt på vägen. Hos oss får du arbeta i spännande projekt på en flexibel arbetsplats med schyssta förmåner. Hos oss är det viktigt att kunna växa i sin roll, och vi avsätter tid för lärande och certifieringar och har ett starkt community för kunskapsdelning. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss här!
 



  





**Rekryteringsprocessen** 




 Vi behandlar ansökningar och kallar till intervju löpande. I rollen ställs höga krav på både kompetens och säkerhetsmedvetenhet. Inför en eventuell anställning genomför vi bakgrundskontroll, och vid intervju behöver du kunna uppvisa giltig legitimation.
 



  





 Processen består av tre intervjuer, personlighet- och logiktest, referenstagning samt bakgrundskontroll. Denna kombination ger oss en bred och rättvis bild av dig, och ger dig möjlighet att visa din kompetens och potential från flera perspektiv.
 



  





 Har du frågor om rollen? Kontakta gärna
 **Hanna Korell** 
 på hanna.korell@soprasteria.com.

title: Development Engineers to TRATON Group R&D
description:
TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation - Let´s make a difference together. Find out more: www.traton.com
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

 We now wonder if you would like to be a part of the mission to transform transportation together and create the future of sustainable transport solutions? With over 8,000 people working in the R&D department at TRATON Group today, we are continuously looking for skilled Development Engineers within various technical fields!
   

  

 We are collectively creating a larger talent pool of potential candidates that we intend to match with a specific role as soon as available. Interviews will be conducted regularly, and we will reach out to you if a matching position becomes available where we will then introduce you to a hiring manager. If we do not reach out to you within a reasonable time then no position could be matched to you, which is why we always encourage you to apply to other interesting positions you find within the TRATON brands.
   

  

 If you would like to be in our talent pool, apply today and we will schedule an interview with you if we find a match for you!
   

  

**This recruitment process is handled by Scania for TRATON Group R&D with positions situated mainly in Södertälje, Sweden.**

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
At MedHelp Care, we’re shaping the future of workplace health management. As a leading Nordic B2B SaaS company, we build intelligent AI-powered platforms that help organizations create healthier, more efficient, and resilient workplaces.
 



  





 Our platform leverages advanced health data analytics and machine learning to detect early signals of health risks, enabling companies to take proactive, preventive action. With predictive insights and a focus on wellbeing, we help organizations care for their people while improving overall performance.
 



  





 We are on an exciting growth journey, expanding our impact and shaping the future of workplace health. We’re now looking for a Fullstack Engineer who thrives in a fast-paced product environment.
 



  





**The Role and the Team** 




 Join our innovative and collaborative cross-functional team dedicated to transforming healthcare through technology. As a Fullstack Engineer, you'll work across the stack. From modern APIs to clean frontend experiences, and play a key role in shipping features that matter.
 



  





***Some of your main responsibilities will include:***



* Design, develop, test, and ship features in our core B2B SaaS platform.
* Involved in full lifecycle development, from idea to production.
* Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and fellow engineers.
* Support and improve our CI/CD pipelines and DevOps workflows in AWS.
* Actively participate in code reviews, architecture discussions, and team rituals.



  





 In our team, you'll have the opportunity to work in a supportive environment that encourages continuous learning and growth. Collaborate with talented professionals who are passionate about technology and its potential to make a difference. Contribute to projects that have a meaningful impact on users and the community.
 



  





**About you** 




 To succeed in this role, you are a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment and loves collaborating in a small, skilled engineering team. You’re driven by impact, curious about applying AI and new technologies, and communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
 



  





***Technical skills we appreciate:***



* Proficient in C#/.NET Core
* React + TypeScript skills
* Comfortable working with relational databases (preferably PostgreSQL)
* Familiarity with containerized development (Docker) and Kubernetes
* Experience deploying applications using modern CI/CD pipelines
* Skilled at integrating REST APIs



  





*In this recruitment, we are collaborating with Safemind, and all applications will be processed through them.*

title: Mjukvaruutvecklare/Funktionstestare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Gedigen arbetslivserfarenhet i Java-utveckling med Eclipse
* Erfarenhet av radiofrekvens-utveckling och RF-test, inklusive tolkning av data från signalgeneratorer, spektrumanalysatorer och oscilloskop
* Förmåga att bygga upp CI/CD-flöden med automatiserade regressionstester på flera nivåer, från enhetstest till systemtest, med Java som utvecklingsspråk
* Vana att arbeta med Jenkins-pipelines för automatisering
* Kompetens inom inbyggda realtidssystem utvecklade i C++
* Väl insatt i Git och Atlassian-sviten för versionshantering och samarbete


**Meriterande**
* Kunskap om FreeRTOS
* Erfarenhet av Embedded Linux
* Förståelse för eller erfarenhet av FPGA-utveckling


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 03-12-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: AI/ML Engineer
description:
***Redpill Linpro är ett företag med djupa rötter inom Open Source och arbetar med de senaste tekniska lösningarna inom våra kärnområden DevOps, API & Integration, Analytics och Cloud. Vi har några av Nordens tyngsta experter inom Azure, AWS, Apache Kafka, Linux, Kubernetes, PostgreSQL, för att nämna några exempel. Vi arbetar med åtaganden och utvecklingsprojekt i många olika branscher i Sverige, Norge och Danmark.***
 Vi letar nu efter en AI/ML Engineer till vår Data & Analytics-enhet. I de här rollen kommer du att spela en central roll i att fortsätta utveckla vårt erbjudande. Du kommer att arbeta med kunder som redan kommit en bit på sin resa mot att bli datadrivna och hjälpa dem att utveckla moderna lösningar med hjälp av de senaste teknikerna inom AI och Analytics. Som AI/ML Engineer förstår du att grunden i varje sådan satsning är en säker tillgång till relevant data och det är din roll som konsult att hjälpa våra kunder på den resan. Du måste därför njuta av att både vara hands-on, använda en whiteboard och utmana kunderna, dig själv och det team du arbetar i.
   

  

**Vi letar efter dig som har erfarenhet av följande:**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet som AI/ML Engineer eller motsvarande
* Relevant akademisk utbildning
* Kunskap om maskininlärningsmodeller och generativ AI
* Erfarenhet av Databricks, Spark och Kafka
* Erfarenhet av utveckling i Python samt SQL
* Erfarenhet av visualiseringsverktyg som Power BI, Qlik eller Tableau
* Erfarenhet av uppsättning av cloud-infrastruktur i AWS, GCP eller Azure
* Erfarenhet av Infrastructure as Code, med verktyg som t ex Terraform
* Erfarenhet av automatiserade releaseprocesser, DevOps och CI / CD
* Erfarenhet av datamodellering (strukturerad och ostrukturerad data)
* Erfarenhet av agil utveckling
* Erfarenhet av konsultrollen
* Flytande i svenska och engelska


 Vill du vara med på resan? Sök tjänsten nu – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Redpill Linpro is the leading provider of Open Source services and products in the Nordics. We are located in seven offices with a mission to share knowledge and best practices for a more open society.
   

  

 We are passionate about open solutions, open business models, and an open society where we work together for maximum benefit to everyone. We have got some really skilled co-workers here at Redpill Linpro, particularly within our main areas: API management, development, IT operations, data analytics, customer experience, cloud, DevOps, and automation.
   

  

**May the Source be with you!**

title: Data Engineer Insight
description:
**Data Engineer**
**Do you want to build the next datamodels för AI, ML and datawarehouse empowered solutions?**
 Nexer Insight, a Microsoft partner, invites you to embark on a journey as a Data Engineer where you'll be part of an extraordinary team, engage in exciting activities, work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits. We are committed to leveraging cutting-edge technologies such as Databricks to drive innovation and excellence in everything we do.
   

  

**Do you want to be our next ”Data Ninja”?**
 Joining Nexer Insight means becoming a vital part of a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. Here, you'll have the chance to engage with cutting-edge technology from Microsoft, Databricks, and DBT Labs, as we proudly partner with them. We're committed to investing in our employees, empowering them to excel in their fields through professional growth and development opportunities. Collaboration is at the heart of our approach, as we value teamwork and foster a vibrant community spirit. Dive into the exciting intersection of data engineering and data science, where you'll have the chance to make a meaningful impact.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and operate scalable and robust analytical models.
* Set up data platforms and build data models and pipelines.
* Innovate and collaborate with customers to learn and find new business opportunities.
* Become a champion in best practices regarding architecture, data quality, reliability, and performance.
* Be at the forefront of the latest data engineering technology.
* Leveraging Microsoft Azure services for data processing, transformation, and storage.
* You propel progress and ensure delivery by constructing top-tier cloud solutions, empowering our customers to adopt a data-driven approach.


**Based on our criteria för the role, we expect you to have:**
* Hands-on project experience of working with cloud solutions (Azure, AWS or GCP)
* Minimum 2 years experience working with ETL tools such as Azure Data Factory, Databricks, DBT, Snowflake
* Experience with Data Lakes or Lakehouse Architecture
* In-depth knowledge of SQL syntax
* Experience in information and dimensional modelling
* Good knowledge of DevOps processes with git version control and CI/CD methodology
* Speaks English and Swedish fluently


**Meritorious** 
**experience:**
* Platform modernisation
* Tabular cubes and DAX
* Data Vault modelling
* Experience in setting up Azure, AWS or GCP Infrastructure

title: Staff Software Engineer
description:
**The Company**
 PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.
   

  

 We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.
   

  

 We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.
   

  

 Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 Come join the PayPal Wallet Mobile Engineering team. We’re embarking on a multi-year journey to revamp wallet functionality adding valuable new features that will impact PayPal’s 350 plus million users. You will be contributing to the foundation of PayPal’s wallet for years to come guiding the team on design and architecture and contributing to the implementation that powers that functionality. Collaborating with product owners, architects, and developers of downstream systems, you will set the technical direction of the mobile wallet functionality. Your contributions will help ensure PayPal is the preferred choice for digital payments.
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Essential Responsibilities:**
* Acts as a project or system leader, coordinating the activities of other engineers on the project or within the system
* Determines the technical tasks that other engineers will follow
* Actions result in the achievement of customer, operational, program or service objectives
* Proactively improves existing structures & processes
* Exercises judgement in reconciling diverse and competing priorities (time, quality, complexity risk) to identify optimal solutions to problems
* Notices patterns and condenses repetition into densely meaningful generalized solutions
* Collaborates with management to set/improve standards for engineering rigor
* Trusted to represent PayPal, Inc to the outside world via interactions with partners, customers, or industry organizations


**Expected Qualifications:**
* 5+ years relevant experience and a Bachelor’s degree OR Any equivalent combination of education and experience.


**Additional Responsibilities And Preferred Qualifications**
 We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Staff Engineer with an in-depth understanding of iOS architecture, to join our dynamic fintech engineering team. Your expertise will drive the development of innovative features, ensuring high performance, scalability, and security in our iOS applications.
   

  

 As a Staff Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and implementing crucial features, shaping the iOS architecture that underpins our digital payment solutions. This position requires a strong technical background, excellent problem-solving skills, and a passion for staying at the forefront of mobile technology.
   

  

**Your day-to-day:**
**As an iOS Software Engineer, you will:**
* Be a strategic thinker and problem solver.
* Define and execute the mobile technology roadmap.
* Build and lead high-performing mobile engineering teams.
* Drive innovation and experimentation in mobile development.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver world-class mobile experiences.
* Mentor and coach senior engineers and foster a culture of innovation and experimentation.
* Partner effectively with product and engineering leadership to oversee mobile architecture and design.


**What you need to bring:**
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field.
* 8+ years of hands-on mobile development experience (iOS).
* Experience in designing, developing and delivering software and/or platforms (libraries)
* Deep expertise in mobile technologies and architecture.
* Solid understanding of Cocoa Frameworks
* Strong object-oriented skills including design, coding and testing patterns.
* Familiarity with database technologies (SQL and NoSQL databases) and ORM frameworks (Hibernate, JPA).
* Ability to design scalable, reliable, and maintainable software systems.
* Thorough understanding of XCode
* Proven ability to lead and influence cross-functional teams.


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience with mobile payment technologies and integrations
* Proficiency in Swift, Objective-C, or React Native.
* Familiarity with continuous integration (Jenkins), application monitoring (Crashlytics and fabric.io), mocking tools (Appium and Apiary), build tool development and enhancements, using unit testing and cucumber tests for functional tests
* Familiar and comfortable with iOS technologies, the tradeoffs, and emerging design patterns.
* Knowledge of mobile performance optimization techniques.
* Strong ability to influence and inspire teams.


 PayPal does not charge candidates any fees for courses, applications, resume reviews, interviews, background checks, or onboarding. Any such request is a red flag and likely part of a scam. To learn more about how to identify and avoid recruitment fraud please visit https://careers.pypl.com/contact-us.
   

  

 For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.
   

  

**Our Benefits:**
 At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset-you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.
   

  

 We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com
   

  

**Who We Are:**
 To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx
   

  

**Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.
   

  

**Belonging at PayPal:**
 Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.
   

  

 Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.
   

  

 We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.
   

  

 REQ ID R0132783

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

**Your role**
 The purpose of the role is to assist Clients in adopting and exploiting Cloud Platform automation and engineering. You will be part of Capgemini’s Cloud & Infrastructure Services (CIS) unit, focusing on project and consulting services in the Nordics. Our goal is to offer customers comprehensive cloud solutions with industry-specific expertise, advanced cloud technology, and global resources. We offer a variety of services to our customers, from strategic advice to project implementation.
   

  

*In this role you will pay a key role in:*
* Engaging closely with architects, clients, partners and other business units to design and implement innovative and competitive solutions across cloud
* Working on large scale, technically challenging projects


**Your profile**
* Hands on experience of Azure, AWS and/or Google platform features and capabilities, ideally with vendor certifications
* Hands on expertise with Kubernetes and Docker Containers
* Hands on automation and orchestration tooling experience with tools such as Packer, Terraform, Cloud Formation
* Good awareness and expertise in Core Cloud Networking and load balancing
* Hands on exposure and understanding of automated build pipeline, continuous integration and continuous deployment – and strong experience of implementing tools that underpin these practices
* Good command line skills in at least one of the following Go, Ruby, Python.
* Experience of Linux
* Knowledge of DevOps concepts, aspects and tools
* Demonstrable experience of delivering in Agile environments
* Full working proficiency in both Swedish and English


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* A vibrant environment where you can grow through continuous learning and professional certifications, collaborate with a global network of experts, and stay at the forefront of the latest technologies
* The freedom to make decisions, manage your time, and work independently - fostering creativity, innovation, and job satisfaction
* An extensive benefits package, including parental benefits, occupational and flex pension, private insurance, preventive healthcare, and more
* A variety of social and wellness activities, from sports and health programs to cultural events and art initiatives, designed to bring employees together and enrich work life


 As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, and background checks may be carried out as required.
   

  

 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: Big Data Engineer
description:
As Software Engineer ODS you will design, implement, and maintain data streaming solutions by consolidated data from multiple master data sources and provide it to customer facing products (e.g. Report manager, Liquidity Overview). SQLDB based.
 



 · Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define architecture requirements and ensure smooth integration of Kafka into existing systems.
 



 · Optimize performance and scalability of Kafka clusters.
 



 · Develop monitoring tools to ensure high availability and reliability of the streaming infrastructure.
 



 · troubleshoot and resolve any Kafka-related issues
 



 · Competence profile
 



 · +5 years in software engineering with a focus on operational data storage systems.
 



 · A bachelor's or master's degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
 



 · Proficiency in SQL database management and optimization.
 



 · Experience with designing large-scale data processing systems.
 



 · Strong understanding of data integration techniques from multiple sources.
 



 · Knowledge of ODL/EAP frameworks and Confluent Platform applications is a plus.
 



 · Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to troubleshoot complex issues swiftly while proposing effective solutions.
 



 · Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills for articulating technical concepts clearly to stakeholders.

title: Kubernetes Engineer
description:
Vi söker nu en Kubernetes Engineer till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm.
   

  

 Som Kubernetes Engineer blir du en viktig del av vårt plattforms- och driftteam, med fokus på att etablera och vidareutveckla vår Kubernetes-baserade infrastruktur. Du ansvarar för att plattformen är robust, säker och optimerad för moderna applikationer, med fokus på både stabil drift och framtida skalbarhet. Du arbetar nära utvecklingsteam, infrastruktur och säkerhetsfunktioner, och är involverad i allt från design och implementation till övervakning, felsökning och förbättringar.
   

  

**Vem är du**
 Du är en tekniskt driven person med erfarenhet av containerbaserad infrastruktur och ett starkt intresse för att bygga stabila, säkra och automatiserade plattformar. Du trivs i komplexa IT-miljöer där höga krav på tillgänglighet, säkerhet och prestanda är en självklar del av vardagen.
   

  

 Vi tror att du har god erfarenhet av att arbeta med Kubernetes i produktion, samt vana vid verktyg för Infrastructure as Code såsom Ansible och Terraform. Du har också kunskap om CI/CD och containertekniker som Docker, samt en god förståelse för säkerhet, övervakning och loggning i distribuerade system. Erfarenhet av samarbete mellan drift och utveckling, i en DevOps-kultur, ser vi som en självklarhet.
   

  

**Mer information och ansökan**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit. Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller +46 730 821 230 alternativt Artan Bitiqi: artan.bitiqi@nexergroup.com eller +46 723 61 28 44.
   

  

 Läs mer om tjänsten och ansök här.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar. Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
   

  

 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Seniora ingenjörer
description:
**Titel**
 Ingenjörer som formar framtidens stridsflyg
   

  

**Ingress**
 Är du tekniskt driven och vill vara med och utveckla spjutspetsteknik som gör skillnad? På Saab söker vi engagerade ingenjörer som vill bidra till ett säkrare Sverige och en säkrare värld.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som ingenjör hos oss på System Test Design för stridsflyg kommer du att vara en viktig del av ett team som utvecklar och testar avancerade system. Vi arbetar agilt och använder internationella standarder (ISO/IEC 15188, INCOSE och ISTQB) för att säkerställa korrekt kvalitet.
   

  

 Vår sektion erbjuder många olika karriärvägar. Du kan specialisera dig inom ett område som inbyggda system, programvaruutveckling, testutveckling eller gruppledning – eller bli en bredare expert. Vi värdesätter samarbete, ömsesidig support och en öppen och prestigelös kultur.
   

  

 Vi arbetar med banbrytande telekrigsystem, där vi använder elektromagnetisk strålning och datasignaler för att analysera och skydda mot hot. Vårt fokus ligger på tidig testning och att använda tidigare erfarenheter för att minimera risker i projekten.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Du är utbildad civilingenjör, högskoleingenjör eller systemvetare, eller har motsvarande kompetens. Erfarenhet av inbyggda system (C++) eller programvaruutveckling (Java) är meriterande.
   

  

 Vi söker en person som trivs i team, tar ansvar och är engagerad i att utvecklas.
   

  

 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

 Bli en del av vårt team och gör verklig skillnad.
   

  

**Vad du blir en del av**
 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 22 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här
